Name: Business Analyst
Description: About the Job:NewDay USA is looking for a top notch business mind and modeler to support our operations and business development initiatives. Working closely with Sales, Finance and Human Resources and reporting to the Vice President of Business Development, the Business Analyst will be responsible for financial planning, human capital modeling, business operation planning and process improvements.Responsibilities:Effectively solve and communicate critical operational and financial mattersContribute to the development and execution of NewDay USA’s strategic goals and objectivesPrepare and analyze financial statements and provide key business insightsEstablish and monitor human capital performance, goal development and incentive structureIdentify opportunities for NewDay USA to leverage cross-functional strengths and improve and streamline operational functions in the companyCreate business models and reporting capabilities for various branches of NewDay USAProvide analysis and execution of capital marketsAbout You:You have 3-5 years of finance and operational experience with a proven track record of creative problem solvingYou have a Business, Accounting or Finance degree and a M.B.A. or are currently enrolled in a M.B.A program from a top tier accredited UniversityYou have advanced skills in SQL and ExcelYou are experienced with change management in a high growth environmentYou are an analytical and decisive decision maker with the ability to prioritize and communicate tactics necessary to achieve organizational goalsAbout NewDay USA:NewDay USA is looking for extraordinary team members to help change the lives of America’s veterans and to be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Maryland. Our team is comprised of some of the most diverse, talented and energetic people anywhere in the financial services industry. They are also driven to excel by the exceptional opportunities for growth and advancement that are unique to NewDay USA. Join one of the fastest growing companies voted a “Top Workplace for Career Training” by The Baltimore Sun, and a “Top Entry Level Employer” by CollegeGrad.com.

Name: Senior Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Description:Leidos is looking to improve and advance our organization. Our program is focused on the delivery of end-user centric IT technology solution to our Centers of Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) customer where we are challenged to provide ongoing innovative and seamless experience while using CMS systems, applications and solutions, provide proactive secure development of IT integrations, concepts, and designs across the CMS enterprise and integrate end-user computing devices, conference room technology, infrastructure hardware and software, and user applications into a streamlined and seamless experience across the CMS user base. We foster a positive end-user experience while ensuring protection of the data.AS Senior Business Process Analyst you will work closely with the program management and technical and engineering teams and provide evaluation and the analysis of the hardware and software products in support of the customer. Review trends and analyze the data to discover patters, identify areas of concerns and prioritize action steps to optimize program performance. You will work closely with external and internal customers to streamline the hardware and software ordering, delivery, tracking and reporting.Primary ResponsibilitiesList daily duties and/or specific job responsibilities. Under the direction of the Program and Deputy Program Manager, you will be responsible, to include, but not limited to:Management of the program Product Catalog.Streamline the ordering, tracking and continuous monitoring and reporting on the hardware and software delivered under the program.Work closely with the internal functional support teams and identify areas of improvements to deliver goods to the customer in the most efficient manner and act as a liaison between the program and the sub-contractors and vendors.Conduct evaluation of the software licensing currently on the program, identify different licensing options that will lead to cost reduction and faster delivery.Research best business practices within and outside the organization, collecting and analyzing process data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on increased productivity and cost reduction. Basic QualificationsList the "must have" MINIMUM requirements to be considered for the position and ensure minimum quals fall within the minimum Leidos job code requirements. Example: Bachelors' Degree with 6 years' of applicable experience or 4 additional years' of experience in lieu of degree. Must be able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI Clearance. Must have 2+ years JAVA experience. Bachelor's Degree with 8 - 12 years of relevant experience or Master's with 6-10 years of prior relevant experience. Additional years of work experience in lieu of degree is acceptable.Working knowledge of Leidos processes and systems.Experience working in Cognos, CostPoint, Hyperion and other financial and procurement systems.Experience in financial analysis and forecasting, review and analysis of invoices within contract and purchase order parameters.Experience with cost estimating, cost/benefit analysis, and the ordering, managing and tracking processes and procedures.Proficiency in budget and cost analysis tools.Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas and pivot tables.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated experience in developing and delivering briefings for senior and executive managers and facilitating high level technical discussions.All candidates supporting the CMS programs must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior in order to be considered.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Resource 1 is seeking a Business Analyst for a contract position in Elkridge, MD. The initial term of the contract is 6 months, with expected extensions through all of 2019. The initial project is a modernization and re-write of existing clinical software, leveraging the latest web technologies (Angular/.NET Core). Candidate should have at least 5 years of experience working as a Business Analyst in support of software development projects. Individual will be responsible for working with users at various levels to gather and write business/functional requirements to be provided to the development team. Individual will create documentation including user stories, requirements, wireframes, use cases, workflows, etc. Axure will be used for wireframing on the project, so any prior experience would be a plus. Individual will join a team responsible for the full life cycle development of web-based medical/clinical software. Would prefer a candidate who has experience working in an Agile environment and is familiar with writing Agile artifacts and participating in Agile ceremonies. Prior healthcare industry experience would be a plus, but is not a requirement. Candidate must possess excellent communication/documentation skills, energy and enthusiasm for technology.  Qualified applicants can e-mail resumes to  (see below) for consideration. Technical Skills: Business Analysis, Technical Liaison, Agile, User Stories, Business Requirements, Functional Requirements, User Stories, Web Applications, SDLC, MS Office, MS Excel, MS Word, and Axure.Get alerts to jobs like this, to your inbox.Create Job AlertSimilar Jobs You May LikeSee More JobsSee AllSuggested searches

Name: Business Analyst
Description: MAXIMUS is a leading operator of government health and human services programs and has partnered with state, federal and local governments to provide critical, high quality health and human service programs to a diverse array of communities. Operating under MAXIMUS's founding mission of Helping Government Serve the People® since 1975, MAXIMUS Federal Services is entirely focused on helping government agencies run programs cost-effectively and serve program constituents with improved outcomes. By being a responsible steward for government programs, we help the federal government deliver on its promises through our people, process and technology. Our focus is always on outcomes and results that connect citizens more effectively with government services. Job Summary: The Business Analyst provides recommendations based on business analysis and subject matter expertise to the operations management team for improving operational performance. The Business Analyst provides guidance and recommendations for performing processes and procedures and provides direction for achieving production goals. Essential Job Duties: *Coordinates with business users to define business processing activities, data availability, and requirements, to implement operational procedures *Collects, analyzes and interprets both qualitative and quantitative data; performs analytical and root cause analyses *Utilizes management and planning tools (flow diagrams, affinity diagrams, gap analysis, and selection/prioritizing matrices) *Facilitates discussions between operations teams, technical teams and business stakeholders on business processes and procedures *Creates user acceptance test scripts/test plans *Assists in efforts to provide training, communication, presentations, and project documentation/artifacts *Assists in training and standards development among peer business analysts *Supports the project manager and/or product owner and stakeholders on project priorities *Assists in maintaining project deadlines, budgets, and schedules *Develops and produces reports as needed *Performs other duties as assigned Education and Experience Requirements: *Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university required; equivalent work experience will be considered in lieu of degree *At least three (3) years of experience in related field required *High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Outlook *Experience with Microsoft Project, Vision and SQL *Proficient with software quality assurance and release management processes *Ability to analyze current situations with new requirements to synthesize into creative solutions Additional Requirements, as per contract/client: *United States Citizenship Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience. May have additional training or education in area of specialization. Develops solutions to a variety of problems of moderate scope & complexity. General application of concepts & principles. Contributes to the completion of organizational projects & goals. Frequent use and general knowledge of industry practices, techniques, and standards. Applies knowledge and skills to complete a wide range of tasks. Communicates on complex or sensitive issues or drafts such responses for supervisor or manager. A committed and diverse workforce is our most important resource. MAXIMUS is and Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. MAXIMUS provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disabled status. - provided by DiceBusiness Analyst

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Summary  CRISP is seeking a business analyst to join the Point Solutions team. The incumbent will join a team responsible for developing and delivering mission critical new software applications for the CRISP Health Information Exchange. The ideal applicant will be an excellent verbal and written communicator, will have an attention to detail, the ability to solve coordinate with a number of stakeholders, manage priorities, and the ability to identify and resolve problems. The business analyst plays a critical role on the software development team to ensure delivered products meet requirements.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Contribute to the design and development of software products that assist in facilitating the exchange of health information for healthcare professionalsTake ownership of business processes and product development and overall success of the serviceWork with different stakeholders and subject matter experts from different backgrounds (clinical, business, technical).Assist in coordination of the Agile/Scrum development process.Assist QA in the reviewing test cases and ensuring appropriate test coverage.Participate in full software lifecycle solution and learn new technologies.Help your team solve difficult problems - learning from and sharing with team members.Assist in the transition of developed services to operations teamsManage priorities and requests in an organized mannerUnderstand how services are being used and use that knowledge to inform future developments Qualifications  To perform this job successfully, the incumbent must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Ability to quickly understand and take ownership of business processes and product development plansAbility to work with many different stakeholders and subject matter experts from different backgrounds (clinical, business, technical)Experience with Agile/Scrum methodology, particularly with the Product Owner role and with writing User Stories and Acceptance CriteriaExperience with writing and executing test casesTake pride in delivering software that meets the client’s needsKnowledge of Agile incremental development methodsDemonstrated ability to work well on a diverse teamJira and Github experience preferredFamiliarity with Microsoft Azure preferred Company DescriptionAnchor Technical Services specializes in servicing organizations that are in need of highly skilled technical resources in the fields of Engineering, Environmental, Healthcare, Information Technology, and Science. Additionally, ATS works with qualified candidates to arrange career placement within leading organizations in a variety of technical sectors. What’s more, Anchor Technical Services delivers unparalleled customer service with an emphasis on follow through and attention to detail to ensure ideal placements and your long-term success.

Description: job summary: Built on 30 years of expertise, Randstad Professionals provides specialized recruiting services to a diverse portfolio of clients ranging from Fortune 500 companies to small and mid-sized businesses spanning multiple industries. The Business Analyst will work internally with an interdisciplinary team of economists, statisticians, actuaries, software and developers.qualifications:Job Requirements: Candidates should understand and have a proven track record with: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, engineering, or business related field. Experience in lieu of degree will be considered.Three (3) years of data analysis experienceThree (3) years of experience in business analysis practicesMarketing, product launch, product roadmap experience helpfulStrong oral and written communicationSQL and data driven analytical application experienceWork with the Product Owner to develop detailed requirements, user stories, and business rules for application development in an Agile frameworkParticipate in User Acceptance, QA, and Regression TestingAssist in operation, refresh, and production support of production systems Qualified candidates should send a resume to adam.daley@randstadusa.com  At this time, our client is only able to consider candidates that are eligible to work for any employer in the United States without sponsorship.skills: SQLEqual Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.Company Description:Randstad is a $22.5 billion global provider of HR services and the second largest staffing organization in the world. From temporary staffing to permanent placement to in-house, professionals, search & selection, and HR Solutions, Randstad holds top positions around the world and has approximately 31,100 corporate employees working from its nearly 4,700 branches and in-house locations in 40 countries.  We are a company built on a deep network of expertise that crosses industries and geographies. We recognize that talent comes in different forms, that every business has its unique challenges and opportunities. And our recruiting experts are skilled at marrying talent and business—identifying the ideal professionals for an organization’s culture and its teams, its needs and its goals.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst job in Crownsville, Maryland. Business Analyst Job Overview:Analyze the business processes, procedures, organizational structure, etc. in order to identify problems and determine solutions that reduce risk and increase organizational effectiveness and efficiencyInteract with the business partners and internal and external stakeholders,including executive staff, to understand organizational processes and needsPerform detailed gap analysis to identify gaps between system functionality and organizational needs and document findingsWork with stakeholders to identify project scope, project objectives, project success criteria and project deliverablesCollaborate with project stakeholders and technical staff to elicit and document requirements (e.g. business, functional, non-functional, process models, etc.)Present solutions to business stakeholders and facilitate the iterative refinement of requirementsWork with the Development and Quality Assurance teams to ensure functional requirements are unambiguous and testableAssist in the creation of test cases to verify the system and validate the system and processes are functioning as expectedCreate and maintain project logs to ensure that issues and risks are documented and tracked to resolution; monitor project schedules and follow up with leadership with concerns related to project milestones and timelinesBusiness Analyst Job Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college in Business or Public Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a related fieldFive (5) years of experience as a business analyst or closely related experience in the analysis of student information systems.Exceptional analytical skills in order to properly interpret business needs and translate into functional requirementsAbility to work in both collaborative and independent environmentsAbility to work under aggressive timelinesAbility to communicate effectivelyThorough knowledge of the principles and practices of planning, developing, implementing, and maintaining student information systemsThorough knowledge of processes, methods, and techniques utilized to analyze and evaluate business operations and document requirementsKnowledge of programming concepts and various Systems DevelopmentLifecycle (SDLC) methodologies.Working Knowledge of Web Accessibility Guidelines 2.0.Fluent language skills and written communication ability.Experience with developing reports, documents, presentations, etc.Experience creating record documents, to include agendas, project logs, meeting notes, etc.Proficiency with MS Office, to include strong competency with Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook.Proficiency in developing and presenting, both verbally and in writing, technical information and presentations to non-technical audiences. FSR is nationwide, award winning, multi-industry workforce solution organization. FSR has grown from providing healthcare professionals to government healthcare facilities to providing talent acquisition, recruiting, and specialized human resources for the private and public sector.  FSR matches talented individuals to organizations to create mutually beneficial, sustainable partnerships.  We invite you to join our team and grow with us!  FSR is a women-owned, minority, small business based out of Maryland. Ask about our Working Warriors Program.  FSRpeople.com

This experience should be in the healthcare, human services, public sector, or information technology fields.  We are looking for 5 to 10 years of business analysis and a bachelor's degree in a related field is preferred.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionKaimetrix is seeking a professional Business Analyst to support the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Requirements Analysis Office (RAO) in Fort Meade, MD. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: The Business Analyst will be part of a team that develops diagrams, process maps, and other graphics necessary to capture and describe the Research and Analysis process for the DISA RAO. Conduct analysis of existing agency policies and instructions in order to develop agency requirements management policies and instructions. Conduct ad-hoc reviews of all aspects of the DISA R&A process and document shortcomings and identify opportunities for process improvement. Develop business process descriptions containing scope, objectives, success factors, activities, procedures, roles and responsibilities and needed tools. Desired Skills: The Business Analyst should have prior experience with most or all of the following: Project Management Institute’s Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK)Systems Engineering’s Systems Engineering Book of Knowledge (SEBOK) The Business Analyst must be highly skilled in the use of system engineering processes, architecture frameworks, modeling languages, and tools, including: DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)Systems Modeling Language (SysML)Business Modeling Process Notation (BPMN) And the Business Analyst must have experience with IT management tools such as: IBM’s Rational DOORS Next GenerationNo Magic’s MagicDrawMicrosoft SharePointRequirements:Bachelor’s Degree or higher in related field5+ years of experience in required skills/expertiseSecret Clearance or higher Company DescriptionKaimetrix is an ISO 9001:2015 certified small-business federal contractor. Our focus is on delivering top technical talent to solve our customers most challenging requirements. With a culture of continuous improvement, we consistently achieve results that exceed expectations. Our professional services include: IT Service Management, Infrastructure Operations, Cyber Security, Software Development, IT Strategy, and Talent Acquisition/Consulting.  We focus is on continuous improvement resulting in the highest-level of customer satisfaction. This commitment is the foundation of our corporate culture and the following values:  People are the most critical success factor  Process must evolve through incremental changes  Improvements must be measurable based on performance  Continuous improvement is critical to long term success

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OverviewIMPAQ International, a growing and dynamic research and analytics firm, provides high-quality technology solutions in support of research and impact evaluations, policy analyses, survey research, organizational development, technical assistance and consulting services to U.S. and international government agencies, foundations, and the private sector. IMPAQ’s mission is to bring together exceptional people to develop innovative and rigorous approaches to evaluate the real-world impact of social policies and programs. IMPAQ offers five locations: our Corporate Headquarters in Columbia, Maryland, rated one of America’s Best Small Cities; Downtown Washington, D.C., Boston, Massachusetts, a Bay Area office in Oakland, California and Seattle, Washington. IMPAQ has a diverse and collegial work environment.Job ProfileThe Business Analyst will assist in the development, implementation, and support of new technology solutions and web applications that will allow government organizations to improve their services to their client base. The ideal candidate will have experience interacting with all levels of business and technical subject matter experts in the elicitation, modeling, documentation, and management of data driven business and system requirements. In addition, the ideal candidate will have experience implementing business process reengineering techniques, as well as understand human centered design processes and protocols. The analyst will use their extensive knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle and business analysis best practices to facilitate requirements sessions and communicate clearly and effectively with end-users, senior business managers, and other team members. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. Employment-based visa sponsorship (including H-1B sponsorship) is not available for this position. ResponsibilitiesCollect information (e.g. business requirements, system requirements, and technical requirements) from various stakeholders to assist in the development of new technical solutions and web applicationsLead requirement gathering activities including business process modeling and process mappingTranslate basic information into technical specifications in order to build systemsBuild data collection and analytic tools for workforce and human services domainsSupport testing of the new system, documenting progress and statusProvide high-level analysis and support related to statutory requirements and compliance QualificationsEducation, Knowledge, and ExperienceB.S. degree in Computer Science or Information Technology, or equivalent work experience and agile development principles strongly preferredResearch, review and recommend technical tools and products that promote an effective and efficient teamElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysisCritically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high‐level information into details, abstract up from low‐level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsProactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: functional requirements, business requirements document, use cases, GUI, screen and interface design mockupsUtilize experience in using enterprise‐wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies Experience acting as a liaison between clients and development teams providing business/functional requirements within the Workforce and/or human services sector3 to 5 years of experience providing consulting services to government clients for the development of Technology SolutionsExperience implementing business process reengineering techniques, including proven experience in process and data modeling, developing business and functional requirements, and performing gap analysisExperience in supporting human centered design projects for workforce and/or human service clientsExperience solving complex Technology Solutions project management issues in accordance with federal laws, regulations, and proceduresPractical knowledge of and experience with supporting project management office operations regarding the management, planning, implementation, and operations and maintenance of enterprise projectsExperience gathering, testing, deploying, and maintaining large-scale projectsSkillsAbility to work within different Technology Solutions infrastructuresExcellent attention to detail, problem solving, and organizational skillsAbility to communicate effectively in verbal and written form with internal teams, management, and clientsAbility to meet deadlines, work within and across teams, and with external clientsLabor/workforce industry experience highly preferredAgile SDLC experienceRequirements management and design skillsWorkflow and use case design experienceAgile storyboarding development and facilitationAtlassian JIRA requirements Name: Business Analyst
Description: Abacus Solutions Group needs a Business Analyst for a new multi-office IT project request (and eventual IT project) regarding document management throughout the design, planning, procurement, and execution of construction and maintenance projects. This resource will elicit requirements from representatives of all affected offices; gather relevant documentation; investigate, analyze and document the relevant business process; then work with other OIT staff to investigate potential solutions and facilitate the project approval process. This resource will then serve as the business analyst and tester on the IT project team which includes requirements gathering, analysis and documentation, developing and maintaining wire frames, developing flow charts, developing and executing test plans, and taking meeting minutes. It is possible that there will be spin-off IT requests or IT projects from the initial analysis effort that this person will need to participate on. Additionally, this resource could be asked to participate on other IT requests / IT projects that require the same skills and experience if his/her workload permits. - provided by DiceBusiness Analysis, Testing

Job Req ID:  11959 Business AnalystClassified Title: Business Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/04/PD  Starting Salary Range: $57,544-$65,000  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: M-F, 8:30am - 5:00pm  Exempt Status: Exempt  Location: 04-MD:School of Medicine Campus  Department name: 60006026-Tech Transfer  Personnel area: Academic and Business Centers General summary/purpose: This position reports to the Manager of the Commercialization Strategy Group (CSG) within Johns Hopkins Technology Ventures (JHTV). In this role, the Business Analyst supports the technology commercialization activities of JHTV by performing assessments of new technologies and venture opportunities to assist with planning the management of new venture opportunities. Specific duties & responsibilities:Reviews and understands technologies disclosed to Johns Hopkins University.Searches relevant prior art to determine the ability to patent this new technology.Analyzes commercial factors such as market size, developmental risk and competitive environment to turn new technologies into commercial products.Conducts in-depth research to understand the structure of specific industries and identify potential partners that can assist in commercialization efforts.Develops a working knowledge of the technology commercialization process, formation of new companies, and the process for obtaining funding for the new companies.Supervisory responsibility: ~2 to 4 student interns Minimum qualifications (mandatory): Bachelor’s degree in a biological or engineering related science required. Minimum 2 years’ experience in marketing, preferably life and physical sciences technologies or working in industry in a similar function. Preferred qualifications: Advanced degree preferred, but not required, in a related science or a MBA with experience in biotechnology fields. Special knowledge, skills, and abilities:Able to understand complex technologies and develop concise, clear synopses of the technologies.Resourceful with data gathering, manipulation of large data sets, and quantitative analysis.Able to think creatively about potential commercial applications for new technologies and how JHTV might facilitate commercialization.Able to deal well with unstructured problems.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Detail oriented and highly organized. The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly. During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Great Business Analyst opportunity in downtown Baltimore.  The Business Analyst will have responsibility for the implementation of the new CRM Salesforce platform. They will work closely with a 3rd party integrator and all stakeholders within the organization. Data analysts will independently develop analysis and design reporting capabilities. They will also monitor company performance and identify improvements for capturing information and integration between all reporting systems. The data analyst must be work well in group settings and have the skill set to turn data concepts into measurable results.  Responsibilities  Interpret and analyze key performance indicators to provide meaningful standardized reports  Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and consistency  Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems  Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets  Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance metrics to locate and correct code problems  Work with management to prioritize business and information needs  Locate and define new process improvement opportunities  Work with multiple teams within the company to provide critical information to be used in strategic decision making  Be willing to be a crucial member of world renowned organization  Requirements  5+ years working experience as a data/business analyst or similar field  Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques  Have a general understanding of business including marketing, sales, operations, and finance  Highly skilled in Microsoft Office, especially Excel, including pivot tables, creating datasets, and analyzing large data pools  Extensive knowledge of CRMs (e.g. Salesforce.com) is required  Industry knowledge of medical/healthcare services industry is preferred or relatable industry  Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy  Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings  Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or other relevant field  MBA or Masters degree is not required but may be beneficial

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Business Analyst Job Location: Greenbelt, MD and other unanticipated locations across the US Job Description: Gather and document Business and Functional Requirements; Translate and communicate Business/Functional Requirements Documents (BRD/FRD) to the technical team for development; Provide reporting both verbally and in writing to groups of varying knowledge levels and at varying degrees of specificity. Work with development team for system defects/enhancements; Coordinate user acceptance testing with end users; Research production problems/errors; Analyze and assess end-user issues and recommend corrective actions; Perform quality assurance testing of production fixes and new releases; Participate in the production and maintenance of Functional Requirements Documents, interface specifications, business process flow diagrams, and agency performance goals; Create UML diagrams using MS Visio. Job Requirements:Education requirement: Bachelor’s degree in any subject from any accredited college or university. In lieu of bachelor’s degree, the employer will accept two additional years of experience in job offered. Experience Requirements: One year of experience in the job offered or as a Business Analyst. Experience as a Business Analyst must include one year of experience in business and functional requirements gathering and translating BRD/FRD to the technical team for development; conduct quality assurance/user acceptance testing, and MS Visio to create UML diagrams.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OverviewDo you have a passion for designing software from the ground up? Are you comfortable working with a range of projects submitted from a global user base? Do you get a thrill from working with customers to gather requirements and translating them into functioning software? If your honest answer to each question is an enthusiastic YES, then we wants to hear from you.  14 West, an Agora company, is looking for a Software Business Analyst to work within a fast-paced, mature agile team. As a Software Business Analyst you will assist with all phases of the software development life cycle including gathering and translating business requirements into functional development specifications, following development tasks to completion, and investigating ways to optimize current functionality and processes.  Being a part of this team means living and breathing product goals and fierce collaboration with teammates, colleagues, and customers. The first step to success in this role is working hard for your teammates and earning their trust. They expect all members of the team to display initiative, take responsibility for managing their own work, and be open to guidance and insight from those around them.ResponsibilitiesServe as a liaison between the customer community and the software development team to gather and communicate requirements which help define and verify product design.Coordinate, schedule, and lead customer-focused collaboration sessions.Elicit, analyze, validate, and manage the true needs of their customers.Translate business and user requirements into functional requirements via customer collaboration.Create design mocks using wireframe and prototyping software.Conduct follow-up conversations with customers, as needed.Serve as a resource for engineering and quality assurance; clarifying requirements throughout the software development life cycle.Maintain and update requirements as needed throughout the software development life cycle.Create and distribute release notes to customers and internal stakeholders.Work closely with the Product Manager to document product vision and roadmap.Support internal staff by communicating and training new functionality prior to releases.Work with Quality Assurance to record and/or review test plans, test scenarios, and test cases results in preparation for regression testing and product validation.Communicate clearly and effectively, face-to-face and in writing.Be a team player and be glad to pitch in to help teammates in need.Work until the job is done and done well. QualificationsExperience and EducationBS in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related.2+ years of previous experience in software development business analysis.Previous experience in related software development life cycle activities or support.A fundamental understanding of Agile software development.Skills & AbilitiesInnate curiosity about processes, systems and user functionality.Demonstrated ability to analyze problems and understand the necessary components of a solution through analysis, planning, evaluation of cost/benefit, testing and reporting.Maintain a sense of urgency and hold others accountable to get working software out the door.Be ready to report on projects formally and on-the-fly.Ruthless team collaborator, ready to give and receive constructive feedback.If interested, please submit a resume and cover letter to the link provided.About 14 West 14 West is the business services arm of The Agora Companies, and has offices in Baltimore City, Maryland and Delray Beach, Florida.  The company exists to provide the support of seasoned, passionate and inspired administrative professionals. So while they focus on growing their enterprises through new ideas, we ensure the well-being of their workplace.  14 West prefers to fill its offices with people who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box. People who will come in and already start asking: “How can we do this differently, and not just differently, but better?” ­­  The company tends to look for individuals in search of more than just a paycheck.

Name: Entry Level Business Analyst
Description: The Business Analysts role is to assist with the plan, design, develop, and launch efficient information systems and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. Using both business and technical skills, the Business Analyst works directly with customers to identify business requirements with sufficient detail and clarity to proposals for solutions. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments. Develops innovative and creative output based on interpretation and analysis.  Provides design and documentation at an application or function capability level.  Identifies/documents how applications and systems interact to support business processes.  Assesses, applies and projects the impact of system changes on users and internal and external clients or stakeholders.  Uses knowledge of systems and industry requirements to develop or modify complex information systems.  Writes test plans and test cases to ensure changes which are made to the application meet client needs and that application integrity is maintained.  Conducts a variety of tests such as system, integration, readiness and acceptance tests. Ensures changes made by programmers are correct.  Conducts tests using client data to be certain client needs will be met.  Qualifications:  Masters Degree in Information Technology.  Must have good knowledge in Finance, Banking, Insurance, Retail or Healthcare and/or benefit administration is a plus.  Excellent writing/documentation, communication, analysis and organizational skills required.  Strong aptitude in both business and technology.  Self-starter with excellent organizational and time management skills.  Fast learner, quality consciousness and committed to deadlines.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: I. General Summary Under limited supervision of departmental leadership, gathers and analyzes prospective user needs. Develops and maintains an information system to efficiently meet the department’s needs. Documents fact finding results and makes formal presentations of findings, recommendations and specifications. Demonstrates fiscal responsibility in the preparation and adherence to the capital and operational budgets.  II. Principal Responsibilities and Tasks The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by personnel so classified.  1. Prepares various reports, surveys and special projects as requested by senior management or for miscellaneous requesting agencies in accordance with departmental procedures. Reviews transactions from various reports and prepares summary reports for reporting organizational activity by the appropriate UMMC Ambulatory department in accordance with departmental procedures.  2. Develops and implements procedures to perform tasks required by internal management or outside regulatory agencies.  3. Prepares timely and accurate monthly reports for Ambulatory Services and other outpatient centers. Prepares and issues reports and trending analyses, and performs evaluations of new programs/ventures.  4. Applies accounting and auditing principles and techniques to ensure that data integrity, internal controls, and audit trails are maintained throughout applications.  5. Reviews Ambulatory centers denial data. Provides ambulatory local center leadership with denial information and works with the teams to implement denial mitigation strategies. Collaborates with UMM Managed Care representatives to leverage payer relationships.  6. Organizes and maintains major reports and schedules containing complex data from multiple sources.  7. Trains operations managers and administrative staff on reading reports and interpreting financial data.  8. Supports preparation and maintenance of capital equipment, operational and salary budgets.  9. Performs professional work related to special projects involving report creation, financial analysis, or financial management, as required.  10. Interprets and implements variance reports for leadership team. Identifies areas of billing insufficiencies and proactively conducts audits regarding reconciliations, batching and patient billing. Supports outpatient centers with process improvement initiatives.  11. Communicates with various departments in order to resolve various budget-related financial problems and procedures. Assists manager/analyst in understanding variances from budget and assists in documenting new issues that impact the current and future budget development.  12. Informs and educates staff as to the cost of operating the department. Organizes and stores management information in electronic and paper formats for future retrieval. Develops tools and methods to gather source data for entry. Performs necessary programming as required.  13. Prepares and distributes routine internal reports to ensure accurate revenue capture and compliance, adherence to operational standards and achieving overall center health. Responsible for implementing continuous education process for departments which will teach the importance of charge capture and advise departments of effective procedures for completing the charge capture function.Protects departmental confidentiality with regard to sensitive data access and maintains an objective demeanor in conducting all duties related to business systems analyses.

Name: Senior Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Description:Leidos is looking to improve and advance our organization. Our program is focused on the delivery of end-user centric IT technology solution to our Centers of Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) customer where we are challenged to provide ongoing innovative and seamless experience while using CMS systems, applications and solutions, provide proactive secure development of IT integrations, concepts, and designs across the CMS enterprise and integrate end-user computing devices, conference room technology, infrastructure hardware and software, and user applications into a streamlined and seamless experience across the CMS user base. We foster a positive end-user experience while ensuring protection of the data.AS Senior Business Process Analyst you will work closely with the program management and technical and engineering teams and provide evaluation and the analysis of the hardware and software products in support of the customer. Review trends and analyze the data to discover patters, identify areas of concerns and prioritize action steps to optimize program performance. You will work closely with external and internal customers to streamline the hardware and software ordering, delivery, tracking and reporting.Primary ResponsibilitiesList daily duties and/or specific job responsibilities. Under the direction of the Program and Deputy Program Manager, you will be responsible, to include, but not limited to:Management of the program Product Catalog.Streamline the ordering, tracking and continuous monitoring and reporting on the hardware and software delivered under the program.Work closely with the internal functional support teams and identify areas of improvements to deliver goods to the customer in the most efficient manner and act as a liaison between the program and the sub-contractors and vendors.Conduct evaluation of the software licensing currently on the program, identify different licensing options that will lead to cost reduction and faster delivery.Research best business practices within and outside the organization, collecting and analyzing process data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on increased productivity and cost reduction. Basic QualificationsList the "must have" MINIMUM requirements to be considered for the position and ensure minimum quals fall within the minimum Leidos job code requirements. Example: Bachelors' Degree with 6 years' of applicable experience or 4 additional years' of experience in lieu of degree. Must be able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI Clearance. Must have 2+ years JAVA experience. Bachelor's Degree with 8 - 12 years of relevant experience or Master's with 6-10 years of prior relevant experience. IMPAQ’s mission is to bring together exceptional people to develop innovative and rigorous approaches to evaluate the real-world impact of social policies and programs. IMPAQ offers five locations: our Corporate Headquarters in Columbia, Maryland, rated one of America’s Best Small Cities; Downtown Washington, D.C., Boston, Massachusetts, a Bay Area office in Oakland, California and Seattle, Washington. Name: Business Analyst

From refining how you manage your contingent workforce to strengthening your employer brand to recruit top talent, our integrated talent solutions drive the business results you need.  As an industry leader, we draw upon decades of experience to design innovative tools, products and processes. We develop competitive practices that position organizations for growth and we deliver the insight needed to succeed in todays global marketplace.Job DescriptionThe Allegis Group Services (AGS) Business Analysts are responsible for supporting the reporting and analytics functions for our programs. They provide consultative guidance in terms of strategy and process to our program directors and coordinators by leveraging our tools and best practices. Analysts are often assigned to multiple programs and must be available to support the program in many different capacities. ResponsibilitiesProvide consultation to program operations teams responsible for delivering reports to our customersAdminister program operations reports where necessary and produce corporate level reporting to support management decision making, business development, finance, and marketingConduct analysis of data trends within programs and summarize findings to support program director decision makingDocumentation of reporting requirements, procedures and business rules necessary to support the delivery of reporting and analytics for our programs and customersWill be client-facing and are expected to introduce clients to ACUMEN and to present our Business Analytics products/packaging to client sponsorshipDevelop reports necessary to manage Program Office performance and meet customer needs. Work with technology partner to develop these reports, including technical scope, design, development, debug and user-acceptance testing.Troubleshoot problems with creating reports to support reporting requirements, data and metric definitionsCompile and deliver data used to measure overall Program performance as well as individual Supplier performance on a daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly basisReconcile and manage data quality as necessary to resolve discrepancies and/or reconcile results. Utilize data to identify potential system issues.Learn to utilize the reporting tools utilized by our programs and provided by our Technology partnersGather questions and requirements from business stakeholders and translate into technical requirements.Work with program operations teams to ensure that data is being entered correctly and work with technology partner to develop enhancements which will improve reportsQualificationsIntermediate to advanced knowledge of MS ExcelMust have strong technical, organizational and communication skills (both written and verbal).Must have strong problem solving capabilities, strong analytical skills, be flexible and able to handle multiple tasks concurrentlyEducationB.S. in Computer Science, Business, or related major or equivalent business experience. Additional InformationAs a workplace, we focus on relationships with each other, our clients and our candidates - in fact serving others is one of our core values. We support open communication and recognize that giving constructive criticism can be even harder than receiving it. We appreciate the fearless and the passionate, who force us to be better. Everything we do sits on a pillar of diversity - diverse perspectives, backgrounds and ideas drive innovation and make us successful.  See what its like to work at AGS by searching #LifeAtAGS on any social network.  AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law. Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: OverviewPublishing Services, an Agora company, is looking for a Jr. Business Analyst to join their team in Mt. Vernon, Baltimore, MD.  The Jr. Business Analyst will support cross-functional teams throughout The Agora Companies by gathering technical business requirements and providing direction to their business for system enhancements and projects. This role will require duties such as research, documentation, implementation, end-user training, assistance with system updates, communication across Publishing Services and the Agora, development of project request forms, coordination with ACS (external software vendor), and development of user’s guides.  The Jr. Business Analyst will also be responsible for assisting the Product Director with product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle including: gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision, and working closely with the Client Services team, Publishing Services Management team, Software Development team and The Agora users to ensure customer satisfaction.  You can learn more about Publishing Services by checking out their“Workplace Highlight” blog post.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with stakeholders to keep projects on-track.Gather and develop business requirements from fellow team members, other Publishing Services application teams, and coworker.Analyze tradeoffs between usability and system requirements.Translate business requirements for both technical and non-technical support teams clearly and concisely.Produce documentation for QA team to assist in development of test cases.Translate technical requirements for end user documentation and assist in production of audience-appropriate training material.Prepare user-friendly release notes to accompany each release.Verify development tasks have been completed according to requirements before release.Carry out duties according to priority and submit necessary documentation in a timely fashion with respect to explicit and implicit deadlines.Communicate status updates throughout development cycles.Develop and maintain clear standards for requirements documentation.Complete Operational Reviews. QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.Experience developing, supporting and maintaining software applications.Comfortable assisting with the design efforts of large software development initiatives.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Creative thinker.Excellent teamwork skills.Positive attitude and a constant learner.Expectations of the Jr.Business Analyst, ERP Product Team:Constant learner, questioning everything in a relentless pursuit of better technical solutions to complex problems.Strong work ethic, willing to go above and beyond to solve the problem and help the customer realize success.Great interest in the latest marketing/software trends and in what they can achieve for their business.Clear and concise communicator regardless of medium or purpose.Punctual in all tasks and duties.If interested, please submit a resume and cover letter to the link provided.About Publishing Services At Publishing Services, they create, customize, and manage the enterprise applications suite that support The Agora Companies. Their passion and progressive ingenuity has shaped and strengthened the marketing industry at large.  Their inventors address the diverse needs of their clients through customization and innovation. If a vendor's technology doesn't quite cut it, they’ll buy it, break it down for parts, and rebuild it. When the technology simply does not exist, they build it from scratch. Publishing Services’ proprietary systems have changed the landscape of media and digital marketing, elevating their clients as industry front runners.  The support teams at Publishing Services partner with clients to implement and manage their applications, optimizing key business functionality and allowing them to focus on making money...hand over fist.  Here, you can explore a cutting-edge market, discover your career, and accumulate extensive experience with the best in the business.

including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Stansberry Research is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to complement a team of data professionals within the Business Intelligence and Analytics team. This is an exciting role that will have a direct impact in building a world class BI/DW ecosystem.  The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for working with stakeholders to identify and define key performance metrics (KPIs) and translate them into actionable reports and dashboards. This role is also responsible for data discovery, ad hoc analysis, building analytic models and star schema design. You will have an opportunity to use the latest cloud technology platforms in Data Warehouses, BI Tools, ETL Tools, etc.ResponsibilitiesIdentify business needs and define KPIs by collaborating with end users, stakeholders and technology.Identify and understand source data systems and become an expert of data sources and flows.Identify and develop all mappings and data movement within the Stansberry Holding’s eco-system.Build and maintain data visualizations, reports and dashboards using Tableau Desktop or other BI Visualization toolsAdminister user permissions, create and maintain user and data security setup on all tools within the BI suite.Serve as a primary point of contact for Production Support issue resolution and respond to request in a timely fashion.Work directly with end-users for requirements gathering, training, on-boarding.Review, assess current state and identify improvement opportunities and best practice recommendations.Qualifications5+ years working with BI tools (such as Business Objects, Cognos, Microstrategy, SSRS, or QlikView).Proficiency in either Tableau or Looker5+ years experience in relational database concepts with hands-on experience with MySQL, PostGRES, Oracle, or MSSQL.BS/BA in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field.5+ years experience with dimensional and star schema modeling techniques.ETL, API or data scripting experience a plus.Marketing and/or SAAS analytics experience a plus.About Stansberry Research Stansberry Research is a subscription-based publisher of financial information and software, serving millions of investors around the world. Their business is guided by two simple principles: They strive to give their customers the information they'd want if their roles were reversed.They only publish analysts whose advice and strategies they'd want their own families to read and to follow.They believe in offering a range of opinions. Experienced analysts, with their own unique investment strategies and philosophies, lead their franchise brands. As a result, they do not promote a single, unified view of the markets, but instead they publish a mosaic of opinions, recommendations, and strategies. This multi-franchise approach gives their work far greater breadth, creating more diverse opportunities for their subscribers. Their franchises are linked, however, by a continuous commitment to risk management and a contrarian approach to identifying investment opportunities. Across all of their franchises, they focus on investments that are unloved, ignored, or unknown. It is in these situations where having an informed perspective gives their subscribers the best risk-to-reward opportunities. Learn more about Stansberry Research at http://stansberryresearch.com

Name: Business Services Analyst
Description: Classified Title: Business Services Analyst  Working Title: ?????Business Services Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/04/PD  Starting Salary Range: $58,695 - $80,625  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: M-F, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm  Exempt Status: Exempt ???????  Location: 33-MD:Johns Hopkins Bayview  Department name: 10002783-SOM DOM Bay General Admin Chairmans Off  Personnel area: School of Medicine *General summary/purpose:** + The Business Services Analyst position assists in project management, data/financial analysis, and reporting for the Department of Medicine (DOM), Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center, and School of Medicine. The position aligns operations to meet the needs of patient care while also supporting the educational and research missions of the Department.  + The DOM maintains approximately 185 inpatient beds at Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center, discharges approximately 11,000 patients and sees more than 70,000 ambulatory visits. With a direct reporting relationship to the Sr. Administrator/Assistant Dean and project accountability to Division Administrators and the Finance/Operations Administrator, the Business Services Analyst is responsible for performing project management, research, and financial analysis in support of the Chairman?s Office, Vice Dean Program Office, as well as Divisions within DOM. The position will supervise interns and residents as well as coordinators and analysts. This job includes presentation and participation in executive meetings and leadership forums.  + The incumbent will coordinate at the Divisional, Departmental, and Hospital Executive level to advance the tripartite mission of research, education, and patient care. Sharing expertise and collaborating closely with a broad spectrum of individuals across the Hopkins enterprise, this position has a far-reaching impact touching patient care, business development, system integration, data analytics, quality improvement, and more. *Specific Duties/Responsibilities:***Project Development/Management:** + Work with education, clinical, and research areas to meet operational targets and to help develop, implement and maintain performance improvement initiatives  + Assist in the development of business plans, financial analyses, market analyses, and other service analysis to evaluate and support strategic initiatives.  + Develop, implement and evaluate comprehensive project plans for identified opportunities ? establish project goals, objectives and outcomes as needed, secure leadership support and endorsement, determine a project timeline to accomplish identified goals with milestones, consider organizational needs by identifying necessary resources, and work with a team of project participants  + Lead, facilitate, and support meetings and committees as appropriate.  + Work collaboratively with physician, nursing and care management leadership to provide effective, efficient and patient-centered care in the Department?s clinical care settings  + As applicable, assist in the development of volume, expense and capital budgets?and corrective action and performance improvement plans?for the DOM?s Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center operations. *Hospital Operations:** + Routinely assess patient throughput (e.g., length of stay, discharge barriers, procedure/test delays, boarding hours, and referring hospital wait times) and, in partnership with Case Management, Social Work, Nursing Administration and faculty leadership, utilize process improvement methodologies to enhance and optimize performance and desired outcomes.  + Engage and partner with other department administrations to develop inter-departmental throughput and capacity solutions for Department of Medicine patients.  + Assist faculty and nursing leadership in the communication and implementation of existing, new and/or revised administrative policies, guidelines and protocols involving patient care operations.  + Assist in the coordination of Department response to internal disasters (e.g., flooding, facilities issues, etc.) and external emergencies (e.g. severe weather, international incidents, etc.)  + Assist in the development of strategies to maintain and improve compliance with all appropriate regulatory and accrediting bodies (e.g. HSCRC, The Joint Commission) in all areas of operations, including personnel management, facilities, workflows, etc.  + Ad hoc/short term operational projects as assigned. *Reporting/IT Systems:** + Utilize Outpatient/Inpatient Operation systems and databases (EPIC, IDX, DataMart, Case Mix, CCUB, Medvitals) to develop and maintain clinical reports detailing access performance, volumes, provider utilization, patient satisfaction, financial performance, safety, compliance and other pertinent decision support tools and management reports. Communicate reporting trends to Departmental and Divisional Leaders.  + Prepare timely and accurate ad hoc analysis/reports such as staffing level, physician productivity, space utilization, access/capacity, new clinical practice initiative, business plans, professional fee and hospital billing assessments and payer mix etc.  + Make recommendations to leadership based on data that is analyzed and develop presentations *Financial Management/Analysis:** + Assist in the development of the annual Departmental budget and projection. Responsible for assisting in control of established budgets by overseeing loading of budget, reconciling budget information and changes, and extracting and analyzing financial data to assist in management of the Department?s JHU & JHB operations  + Perform comprehensive financial analysis relating to business plans to improve Departmental financial effectiveness and compliance with JHU, JHH and/or agency regulations and restrictions  + Assist in developing business plans for revenue enhancement or new lines of business. Evaluate the financial performance of existing programs and create financial performance reports. Develop financial proposals for programs as needed.  + Oversee Joint Administrative Agreement including monthly transfers, reconciliation and changes.  + Partner with at least one Division to maintain consistency of financial practices as well as implement/maintain a vision of overall DOM financial goals.  + Expectation to investigate and perform constant financial improvement/projects in areas of interest.  + Train new and existing finance staff to complete monthly financial reporting requirements and the annual budget. Meet routinely with Department and Division leadership to share financial results, discuss areas of improvement, and propose plans to address weaknesses. *Minimum qualifications:** + Bachelor?s degree in Health or Business Administration required. Master?s degree preferred.  + Three years health care experience required.  + Understanding of medical operations and physician practice management as usually acquired in 3-5 years applicable experience.  + Working knowledge of information systems, revenue cycle, communication skills, plus advanced analytical ability to identify data requirements, and analyze complex reports. *Special knowledge, skills, and abilities:** + Requires the ability to compile, analyze and interpret patient /physician data.  + Must be able to present and format data and technical information for various end users.  + Must have solid project management skills.Ability to make independent judgments and to act on decisions on a daily basis.  + Ability to work for long periods of time without direction.  + Ability to prioritize own work and work of staff as needed.  + Ability to work with flexibility on several tasks simultaneously and to meet various concurrent deadlines.  + Excellent communication and customer service skills with the ability to work well under pressure.  The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu . For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. *The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.** During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. *Equal Opportunity Employer** Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled. *EEO is the Law**Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm Equal Opportunity Employer: Johns Hopkins University is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria. The university promotes affirmative action for minorities, women, disabled persons, and veterans.
