Name: Data Analyst
Description: Classified Title: [[Data Analyst]]  Working Title: [[Data Analyst]] ?????  Role/Level/Range: ATP/03/PB  Starting Salary Range: [[$43,101 - $59,202]]  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: [[Monday - Friday 8:30a - 5:00p / 37.5 hours per week]]  Exempt Status: Exempt ???????  Location: 05-MD:School of Public Health  Department name: 10001064-Registration and Records  Personnel area: School of Public Health *General Summary/Purpose** The Data Analyst is responsible for the management of all Student Information System (SIS) data related to the Office of Records and Registration. The Data Analyst is the office?s functional lead and serves as the unit?s liaison to technical staff both within the School and the University. The Data Analyst recommends and formulates solutions to business problems through existing and developing technologies. Additionally, the Data Analyst assists with the integration of CMN data with the other functional and technical leads within PH to ensure the integrity of student data as reported for the School of Public Health. *Specific Duties & Responsibilities** + Provides general direction, support and training to all staff within the unit and in the Schools academic departments on matters related to the student registration system; uses problem-solving skills to maintain system efficiency and effectiveness.  + Serves as functional resource to Public Health Student Affairs technical staff  + Partner with PH and University programmers to ensure that required functionality serves the needs of the School.  + Prepare and document records and registration process decisions; follow change management procedures.  + Report and submit system problems and enhancements to Student Affairs IT Director.  + Monitors production calendar to ensure processes and jobs are scheduled and run  + Develop test plans and procedures, perform tests, document test results, and make appropriate recommendations in conjunction with technical staff at PH Student Affairs IT as well as University IT.  + Identify, prioritize, reports and document systems defects; determine path of resolution.  + Analyze current system configuration, evaluate existing functionality within the registration system and propose modifications for efficiency on standards and procedures.  + Recommend and document systems enhancements.  + Generate standard and ad hoc statistical reports and data extracts.  + Use university reporting tools to produce reports for faculty, academic coordinators and administrative offices;  + Generate standard and ad hoc statistical reports and data extracts, including required federal reporting  + Provide supervision for the Registration Data Coordinator.  + Troubleshoot PH individual staff questions and problems regarding the registration system.  + Serve as the School?s functional representative in university wide subgroups for the establishment of new business procedures.  + Recommend and implement most efficient reporting solutions for the office accordingly.  + Performs related duties as required  + Use the university?s reporting tools to produce reports for faculty, academic coordinators and administrative offices; *Minimum Qualifications** Bachelor?s Degree required and three (3) years of related experience in data/registration processes and procedures required.  Additional education may substitute for required experience and additional related experience may substitute for required education, to the extent permitted by the **_JHU Equivalency Formula_** : _30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job. *_ *Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities** + Experience in ensuring data integrity and procedural documentation  + Knowledge of registration procedures at the School and University levels.  + Knowledge of School?s academic/administrative policies and procedures.  + Knowledge of JHU SIS system highly preferred  + Ability to prioritize projects, meet deadlines and work effectively under pressure.  + Ability to exercise independent judgment.  + Good written and interpersonal communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization (student, staff, faculty, deans, directors and department?s chairs).  + Ability to mentor and train junior staff and monitor their assigned tasks.  + Ability to maintain excellent collaborative working relationships with internal/external functional and technical staff.  The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu . For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. *The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.** During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. *Equal Opportunity Employer** Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled. *EEO is the Law**Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm Equal Opportunity Employer: Johns Hopkins University is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria. The university promotes affirmative action for minorities, women, disabled persons, and veterans.

Name: IT Business Analyst

Evolver’s core competencies are infrastructure, application development, cybersecurity, cloud, end-user support, data analytics and legal services.We believe our employees are key to our success and continued growth. We attract and retain our diverse workforce by promoting a work-life balance with generous and flexible time off, competitive compensation and benefits, and a commitment to professional development. When you join Evolver, you join a community of talented and dedicated individuals whose abilities, skills, and actions contribute to the success of the company.Evolver is seeking a IT Business Analyst to work in Bowie, MD.**Applicant must be a U.S. Citizen and qualify for a Public Trust clearance level position**Work with multiple data center clients and customers (i.e. project and application teams) to perform all aspects of complex “server” delivery (build) management oversight activities upon request.Perform change management activities associated with installation and decommissioning of server infrastructure, including storage, software licensing, and costs analysis.Perform some incident management support and follow up on an as needed basisIdentify, mitigate, and prioritize, manage and resolve project issues, constraints, dependencies and risks.Perform some incident management support and follow up on an as needed basisPerform technical requirements analysis, costs analysis, and schedule analysis.Facilitate resolution of technical issues. Capable of interpreting technical information and present/speak the information to different audiences (business owner, etc.), conveying the message in a way the audience can understand.Bachelor’s Degree required. Will consider years of experience and/or certifications in lieu of Degree.Must have 5+ years of IT project management or IT operations support experienceMust have experience & knowledge of data center infrastructure, including blade server and virtualization technologiesMust have experience in IT service delivery, including ITIL conceptsMust have experience with Enterprise Change Management tools such as RemedyAssociates or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering/ Information Systems or related discipline (In-Lieu-of the education 10 years of total full time IT experience required)Ability to communicate status and issues to senior management and project stakeholdersCoordinate cross-org team, proactively ensuring that teams are "in sync" in terms of communication, schedules, issues, etc.Facilitate decision making with stakeholders, balancing the needs of different constituencies and facilitating consensus.Champion and key contributor of continuous improvement of IT best practices, using innovative ideas to increase effectiveness of organization.Understanding of process, potential issues, consequences of changes during Software Development LifecycleAbility to gauge severity of a technical issue REQUIRED: MS Visio, Excel, Project, and PowerPoint (including architecture diagrams, process diagrams, swim lanes, database management, cost analysis, and pivot tables)At Evolver, we foster teamwork, growth, individuality and entrepreneurialism. As a part of the Evolver team, we actively promote a working and learning environment that supports a highly qualified workforce and a quality of work life that is based on trust and respect for all employees resulting in a healthy and trusting organizational culture.Evolver, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Name: BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description: Business Systems Analyst  Skip to main content Follow Us |Toggle navigationAbout UsLeadership TeamHeritageCultureGlobal PresenceCode of ConductCommunity OutreachCareer ProfilesJob PostingsSubmit your RsumMy favorites (0)My account-_selectjob _fctUpdateSelectionLabel  Business Systems Analyst Job Title Business Systems Analyst Reference Number************Business Unit Baltimore Aircoil Co. Job Location United States / Maryland / Jessup Job Category Information Technology Job Description Baltimore Aircoil Company is the global leader in sustainable solutions for evaporative cooling, thermal storage, and heat transfer equipment. The corporate headquarters is located in Howard County, Maryland, near Baltimore.  Our equipment is found in residential and commercial buildings to keep people comfortable, supermarket and cold storage warehouses to protect food and perishables, and industrial processes and power installations to improve efficiency and productivity. We are passionate about enhancing the quality of life through our technologies that reduce energy, water, and chemical usage. As a global leader, we are committed to a world of sustainable progress and enduring results. POSITION PURPOSE The Business Systems Analyst collaborates with other Business Systems Analysts to support/lead the implementation of global business initiatives. He or she serves as the liaison between the Global Business Systems team and other global business stakeholders. As liaison this person communicates across multiple levels ranging from business and functional leaders to software developers and production personnel.  The Business Systems Analyst assists in the facilitation of cross-functional meetings and discussions. Working with other GBS team members, he/she is also responsible for the creation and implementation of detailed functional specification and project plans in order to implement business requirements and drive business system process improvement efforts to completion.  Additional duties include: assists in facilitating continuous process improvement initiatives across functional areas to support internal and external business processes; and assisting with Helpdesk activities including report generation, data analysis and problem resolution. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIESWith supervision, principle accountabilities are:Business requirementsFocusses to meet customer objectives including on time delivery and qualityInterprets business requirements and translates them into functional specifications that can be used by the Global Business System teamDevelop and project manage schedules, resource plans, cost estimates and contingenciesConducts requirements review, coordinates / performs integration and UAT testingAnalyzes data and trends generated from Support Requests tracking system and recommends and leads business process improvement effortsImprovement of working processesDrive Process Improvement activitiesParticipates in efforts to create standard work flow for processes within the Global Business System organizationWorking Helpdesk activities including report generation, data analysis and problem resolution as well as provide instructions and training for IT related activitiesCommunicationActs as liaison between the Global Business System Teams and other business stakeholdersProvides periodic communications and presentations on project status and production issues, changes to all stakeholdersPERFORMANCE INDICATORSThere are no people reporting to this function. The Business Systems Analysts plays however an important role in the steering and guidance of all stakeholders involved in the projects that he/she coordinates.No grants of authority have been assigned to the Business Systems AnalystsThe Business Systems Analysts has multiple day to day contacts while executing his/her function:Members of the Global Business System TeamsAll BAC departments when providing:Training/Facilitating on process improvement techniquesResolving or providing guidance to business systems issuesAll persons participating in cross-functional teams including the User Group team3rd party suppliers of servicesKNOWLEDGE & SKILLSIs in possession of a Bachelor degree in information technology, engineering, business or a related field or has built up a minimum of 2 years of work experience in a similar function within a similar environmentOver 2 year of functional and working knowledge and experience in ERP business systems and project management implementation and Tier 2 Business Systems supportMicrosoft Office Tools (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint) proficientWith management direction, can steer, guide and follow up projects using project management skillsDemonstrated business savvy to work effectively with other business leaders to achieve key business and technology goalsCombines technical qualities with an open and enthusiastic communication style (verbal and written, at all levels)Is capable in presenting his/her ideas to all levels of the organization including Customers and other stakeholdersShows a pro-active attitude - likes looking for solutions to problems and steers others in continuously looking for improvementsDemonstrates change management skills: participate in group meetings, looks for process improvement opportunities Preferred Prior experience as a functional user within a PeopleSoft environmentProject Management foundationHas a high level of customer focus with the ability to identify and prioritize urgent requirementsA stress resistant person who's willing to help others and shift priorities as neededWORKING CONDITIONS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and walk up to 50% of the time. Working conditions include those of a normal construction environment, as well as standard hazards associated with installed HVAC equipment and rotating equipment. This position requires occasional lifting of up to 30 lbs, and travel of 10 - 20% of the time.  BAC is a division of Amsted Industries, a 100% employee-owned company. We offer a very competitive benefit package which includes medical, dental, life, and disability insurance. We also offer two retirement savings programs: (1) an Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP) which is fully company paid and (2) a 401(k) plan. Other benefits include 11 paid holidays per year, vacation time ranging from two to five weeks per year, tuition reimbursement, a wellness program featuring a fitness room at our corporate headquarters and much, much more. Baltimore Aircoil Company is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Name: Business Analyst IT - ETRM / CTRM products
Description: DescriptionPRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION Provide in-depth expertise to solicit functional and technical requirements for projects and/or on-going operations. Creates and assigns detailed tasks to subordinates. PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES - Provide application support to Constellation’s ETRM system (OpenLink Endur), including defect management, Issue analysis, application documentation and system training.  - Perform and manage team to provide functional expertise to elicit, document, and maintain business requirements and understand how they translate into technical requirements. Convey strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with complex technical problems.  - Facilitate communication across various organizational units and help resolve conflicting requirements. Resolve disagreements and conflicts constructively, knowing when to escalate and involve others.  - Maintain business acumen within own discipline or function. Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Title : Senior Business Analyst  Location : Baltimore, MD  Duration : 6+ Months Contract  The Business Analyst acts as a consultant and partner with the business community, EPMO, Program Manager, project teams and business partners to elicit clarify and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design from which solutions are developed. The Sr. BA is responsible for supporting, gathering data and defining (and/or redefining) business needs for new and/or enhanced products, services or optimized business processes. This position supports a high profile regulatory project, the EU General Data Protection Regulation ("GDPR").It will report into the program PMO and work closely with the Head of Privacy to meet with multiple business unit leaders and business process owners to document their high and medium risk systems and business processes.Although there will be standard questions, the BA will need to navigate the interview and draw out key information required to build a Record of Processing (RoP), and then conduct follow up sessions, as required.Previous experience working within the Financial Services industry a plus, but not required.Previous experience building, adding, maintaining and extracting data from systems and SharePoint sites are a plus.5 Year minimum experience required.This is both a technical and business position.The successful candidate should be flexible and able to move between both groups.Strong SharePoint design, Excel, MS Project, Visio and PowerPoint skills a strong plus.Must have DEMONSTATED gap analysis experience, mapping, have methodology of how to gather required information.Investment/finance experience, previous experience working on regulatory projects.High Level Excel Skills.Creating lists and pivot tables within Share point is preferred.While there is a lot of data, this position is business process driven and requires a senior level BA with a technical and business background.Ability to create professional level documentation that can be easily accessed and reviewed by regulators.

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst
Description: IT Business Systems Analyst  IT Business Systems Analyst  Return to Job Opportunities  Job Details  Level  Experienced  Job Location  Baltimore - Linthicum, MD  Position Type  Full Time  Education Level  4 Year Degree  Salary Range  Undisclosed  Travel Percentage  Undisclosed  Job Shift  Day  Job Category  Information Technology  Description  Versant Health bringing you Davis Vision | Superior Vision is a leading provider of vision and eye health solutions offering services to the full spectrum of the vision care marketplace, including employer groups, health plans, and government-sponsored programs. We deliver value to our members through our extensive access to providers and having the industry's broadest, most diverse networks. No other vision carrier comes close to the size, accessibility, and diversity we offer. We have built lasting relationships based on one foundational principle: our members are our highest priority. Every department embodies a member-centric approach to service.  We are an innovative company that is always looking forward and adapting our comprehensive portfolio of products to match -- and anticipate -- what our customers need. We are a true partner with our customers by leading and guiding them to make the best choice. Name: Business Analyst - Compliance
Description: NewDay USA is looking for extraordinary team members to help change the lives of America’s veterans and to be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Maryland. They are also driven to excel by the exceptional opportunities for growth and advancement that are unique to NewDay USA. Join one of the fastest growing companies voted a “Top Workplace for Career Training” by The Baltimore Sun, and a “Top Entry Level Employer” by CollegeGrad.com. The Business Analyst-Compliance (BA) provides essential analysis of documents, processes and systems to support compliance and the operational business units. The BA aides in bridging business needs with technology solutions once data information and document requirements have been identified. The BA consults with senior staff where clarification or exception to policy may be required and may provide practical guidance to less experienced staff. Name: Sr. Systems Business Analyst
Description: The Senior Business Systems Analyst utilizes a variety of elicitation techniques to effectively gather pertinent information to plan, design, develop, and launch business, financial, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. The BA must identify and create clear and concise alternative, constructive and forward thinking solutions for multiple business objectives and requirements. Recommended solutions will best fit the overall alignment with JHHC organizational goals. Solutions may include new applications, interfaces, architectures or process. The Sr. BA will be skilled in creating all supporting documentation and is able to create and utilize models and prototypes as required to solidify final requirements. The Sr. BA should be comfortable with both iterative/agile methodologies as well as traditional waterfall approaches to development. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, suability engineering and problem-solving skills to create final functional definitions ResponsibilitiesAbility to ascertain the true needs that will address tactical and strategic goals. He or she will be able to transfer information acquired from elicitation techniques into needed data and documentation. Statistics from other sources will be assessed and turned into usable information. The business analyst will be able to compile and report an easily understood projected vision to be implemented. Expert facilitation skills required.Must possess efficient analytical skills with proven ability to recognize patterns and create solutions for change in process workflow or reallocation of resources. Ability to both lead teams and work within teams to meet goals. Demonstrates a strong knowledge of one or more business areas and develops functional requirements and recommends operation process flows to meet business requirements and objectives.RequirementsEducation Bachelors degree in business. management, human resources, information systems, computer science, or another related field, or equivalent experience is required. A Masters degree in related field is preferred. Experience and SkillsMinimum of five years of experience working in a technology environment with mainframe, client server, or web based applications in the areas of requirements gathering, requirements definition and analysis, and business analysis, testing, or other general system support tasks. Additional experience should include project management and development skills through teamwork. Work experience should include roles as team member and team lead in a matrixed resource setting.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, ServiceNow
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITIONUnder independent direction, the Sr. Business Analyst, ServiceNow assists in the development and delivery of technical and process oriented solutions and recommendations in support of the production environment. This includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of current system requirements, translation into proper system specifications, and writing and execution of test cases. The position is competent to work at a high level of most phases of systems analysis and considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. The position guides and advises less-experienced Production Support ServiceNow Analysts and works independently on application support projects of medium to high complexity.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESAssists in the development and delivery of technical and process oriented solutions and recommendations in support of the ServiceNow production environment. This includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of current system requirements, and translation into proper specifications for desired solution.Manages the execution of some aspects and/or phases of testing initiatives for moderate to large sized system implementations and/or application management projects. This includes writing and executing the test plan and test cases. Responsibility may include coordination of user acceptance testing.Collaborates within team to discuss issues and resolutions; provides status updates so others are informed of any implications that might affect them (e.g., trading implications). Provides direction and assistance to other ServiceNow Business Analysts regarding complex technical issues. Coaches and mentors users on applications, policies, and procedures.Writes low to moderately complex code, based on their translations of functional requirements and unit tests code to ensure proper functionality for business use. Assists in the estimation of the size of the effort required to complete the project based upon analysis of requirements of modules assigned; estimates costs and time allotment needed for a project.QUALIFICATIONSRequiredAdaptable and able to learn quicklyAbility to work both independently and in a team environmentStrong verbal and written communication skillsStrong interpersonal skills. Must be able to effectively work with people in the team, other IT departments and/or outside of the enterpriseMust be able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environmentDemonstrated advanced analytical and problem solving skillsDemonstrated ability to develop multiple solutions to moderately complex problems and recommend the best solution to the business and project teamAbility to translate functional business requirements into technical specificationsPreferredBS degree in technology related field preferredSome experience estimating development effort and scope preferredSome experience mentoring less experienced technical staff preferredPrior experience working in multiple technical environments preferredSome experience applying technical standards and change control policies and procedures preferredT. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Sr. Research Data Analyst
Description: Classified Title: [[Sr. Research Data Analyst]]  Working Title: [[Sr. Research Data Analyst]]  Role/Level/Range: ACRP/04/MD  Starting Hourly Pay Rate Range: [[$24.98 - $34.37 ]]  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: [[Monday - Friday, 8:30a - 5:00p / 37.5 hours per week]]  Exempt Status: Exempt  Location: 05-MD:School of Public Health  Department name: 10001217-PFRH Home Visiting  Personnel area: School of Public Health  General Summary/Purpose  The Sr. Research Data Analyst will work as part of our productive, collaborative research team at the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health. For over twenty years, our team has been dedicated to conducting highquality, utilizationfocused evaluation and research work across the United States, with a specific focus on the evaluation of home visiting programs which serve expectant families and families with young children.  The Sr. Research Data Analyst will be part of the research team carrying out evaluations related to New Jersey's Home Visitation Initiative, including a randomized control trial aiming to improve family engagement in home visiting programs in New Jersey by identifying factors related to family goal plan practice and examining a coaching intervention designed to enhance the supervision skills of New Jersey home visiting supervisors.  The Sr. Research Data Analyst will support the study through general oversight of implementing evaluation protocols, monitoring the collection of study data, and managing the organization and analysis of evaluation data. The range of duties includes but is not limited to: assuring data collection activities are carried out with fidelity and in adherence to study timelines; managing and analyzing data collected through surveys, audio-recordings, and document review and abstraction; dissemination of research findings through written reports and oral presentations; and communicating with team members on the status of the project. Applicants must be able to work independently in a self-directed fashion while managing multiple tasks.  Specific Duties & Responsibilities  Contribute to the planning and oversight of the day-to-day programmatic activities for the evaluation and assure that protocols are carried out with fidelity and adhere to study timelines and institutional policy regarding human subjects and data security. Oversee data management activities, including design, creation, and management of evaluation databases, editing and compilation of data files.Ensure data accuracy and that study data files are organized and current. Maintain the confidentiality of the data files and documentation.Identify challenges faced in data collection and aid team in brainstorming strategies to address new/recurring challenges.Hire, train and supervise research assistants in coding study data and other data management tasks.Communicate regularly with team members to provide updates about completion of data collection and management activities Utilize skills to carry out data analyses and interpretation of results and convert results into figures and/or graphs for reports, presentations, and publications.Assist with progress reporting to funders and the wider research team, including writing and preparation of evaluation reports and presentations.Lead communication activities among evaluation staff and research partnersAttend all regular training/team meetings with supervisor and other team members. (These meetings may occur on a weekly or monthly basis).Perform other study-related duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications Master's degree in related discipline. Typically require PhD.  1 year related experience. Require highly specialized advanced knowledge, education and/or training in a specialized field of study to conduct research.  Demonstrated ability on significant graduate project or additional doctoral education may substitute for experience to the extent permitted by the JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job. *  Preferred Qualifications  Master's degree in related discipline, including epidemiology, biostatistics, public health, public policy, economics or similar discipline.  Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Candidate must be able to fluently and reliably merge and manage intricate datasets and have experience monitoring the process of carrying out research protocols. This position requires strong analytical skills and proficiency with data programming and statistical methods using programs such as SPSS, SAS, and STATA. Candidates must be skilled in the analysis and interpretation of survey data and other large secondary data sets and the dissemination of study findings through written and oral communications. Candidates must be able to work independently as well as communicate and collaborate effectively in a team environment.  The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711.  The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.  During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled.  EEO is the Law Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm  School of Public Health - East Baltimore CampusSDL2017

Name: Sr Business Analyst, Fund Product Management
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITIONThe Senior Business Analyst’s primary role within Fund Product Management - North America (FPM-NA) is to lead small-to-medium scale initiatives related to the T. Rowe Price Mutual Funds (Funds), T. Rowe Price Common Trust Funds (Trusts), or other investment products (collectively, the “Products”). In leading these initiatives, the Senior Business Analyst will work closely with stakeholders across the firm including investments, sales, client servicing, reporting, and accounting. The Senior Business Analyst will also continue to provide project and research support to FPM-NA managers. The incumbent must be able to act independently, make certain business decisions, and collaborate with business partners and project teams to influence and advance initiatives. This role will provide intrinsic value to the organization, as the incumbent will lead certain initiatives, train analysts, enhance policies and procedures, and spearhead improvement processes that will allow FPM-NA to continue to efficiently manage initiatives and product related tasks.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESProject Leadership – Leads small-to-medium scale initiatives that promote FPM-NA activities such as managing the operational aspects of new product launches and mergers/transitions; creating and enhancing policies and procedures of the Products; educating other business units on the Products’ policies and procedures; leading end-to-end process reviews; and implementing other product-related changes. For each initiative, the Senior Business Analyst will be expected to identify the objectives and goals, manage the project planning and any related documentation, make substantive decisions, and provide direction to team members. The incumbent will lead certain discussions with business partners across the firm’s operations, distribution, investment, and corporate divisions to drive these initiatives to a successful completion.Business Analysis and Support - Assists FPM-NA Managers by researching new or existing investment strategies, business processes, or regulatory developments in support of department initiatives. Coordinates the collection of information, identifies key trends, and presents such information to FPM-NA managers in a concise and professional format. Facilitates meetings with business partners for the purpose of eliciting and documenting business requirements from which products, services, and tools are developed. Validates that requirements and assessment of risk elicited match the stakeholder’s understanding and meets their needs. Acts independently with minimal supervision, identifies potential risks to FPM-NA and/or the firm’s business-as-usual operations, and elevates issues to management when necessary. Works with FPM-NA Managers on the development of product-related recommendations to both mid-level and senior staff.Infrastructure Development and Support – Develops and evolves team and client reference resources. Researches new tools and technologies that may benefit the operations of the team such as SharePoint to enhance FPM-NA’s project tracking and execution. Develops and leverages metrics to analyze and measure the effectiveness and outcomes of projects, initiatives, and product launches. Develops standard documentation for FPM-NA-led initiatives to enhance processes and improve effectiveness.Board and Product Administration – Assists with the preparation of board materials. Name: Sr. Research Data Analyst
Description: Classified Title: [[Sr. Research Data Analyst]]  Working Title: [[Sr. Research Data Analyst]]  Role/Level/Range: ACRP/04/MD  Starting Hourly Pay Rate Range: [[$24.98 - $34.37 ]]  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: [[Monday - Friday, 8:30a - 5:00p / 37.5 hours per week]]  Exempt Status: Exempt  Location: 05-MD:School of Public Health  Department name: 10001217-PFRH Home Visiting  Personnel area: School of Public Health  General Summary/Purpose  The Sr. Research Data Analyst will work as part of our productive, collaborative research team at the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health. For over twenty years, our team has been dedicated to conducting highquality, utilizationfocused evaluation and research work across the United States, with a specific focus on the evaluation of home visiting programs which serve expectant families and families with young children.  The Sr. Research Data Analyst will be part of the research team carrying out evaluations related to New Jersey's Home Visitation Initiative, including a randomized control trial aiming to improve family engagement in home visiting programs in New Jersey by identifying factors related to family goal plan practice and examining a coaching intervention designed to enhance the supervision skills of New Jersey home visiting supervisors.  The Sr. Research Data Analyst will support the study through general oversight of implementing evaluation protocols, monitoring the collection of study data, and managing the organization and analysis of evaluation data. The range of duties includes but is not limited to: assuring data collection activities are carried out with fidelity and in adherence to study timelines; managing and analyzing data collected through surveys, audio-recordings, and document review and abstraction; dissemination of research findings through written reports and oral presentations; and communicating with team members on the status of the project. Applicants must be able to work independently in a self-directed fashion while managing multiple tasks.  Specific Duties & Responsibilities  Contribute to the planning and oversight of the day-to-day programmatic activities for the evaluation and assure that protocols are carried out with fidelity and adhere to study timelines and institutional policy regarding human subjects and data security. Oversee data management activities, including design, creation, and management of evaluation databases, editing and compilation of data files.Ensure data accuracy and that study data files are organized and current. Maintain the confidentiality of the data files and documentation.Identify challenges faced in data collection and aid team in brainstorming strategies to address new/recurring challenges.Hire, train and supervise research assistants in coding study data and other data management tasks.Communicate regularly with team members to provide updates about completion of data collection and management activities Utilize skills to carry out data analyses and interpretation of results and convert results into figures and/or graphs for reports, presentations, and publications.Assist with progress reporting to funders and the wider research team, including writing and preparation of evaluation reports and presentations.Lead communication activities among evaluation staff and research partnersAttend all regular training/team meetings with supervisor and other team members. (These meetings may occur on a weekly or monthly basis).Perform other study-related duties as assigned.Minimum Qualifications Master's degree in related discipline. Typically require PhD.  1 year related experience. Require highly specialized advanced knowledge, education and/or training in a specialized field of study to conduct research.  Demonstrated ability on significant graduate project or additional doctoral education may substitute for experience to the extent permitted by the JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job. *  Preferred Qualifications  Master's degree in related discipline, including epidemiology, biostatistics, public health, public policy, economics or similar discipline.  Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Candidate must be able to fluently and reliably merge and manage intricate datasets and have experience monitoring the process of carrying out research protocols. This position requires strong analytical skills and proficiency with data programming and statistical methods using programs such as SPSS, SAS, and STATA. Candidates must be skilled in the analysis and interpretation of survey data and other large secondary data sets and the dissemination of study findings through written and oral communications. Candidates must be able to work independently as well as communicate and collaborate effectively in a team environment.  The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711.  The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.  During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled.  EEO is the Law Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm  School of Public Health - East Baltimore CampusSDL2017

Name: BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
Description: Business Systems Analyst  Skip to main content Follow Us |Toggle navigationAbout UsLeadership TeamHeritageCultureGlobal PresenceCode of ConductCommunity OutreachCareer ProfilesJob PostingsSubmit your RsumMy favorites (0)My account-_selectjob _fctUpdateSelectionLabel  Business Systems Analyst Job Title Business Systems Analyst Reference Number************Business Unit Baltimore Aircoil Co. Job Location United States / Maryland / Jessup Job Category Information Technology Job Description Baltimore Aircoil Company is the global leader in sustainable solutions for evaporative cooling, thermal storage, and heat transfer equipment. The corporate headquarters is located in Howard County, Maryland, near Baltimore.  Our equipment is found in residential and commercial buildings to keep people comfortable, supermarket and cold storage warehouses to protect food and perishables, and industrial processes and power installations to improve efficiency and productivity. We are passionate about enhancing the quality of life through our technologies that reduce energy, water, and chemical usage. As a global leader, we are committed to a world of sustainable progress and enduring results. POSITION PURPOSE The Business Systems Analyst collaborates with other Business Systems Analysts to support/lead the implementation of global business initiatives. He or she serves as the liaison between the Global Business Systems team and other global business stakeholders. As liaison this person communicates across multiple levels ranging from business and functional leaders to software developers and production personnel.  The Business Systems Analyst assists in the facilitation of cross-functional meetings and discussions. Working with other GBS team members, he/she is also responsible for the creation and implementation of detailed functional specification and project plans in order to implement business requirements and drive business system process improvement efforts to completion.  Additional duties include: assists in facilitating continuous process improvement initiatives across functional areas to support internal and external business processes; and assisting with Helpdesk activities including report generation, data analysis and problem resolution. The Business Systems Analysts plays however an important role in the steering and guidance of all stakeholders involved in the projects that he/she coordinates.No grants of authority have been assigned to the Business Systems AnalystsThe Business Systems Analysts has multiple day to day contacts while executing his/her function:Members of the Global Business System TeamsAll BAC departments when providing:Training/Facilitating on process improvement techniquesResolving or providing guidance to business systems issuesAll persons participating in cross-functional teams including the User Group team3rd party suppliers of servicesKNOWLEDGE & SKILLSIs in possession of a Bachelor degree in information technology, engineering, business or a related field or has built up a minimum of 2 years of work experience in a similar function within a similar environmentOver 2 year of functional and working knowledge and experience in ERP business systems and project management implementation and Tier 2 Business Systems supportMicrosoft Office Tools (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint) proficientWith management direction, can steer, guide and follow up projects using project management skillsDemonstrated business savvy to work effectively with other business leaders to achieve key business and technology goalsCombines technical qualities with an open and enthusiastic communication style (verbal and written, at all levels)Is capable in presenting his/her ideas to all levels of the organization including Customers and other stakeholdersShows a pro-active attitude - likes looking for solutions to problems and steers others in continuously looking for improvementsDemonstrates change management skills: participate in group meetings, looks for process improvement opportunities Preferred Prior experience as a functional user within a PeopleSoft environmentProject Management foundationHas a high level of customer focus with the ability to identify and prioritize urgent requirementsA stress resistant person who's willing to help others and shift priorities as neededWORKING CONDITIONS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and walk up to 50% of the time. Working conditions include those of a normal construction environment, as well as standard hazards associated with installed HVAC equipment and rotating equipment. This position requires occasional lifting of up to 30 lbs, and travel of 10 - 20% of the time.  BAC is a division of Amsted Industries, a 100% employee-owned company. We offer a very competitive benefit package which includes medical, dental, life, and disability insurance. We also offer two retirement savings programs: (1) an Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP) which is fully company paid and (2) a 401(k) plan. Other benefits include 11 paid holidays per year, vacation time ranging from two to five weeks per year, tuition reimbursement, a wellness program featuring a fitness room at our corporate headquarters and much, much more. Baltimore Aircoil Company is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. Name: PREP Grants & Contracts Analyst
Description: Classified Title: Grants & Contracts Analyst  Working Title: PREP Grants & Contracts Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/03/PC  Starting Salary Range: $50,200 to $68,090 per year  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: M-F, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.  Exempt Status: Exempt  Location: 25-MD:JH at Columbia Center  Department name: 10001507-Energetics Research Group  Personnel area: Whiting School of Engineering General Summary: This position will be primarily responsible for the financial management of the JHU NIST PREP Program. Primary duties will include subaward coordination and processing between JHU and our partner universities. In addition, this position is tasked with financial management of the program budget and financial reporting to both internal and our sponsor resources. Also, this position works with the Corporate and Government Program Office in their mission to fully integrate non-traditional commercial and government research sponsorship into the WSE portfolio. The ideal candidate will serve as a material resource for faculty researchers in pre-award and proposal development budgeting exercises and lend expertise to support fiscal management and reporting. This is a salaried, exempt position.  The analyst will provide dedicated professional level sponsored funds management for more than 80% of time. The primary goal of this position has responsibility for post-award functions that include, but may not be limited to: budget development, account maintenance and oversight, billing/invoicing, reporting, compliance, and closeout. Other responsibilities include processing travel reimbursements, purchasing and invoicing responsibilities and human resource related tasks, e.g. stipend disbursement and visa processing for foreign applicants. The pre-award activity may include proposal preparation, submission, and budget development. One must be able to work independently on a variety of grants/contracts that range from simple to moderately complex. While this role may assist with some aspects of non-sponsored funds, the primary goal of this position is to ensure timely, effective and efficient functioning of sponsored funding. Job Scope/Complexity: The ideal candidate will work independently the majority of the time, with support from Principal Investigator (PI) and/or senior/management level grants & contract professionals on increasingly more complex grants/contracts. This individual will provide standard professional administrative level guidance on protocols, regulations and guidelines to PI and other scientific/research professionals within the department. One may interact with external research/administrative professionals.  Types of Sponsored Awards for which the Position is Responsible:  This role functions at an intermediate level, with responsibility for independent management of simple to moderately complex grants/contracts, including those from NIH, NSF, DOD and NASA. These grants, contracts and awards may involve detailed budgets, sub-awards and special instructions in RFA, career awards, training awards, multi-project grants, complex Foundation grants, sub-awards from other institutions on their federal pass-through grants. Primary Duties and Responsibilities:Understand and utilize institutional policies for post award grant process and sponsor guidelines.Review budgets and related justification for appropriateness and completeness of content. Ensures that all applicable and indirect costs have been applied. May also provide groundwork for subcontract negotiations.Ensure compliance in all other areas related to grant and contract management, including sponsoring organization guidelines, internal protocols, accurate protocol information within grant documents, conflicts of interest, etc.Maintain ongoing updates and communications related to current grants and contracts, this includes regular auditing and reporting to principal investigators and departmental leadership. Assist with closeouts as needed.Coordinate the process of setting up awards in designated department/division after grant number is assigned, including reviewing award, verifying award set-up and ensuring personnel is setup appropriately.Pro-actively ensures spending is compliant in accordance with institutional and sponsor regulations, terms, and conditions.Ensure that post-award responsibilities are completed, including budget distribution, account reconciliation, e-form setup, effort reporting, cost transfers, paying invoices and paperwork finalization related to subcontract setup.Conduct complex award management activities including monitoring and managing accounts, audits, evaluations and reporting.Provide information and direct assistance required to complete contract and grant closeouts.Partner with departmental faculty and/or budgetary staff and the Divisional Office of Research Administration toward the planning and development of application submissions to various federal offices, private agencies/foundations and commercial companies. May review sponsored project proposals for assigned faculty prior to them being forwarded to the Grants & Contracts Manager and Divisional Sponsored Projects Office for signature. Review involves accuracy, content, and adherence to all relevant guidelines.May be expected to provide instruction, preparation assistance and support related to grant application procedures.May serve as liaison between research units, central offices and funding agencies.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelors degree required.Two years of administrative/budgeting experience.Additional education may substitute for required experience and additional related experience may substitute for required education, to the extent permitted by the JHU equivalency formula. JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job. Additional Applicable Information: Successful completion of the RAT program (18-24 months) is equivalent to three years of relevant experience for this position. If an employee does not successfully complete the program, no additional experience will be applied. Special Skills/Knowledge:Knowledge of accounting and budgeting theory and practices required. Thorough knowledge and understanding of The Johns Hopkins University accounting system and related fiscal offices preferred.Ability to make independent judgments and to act on decisions on a daily basis.Ability to work with flexibility on several tasks simultaneously and to meet various concurrent deadlines.Knowledge of external Federal guidelines/procedures for grants and contracts, including NIH, NSF, DOD and NASA. The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check. During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst
Description: IT Business Systems Analyst  IT Business Systems Analyst  Return to Job Opportunities  Job Details  Level  Experienced  Job Location  Baltimore - Linthicum, MD  Position Type  Full Time  Education Level  4 Year Degree  Salary Range  Undisclosed  Travel Percentage  Undisclosed  Job Shift  Day  Job Category  Information Technology  Description  Versant Health bringing you Davis Vision | Superior Vision is a leading provider of vision and eye health solutions offering services to the full spectrum of the vision care marketplace, including employer groups, health plans, and government-sponsored programs. No other vision carrier comes close to the size, accessibility, and diversity we offer. We have built lasting relationships based on one foundational principle: our members are our highest priority. Every department embodies a member-centric approach to service.  We are an innovative company that is always looking forward and adapting our comprehensive portfolio of products to match -- and anticipate -- what our customers need.
