Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionData AnalystDo you believe in the power of data? Do you see a future where you directly impact the growth of the credit union industry?Callahan & Associates is an entrepreneurial company that provides industry-leading software, content, and consulting to credit union executives. We’re looking for a data analyst to coordinate operations between the Technology team and the Business Analysts. This role will report directly to the head of Information Services & Technology.In this role, you will have a significant impact on the operational side of the business. You will be able to reach beyond your technical skills to assist other teams to pull reports, understand our data infrastructure, analyze new projects’ data needs and provide recommendations based on business requirements.The data analyst must have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. This is a critical role that interacts directly multiple business units within the organization including product development, sales and marketing. The ideal candidate should be extremely motivated with excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, fun work environment.To be successful, you will be familiar with database infrastructure and the general concepts of analytics. Front end visualization experience is a plus.In this role, you will:Participate as a key member of our technology team by maintaining high-level knowledge of all datasets in this organizationWork directly with business units to better understand their needs and contribute to the strategic vision that converts these needs into products.Translate internal/external requirements into reportsAssist on projects related to data collection systems, data analytics etc.Recommend and secure new datasets that will allow our products to evolveLocate and define new process improvement opportunitiesMaintain data documentationSkills & Requirements5 or more years of Database and/or Analytics Systems development and deployment experience, front-end visualization is a plusHands on experience as a data analystHands on experience with data governance, database infrastructure, SQL Server, excelKnowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) is a plus Company DescriptionCallahan & Associates was founded over 30 years ago by three credit union proponents with a shared passion for helping credit unions thrive. Callahan's founders realized that the best way to support credit unions was by empowering them with actionable data, fostering collaboration, and driving groundbreaking innovation.  Our flagship product, The Credit Union Directory, gave credit union executives unprecedented access to industry data in an easy-to-use format. Thirty years later, Callahan is still providing timely, accurate market intelligence across a variety of channels.  Collaboration is one of our foundational values and it continues to drive us today. We bring the industry's best minds together to identify market opportunities, overcome shared challenges, and discover ways to better serve members.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, ServiceNow
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITIONUnder independent direction, the Sr. Business Analyst, ServiceNow assists in the development and delivery of technical and process oriented solutions and recommendations in support of the production environment. This includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of current system requirements, translation into proper system specifications, and writing and execution of test cases. The position is competent to work at a high level of most phases of systems analysis and considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. The position guides and advises less-experienced Production Support ServiceNow Analysts and works independently on application support projects of medium to high complexity.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESAssists in the development and delivery of technical and process oriented solutions and recommendations in support of the ServiceNow production environment. This includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of current system requirements, and translation into proper specifications for desired solution.Manages the execution of some aspects and/or phases of testing initiatives for moderate to large sized system implementations and/or application management projects. This includes writing and executing the test plan and test cases. Responsibility may include coordination of user acceptance testing.Collaborates within team to discuss issues and resolutions; provides status updates so others are informed of any implications that might affect them (e.g., trading implications). Provides direction and assistance to other ServiceNow Business Analysts regarding complex technical issues. Coaches and mentors users on applications, policies, and procedures.Writes low to moderately complex code, based on their translations of functional requirements and unit tests code to ensure proper functionality for business use. Assists in the estimation of the size of the effort required to complete the project based upon analysis of requirements of modules assigned; estimates costs and time allotment needed for a project.QUALIFICATIONSRequiredAdaptable and able to learn quicklyAbility to work both independently and in a team environmentStrong verbal and written communication skillsStrong interpersonal skills. Must be able to effectively work with people in the team, other IT departments and/or outside of the enterpriseMust be able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environmentDemonstrated advanced analytical and problem solving skillsDemonstrated ability to develop multiple solutions to moderately complex problems and recommend the best solution to the business and project teamAbility to translate functional business requirements into technical specificationsPreferredBS degree in technology related field preferredSome experience estimating development effort and scope preferredSome experience mentoring less experienced technical staff preferredPrior experience working in multiple technical environments preferredSome experience applying technical standards and change control policies and procedures preferredT. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Sr. Programmer Analyst
Description: Classified Title: Sr. Programmer Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/04/PD  Salary: Commensurate with Experience  Status: Full-Time  Department name: ICTR Institute of Clinical Translational Research  Work Schedule/Hours: M-F; 8:30am-5:00pm  Location: 12-MD:JH at Fells Point  Personnel area: School of Medicine  The Sr. Programmer Analyst will be responsible for the creation, implementation, maintenance, performance, production support and documentation of various departmental and enterprise-wide application systems. This includes but is not limited to the installation, modification, and testing of new and/or upgraded applications (packages or home grown), operating systems, file structures, hardware, communication devices, and productivity tools. Applies analysis techniques and procedures to gather and then translate business requirements into functional/technical specifications and designs. Using functional specifications and designs, produces all or part of the deliverables. Maintains databases and application system code.  This position is responsible for requirements gathering, data provisioning, data analytics, end user training, and data quality monitoring related to the Precision Medicine Analytic Platform, supporting clinical research projects.  This position requires a significant level of collaboration with the clinical research community, involving application of analysis techniques to gather and translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications and designs. This position also requires knowledge of HIPAA privacy policies related to Human Subjects Research to review IRB-approved protocols to ensure compliance. Will prepare supporting documentation to facilitate use of the PMAP system, as well as deliver in-person and online training materials to PMAP researchers. Will provide feedback to the PMAP development team based on end user acceptance testing and production usage. Will perform data analysis and interpretation, utilizing knowledge of statistics and quantitative analysis. Will conduct basic statistical analysis for studies with various research designs. Make suggestions or provide solutions to problems related to data management and statistical analysis.  The position will use JIRA to document and track assignments. Data must be delivered and analyzed in a secure manner, following all applicable institutional policies and State and Federal regulations for privacy, security, and the conduct of human subject research.  The role will also utilize the PMAP Configuration Services tool to create data projections within the PMAP environment based on IRB approval and researcher requirements, and assist researchers in analyzing this data using tools such as Python, Jupyter Notebook, Stata, SAS or R Studio. The major systems with which the position interfaces are: Epic, EPR2020, and DataMart/CaseMix.  This position could work with about one hundred different users annually, primarily from the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, but also from the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health, Nursing, and the Engineering Program at the Homewood Campus. The position will require some travel to the Johns Hopkins Hospital and possibly to other locations in Baltimore in order to meet with customers. The most complex part of this job is learning about the nuances of the data in large institutional databases, with data for about 5.4 million patients.  Specific Duties & Responsibilities  Service-oriented with excellent verbal and written communication and organization skills; experience with delivering training to a diverse population of users; comprehensive understanding of business requirements gathering and analysis; understanding of change control/change management and the implications of technology solutions. Must be able to work closely with customers and understand and translate their functional needs into technical requirements. Experience in delivering effective technology solutions in a higher education environment or in the technology supported or enabled delivery of education is required.  Basic experience using Microsoft SQL Server to extract data for quality control purposes and experience with quality assurance testing, data analytics, preparing high-quality training materials, and delivering training and assistance as needed to support the PMAP research community. Experience with analytical and statistical applications such as SAS, R Studio, and Python. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree required and three years of related work experience with computer systems and applications. Additional education may substitute for experience.  JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits or 18 graduate degree credits = 1 year of experience. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college coursework may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job. Preferred: Experience with clinical data, particularly with mining data from one or more of the following systems: Epic, EPR2020, Sunrise Clinical Manager, DataMart/CaseMix and experience with Jupyter Notebook and Tableau highly desired.  The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711.  The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.  During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled.  EEO is the Law Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm  School of Medicine - East Baltimore CampusSDL2017

Name: Business Analyst Internship
Description: Summary: Internships at Almo Corporation offer students hands-on experience with a creative, fun, and hard-working team. Already the largest independent distributor of appliances, consumer electronics, professional A/V equipment, and furniture in the United States, Almo Corporation continues growing and needs motivated interns for in all areas of our company. Almo’s summer intern program includes a meaningful summer project, a series of career training workshops, and contact with senior leaders.  This is a full-time, paid internship in our Lutherville, MD office that will run from roughly May/June through July/August, depending on student availability. The core learning program will run for 8 weeks. Internship Responsibilities: Job functions include entry level responsibilities within the designated department. Interns will have exposure to all facets of the department.  The Business Analyst intern will be responsible for: Market and business analysisUpdating product categories, descriptions, and assets for customer portal and website as necessaryAssorted ad-hoc projects that may include National Sales Meeting setup, technical assistance, product evaluations, and othersProject - research related internal communication, marketing efforts, product management, and sales initiatives for an underperforming or growth-focused product line Assess vendor's strategy and structure relative to Almo's business modelPresent research and analysis along with recommended changes to increase sales Education: Currently enrolled in undergraduate program at an accredited college (preference for rising juniors and seniors) Qualifications: Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and Power PointStrong written and verbal communication skillsProductive time management skillsMinimum 3.0 GPA

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Title : Senior Business Analyst  Location : Baltimore, MD  Duration : 6+ Months Contract  The Business Analyst acts as a consultant and partner with the business community, EPMO, Program Manager, project teams and business partners to elicit clarify and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design from which solutions are developed. The Sr. BA is responsible for supporting, gathering data and defining (and/or redefining) business needs for new and/or enhanced products, services or optimized business processes. This position supports a high profile regulatory project, the EU General Data Protection Regulation ("GDPR").It will report into the program PMO and work closely with the Head of Privacy to meet with multiple business unit leaders and business process owners to document their high and medium risk systems and business processes.Although there will be standard questions, the BA will need to navigate the interview and draw out key information required to build a Record of Processing (RoP), and then conduct follow up sessions, as required.Previous experience working within the Financial Services industry a plus, but not required.Previous experience building, adding, maintaining and extracting data from systems and SharePoint sites are a plus.5 Year minimum experience required.This is both a technical and business position.The successful candidate should be flexible and able to move between both groups.Strong SharePoint design, Excel, MS Project, Visio and PowerPoint skills a strong plus.Must have DEMONSTATED gap analysis experience, mapping, have methodology of how to gather required information.Investment/finance experience, previous experience working on regulatory projects.High Level Excel Skills.Creating lists and pivot tables within Share point is preferred.While there is a lot of data, this position is business process driven and requires a senior level BA with a technical and business background.Ability to create professional level documentation that can be easily accessed and reviewed by regulators.

Name: Business Analyst IT - ETRM / CTRM products
Description: DescriptionPRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION Provide in-depth expertise to solicit functional and technical requirements for projects and/or on-going operations. Act as the liaison to provide IT teams and business personnel with clear understanding of business requirements and business unit’s processes and translate into defined scope. Creates and assigns detailed tasks to subordinates. PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES - Provide application support to Constellation’s ETRM system (OpenLink Endur), including defect management, Issue analysis, application documentation and system training.  - Perform and manage team to provide functional expertise to elicit, document, and maintain business requirements and understand how they translate into technical requirements. Requirements include, but not limited to Business Requirement Documents (BRDs), system diagrams, use cases, and analysis of data.  - Participates in providing guidance to less experienced personnel in the areas of gap analysis, from a software perspective, highlighting current state, future state, client needs, and best practices.  - Maintain and enhance engagement with business and IT partners to establish credibility at all levels. Convey strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with complex technical problems.  - Facilitate communication across various organizational units and help resolve conflicting requirements. Resolve disagreements and conflicts constructively, knowing when to escalate and involve others.  - Maintain business acumen within own discipline or function. QualificationsPOSITION SPECIFICATIONSMinimum: - Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Information Technology or related discipline and typically 5 to 7 years’ experience in business analysis, including requirements gathering, design and support of IT applications.  - Demonstrated strong teamwork skills with self-motivation to achieve success in a rapidly evolving environment.  - Excellent interpersonal and communications skills, both written and oral  - Demonstrated attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and manage priorities.  - Exposure to business process redesign principles, tools, and techniques  - Demonstrated conceptual problem-solving and analytical aptitude  - Experience leading small IT projects or sub-teams and knowledge of IT project management  - Financial management experience and ability to understand and manage a budget, forecast, and explain variances  Preferred: Prior experience developing software requirements and configuration for complex ecoysystems for energy industry is a major plus; primarily with Energy Trading and Risk Management (ETRM) systems.Experience with OpenLink Endur or other ETRM/CTRM productsStrong commodity exposure and business acumen, including power, gas, and fuels (Wholesale and Retail business) Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Name: Business Intelligence Developer and Data Analyst
Description: Business Intelligence Developer and Data Analyst  Requisition #: 175847  Location: Johns Hopkins Hospital/Johns Hopkins Health System, Baltimore, MD  Category: Manager/Supervisor  Work Shift: Day Shift  Work Week: Full Time (40 hours)  Weekend Work Required: No  Date Posted: Oct. 12, 2018  Johns Hopkins employs more than 20,000 people annually across our health system. Upon joining Johns Hopkins, you become part of a diverse organization dedicated to its patients, their families, and the community we serve, as well as to our employees. Career opportunities are available in academic and community hospital settings, home care services, physician practices, international affiliate locations and in the health insurance industry. If you share in our vision, mission and values and also have exceptional customer service and technical skills, we invite you to join an employer that is a leader and innovator in the healthcare field.  Reports to the Clinical Analytics Systems Architect and is responsible for developing, planning, testing, and implementing systems to abstract clinical data and perform analysis in order to provide meaningful information to detect, quantify and prevent healthcare-acquired infections and track antimicrobial use and antimicrobial resistance in The Johns Hopkins Hospital. The Business Intelligence Developer and Data Analyst is able to recommend and implement information systems to collect data that will be used for the different reporting needs of the organization. . This position is responsible for building complex data sets and using sophisticated data analysis methods to create reports to inform clinical and operational decision making  The Business Intelligence Developer and Data Analyst defines and directs the data management workflow for assigned projects, ensuring all necessary data quality control measures are in place and serves as the data management expert providing specific expertise on timeline development and identification of data management and reporting deliverables. He/she assists in research efforts by providing statistical support, directs the creation and management of new database systems and implements reporting and quality assurance activities.  This position will assist the infection control department in managing the data requests, building the required reports, design and development of reliable applications that could help department and will coordinate the team work plan to achieve deliverables within agreed timeframes.  Full-time, Day Shift  8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.  Work Location: Johns Hopkins Hospital, East Baltimore Campus  Pay Grade: IW  Requires a Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, data management or a related field. A Master's degree in Health Administration is preferred.  A minimum of 5 years' experience in database system design, development, implementation and management. Requires a minimum of 3 years of experience in data collection, validation, modeling and analysis, statistical programming and designing and implementing clinical data analysis plans.  "Johns Hopkins Hospital is a Smoke Free Campus"  #LI-MP1SDL2017

Name: Analyst, Revenue Accounting
Description: Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.What will you do at Ciena? This individual will be responsible for the reconciliation of and then the analyzing of a variety of customer revenue and expense accounts against the business plan/forecast pertaining to above the line activities. ResponsibilitiesThey will be responsible for margin forecasting and analysis and he/she will eventually be the first line support for revenue recognition and contract review and provide the communication/guidance to the finance, sales and manufacturing teams to help in meeting revenue and margin goals for the quarter.This person will manage the completion of day to day transaction driven activities allowing him/her to focus on maintaining current revenue recognition files (white papers), communications with external auditors and other internal groups, and creating efficient processes in retrieving data from Oracle, Seibel and OBIEE.This person will also support the Finance Team with various schedules and will be an integral contributor to the creation and roll-up of the yearly business plan and quarterly forecast.General ActivitiesCreate detailed spreadsheets / adhoc analysisParticipate in projects and presentations as neededAnalyze revenue and COGS actual resultsCollaboration with stakeholdersWork with revenue assurance team workload against deadlinesWork with other internal departments to resolve accounting issues, including: Accounts ReceivableOrder ManagementLegalGovernanceExperienceBS Degree in AccountingCPA a PlusMinimum 3 Years Experience in AccountingCost Accounting Experience in a Manufacturing Environment a PlusDirect Exposure to Revenue Recognition Rules and Regulations a Plus *LI-CN Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes. Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us. A distinct way to work Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.  Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.  Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. What you can expect from usYou will receive notification of your successful applicationSuccessful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussionIf suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Name: Sr Business Analyst, Fund Product Management
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITIONThe Senior Business Analyst’s primary role within Fund Product Management - North America (FPM-NA) is to lead small-to-medium scale initiatives related to the T. Rowe Price Mutual Funds (Funds), T. Rowe Price Common Trust Funds (Trusts), or other investment products (collectively, the “Products”). In leading these initiatives, the Senior Business Analyst will work closely with stakeholders across the firm including investments, sales, client servicing, reporting, and accounting. The Senior Business Analyst will also continue to provide project and research support to FPM-NA managers. The incumbent must be able to act independently, make certain business decisions, and collaborate with business partners and project teams to influence and advance initiatives. This role will provide intrinsic value to the organization, as the incumbent will lead certain initiatives, train analysts, enhance policies and procedures, and spearhead improvement processes that will allow FPM-NA to continue to efficiently manage initiatives and product related tasks.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESProject Leadership – Leads small-to-medium scale initiatives that promote FPM-NA activities such as managing the operational aspects of new product launches and mergers/transitions; creating and enhancing policies and procedures of the Products; educating other business units on the Products’ policies and procedures; leading end-to-end process reviews; and implementing other product-related changes. For each initiative, the Senior Business Analyst will be expected to identify the objectives and goals, manage the project planning and any related documentation, make substantive decisions, and provide direction to team members. The incumbent will lead certain discussions with business partners across the firm’s operations, distribution, investment, and corporate divisions to drive these initiatives to a successful completion.Business Analysis and Support - Assists FPM-NA Managers by researching new or existing investment strategies, business processes, or regulatory developments in support of department initiatives. Coordinates the collection of information, identifies key trends, and presents such information to FPM-NA managers in a concise and professional format. Facilitates meetings with business partners for the purpose of eliciting and documenting business requirements from which products, services, and tools are developed. Validates that requirements and assessment of risk elicited match the stakeholder’s understanding and meets their needs. Acts independently with minimal supervision, identifies potential risks to FPM-NA and/or the firm’s business-as-usual operations, and elevates issues to management when necessary. Works with FPM-NA Managers on the development of product-related recommendations to both mid-level and senior staff.Infrastructure Development and Support – Develops and evolves team and client reference resources. Researches new tools and technologies that may benefit the operations of the team such as SharePoint to enhance FPM-NA’s project tracking and execution. Develops and leverages metrics to analyze and measure the effectiveness and outcomes of projects, initiatives, and product launches. Develops standard documentation for FPM-NA-led initiatives to enhance processes and improve effectiveness.Board and Product Administration – Assists with the preparation of board materials. Provides on-going product support for investment vehicles such as supporting a benchmark change, managing a fund name change, or adding a new share class. Determines opportunities to improve reporting process, interacts with other business units to design and gather requirements, and then coordinates the implementation of such reporting enhancements for use within the group and by other cross-functional teams.QUALIFICATIONSRequiredCollege degree and 2 years of related work experience, or Associate degree and 4 years related work experience, or High School diploma/equivalent and 6 years related work experienceBroad experience of the financial industry including mutual funds and/or other investment vehicles offered by T. Rowe PriceAbility to apply acquired knowledge from prior experience effectively in new situationsSelf-motivatedPositive approach to work and ability to work with all levels of the organization as neededAbility to work in an extremely fast-paced, high volume environment that calls for constantly changing prioritiesCustomer service orientationStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work collaboratively with others in team environmentAbility to effectively facilitate cross-functional/cross-site conversationsAbility to effectively communicate with high level internal and external contactsExperience communicating financial mattersAbility to develop and manage effective relationships at all levels of the organization and work collaboratively with others in a team environmentLogical thinker with strong attention to detailAbility to think strategically and creativelyOutstanding and demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills, both qualitative and quantitativeAbility to translate business needs into functional requirementsAbility to develop multiple options to address identified, moderately complex business issues or needsProcess oriented with proven process improvement experience and ability to create detailed, end-to-end processesStrong project management skills including project planning, documentation, and follow-through Demonstrated ability to independently lead and execute projects of small to medium complexity with various stakeholdersAbility to organize, prioritize, and manage multiple tasks and/or initiativesExperience using Microsoft Office Suite - Superior PowerPoint skills and advanced Excel skillsSkilled in the use of Visio or other process or flow chart toolsWorking knowledge of software and databases such as Morningstar Direct, SIMFUND, Lipper, FactsetKnowledge of and experience with testing conceptsPreferredExperience with investment product operations, processes, and systemsKnowledge of TRP distribution unit clients and servicesKnowledge of relational databases such as Microsoft AccessInvestment product and market/competitor data experienceT. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Sr. Systems Business Analyst
Description: The Senior Business Systems Analyst utilizes a variety of elicitation techniques to effectively gather pertinent information to plan, design, develop, and launch business, financial, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. The BA must identify and create clear and concise alternative, constructive and forward thinking solutions for multiple business objectives and requirements. Recommended solutions will best fit the overall alignment with JHHC organizational goals. Solutions may include new applications, interfaces, architectures or process. The Sr. BA will be skilled in creating all supporting documentation and is able to create and utilize models and prototypes as required to solidify final requirements. The Sr. BA should be comfortable with both iterative/agile methodologies as well as traditional waterfall approaches to development. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, suability engineering and problem-solving skills to create final functional definitions ResponsibilitiesAbility to ascertain the true needs that will address tactical and strategic goals. He or she will be able to transfer information acquired from elicitation techniques into needed data and documentation. Statistics from other sources will be assessed and turned into usable information. The business analyst will be able to compile and report an easily understood projected vision to be implemented. Expert facilitation skills required.Must possess efficient analytical skills with proven ability to recognize patterns and create solutions for change in process workflow or reallocation of resources. Ability to both lead teams and work within teams to meet goals. Demonstrates a strong knowledge of one or more business areas and develops functional requirements and recommends operation process flows to meet business requirements and objectives.RequirementsEducation Bachelors degree in business. management, human resources, information systems, computer science, or another related field, or equivalent experience is required. A Masters degree in related field is preferred. Experience and SkillsMinimum of five years of experience working in a technology environment with mainframe, client server, or web based applications in the areas of requirements gathering, requirements definition and analysis, and business analysis, testing, or other general system support tasks. Additional experience should include project management and development skills through teamwork. Work experience should include roles as team member and team lead in a matrixed resource setting.

Location: 05-MD:School of Public Health  Department name: 10001064-Registration and Records  Personnel area: School of Public Health *General Summary/Purpose** The Data Analyst is responsible for the management of all Student Information System (SIS) data related to the Office of Records and Registration. The Data Analyst is the office?s functional lead and serves as the unit?s liaison to technical staff both within the School and the University. The Data Analyst recommends and formulates solutions to business problems through existing and developing technologies. Additionally, the Data Analyst assists with the integration of CMN data with the other functional and technical leads within PH to ensure the integrity of student data as reported for the School of Public Health. *Specific Duties & Responsibilities** + Provides general direction, support and training to all staff within the unit and in the Schools academic departments on matters related to the student registration system; uses problem-solving skills to maintain system efficiency and effectiveness.  + Serves as functional resource to Public Health Student Affairs technical staff  + Partner with PH and University programmers to ensure that required functionality serves the needs of the School.  + Prepare and document records and registration process decisions; follow change management procedures.  + Report and submit system problems and enhancements to Student Affairs IT Director.  + Monitors production calendar to ensure processes and jobs are scheduled and run  + Develop test plans and procedures, perform tests, document test results, and make appropriate recommendations in conjunction with technical staff at PH Student Affairs IT as well as University IT.  + Identify, prioritize, reports and document systems defects; determine path of resolution.  + Analyze current system configuration, evaluate existing functionality within the registration system and propose modifications for efficiency on standards and procedures.  + Recommend and document systems enhancements.  + Generate standard and ad hoc statistical reports and data extracts.  + Use university reporting tools to produce reports for faculty, academic coordinators and administrative offices;  + Generate standard and ad hoc statistical reports and data extracts, including required federal reporting  + Provide supervision for the Registration Data Coordinator.  + Troubleshoot PH individual staff questions and problems regarding the registration system.  + Serve as the School?s functional representative in university wide subgroups for the establishment of new business procedures.  + Recommend and implement most efficient reporting solutions for the office accordingly.  + Performs related duties as required  + Use the university?s reporting tools to produce reports for faculty, academic coordinators and administrative offices; *Minimum Qualifications** Bachelor?s Degree required and three (3) years of related experience in data/registration processes and procedures required.  Additional education may substitute for required experience and additional related experience may substitute for required education, to the extent permitted by the **_JHU Equivalency Formula_** : _30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job. *_ *Special Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities** + Experience in ensuring data integrity and procedural documentation  + Knowledge of registration procedures at the School and University levels.  + Knowledge of School?s academic/administrative policies and procedures.  + Knowledge of JHU SIS system highly preferred  + Ability to prioritize projects, meet deadlines and work effectively under pressure.  + Ability to exercise independent judgment.  + Good written and interpersonal communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization (student, staff, faculty, deans, directors and department?s chairs).  + Ability to mentor and train junior staff and monitor their assigned tasks.  + Ability to maintain excellent collaborative working relationships with internal/external functional and technical staff.  The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu . For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. *The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.** During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. *Equal Opportunity Employer** Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled. *EEO is the Law**Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm Equal Opportunity Employer: Johns Hopkins University is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria. The university promotes affirmative action for minorities, women, disabled persons, and veterans.

Name: Technical Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionTechnical Analyst Formed in 1924, Cowan Systems enjoys a history of excellence and quality in the transportation business. Due to continued growth, Cowan Systems, LLC has a Technical Analyst position available in our corporate office located in Halethorpe, Maryland.  The Technical Analyst will provide exceptional customer service and act as an initial point of contact for end-users in the corporate headquarters and remote locations. The Technical Analyst assists staff with technical support of desktop computers, applications, telecommunications and related technology across our 24x7 enterprise. Support includes interaction with application software and operating systems to diagnose and resolve unique, recurring and non-recurring problems and documenting issues in the help desk ticketing system. Responsibilities require independent analyses, communication and problem solving skills. This position reports to the Help Desk Supervisor. Responsibilities include: - Support and maintenance of the desktops, laptops, IP phones, mobile phones, printers and peripherals on the corporate network.  - Support of the company's enterprise virtual desktop and application delivery software systems in conjunction with other members of the IT staff.  - Accurately log all support requests in the Track-It help desk system. Acknowledge, troubleshoot and resolve all assigned tickets; escalate and follow through when necessary especially in system down situations.  - Responsible for creation, deletion and modification of user accounts and MS Exchange mailboxes.  - Responsible to communicate all system related issues to IT staff through channels set forth by management.  - Facilitates moves, additions, and changes of computer and phone related equipment as required.  - Perform user profile data migrations and restorations.  - Maintenance of hardware and software inventory within the Track-It system.  - Assist next level IT support staff as necessary.  - Participate in the on-call rotation.  - Other tasks as assigned. Qualifications - BA/BS degree in a computing discipline and 1 year of work experience or 2-3 years providing PC desktop support in a corporate WAN environment.  - Previous experience supporting Microsoft Windows 7 in a corporate environment required.  - Experience supporting Microsoft Office with comprehensive knowledge of Outlook required.  - Experience with desktop imaging software.  - Familiarity with VoIP, general telecom and associated technologies a plus.  - Experienced supporting enterprise-level multifunction printer/copiers/scanners also helpful. Additional: - Strong customer-service orientation. Effective interpersonal and relationship-building skills. Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language to both technical and non-technical end-users.  - Ability to multi-task and remain calm and composed under pressure.  - Ability to lift and carry related computer & networking equipment.  - Ability to climb ladders and stairs.  - Must possess a valid driver's license and a vehicle for local travel to remote sites. Part of the Technical Analysts responsibility will be to support (in a rotation) an annex of the corporate office located about a mile away.  - Ability to travel (infrequent - less than 5%) to locations across the US for short durations.  #cs

Name: Grants & Contracts Analyst
Description: Description  Classified Title: Grants & Contracts Analyst  Working Title: ​​​​​Grants & Contracts Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/03/PC  Starting Salary Range: $50,200 - $69,089 Commensurate with Experience  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: 37.5 hours/week M-F  Exempt Status: Exempt  Location: 05-MD:School of Public Health  Department name: 10001101-Epidemiology  Personnel area: School of Public Health General summary/purpose:Position Overview: Analyst will provide dedicated professional level sponsored funds management for more than 80% of time with specific responsibility for pre-award and post-award functions that include, but may not be limited to: proposal preparation, submission, budget development, account maintenance and oversight, billing/invoicing, reporting, compliance, and closeout. Works independently on a variety of grants/contracts that range from simple to moderately complex. While this role may assist with some aspects of non-sponsored funds, the primary goal of this position is to ensure timely, effective and efficient functioning of sponsored funding. Job Scope/Complexity: Will work independently the majority of the time, with support from Principal Investigator (PI) and/or senior/management level grants & contract professionals on increasingly more complex grants/contracts. Will provide standard professional administrative level guidance on protocols, regulations and guidelines to PI and other scientific/research professionals within the department. May interact with external research/administrative professionals. Types of sponsored awards for which the position is responsible: This role functions at an intermediate level, with responsibility for independent management of simple to moderately complex grants/contracts, including those from NIH, NSF, DOD and NASA. These grants, contracts and awards may involve detailed budgets, subawards and special instructions in RFA, career awards, training awards, multi-project grants, complex Foundation grants, subawards from other institutions on their federal pass-through grants and Pharmaceutical company clinical trials. Specific Duties/Responsibilities:Partner with departmental faculty and/or budgetary staff and the Office of Research Administration toward the planning and development of application submissions to various federal offices, private agencies/foundations and commercial companies.Understand and utilize institutional policies for pre-award grant process and sponsor guidelines.Review all sponsored project proposals for assigned faculty prior to them being forwarded to the Grants & Contracts Manager and ORA for signature. Review involves accuracy, content, adherence to all relevant guidelines.Provide instruction, preparation assistance and support related to grant application procedures.Serve as liaison between research units, central offices and funding agencies.Review budgets and related justification for appropriateness and completeness of content. Ensures that all applicable and indirect costs have been applied. May also provide groundwork for subcontract negotiations.Ensure compliance in all other areas related to grant and contract management, including sponsoring organization guidelines, internal protocols, accurate protocol information within grant documents, conflicts of interest, etc.Manage all assigned grant submissions to ensure timeliness and accuracy.Maintain ongoing updates and communications related to current grants and contracts, this includes regular auditing and reporting to principal investigators and departmental leadership. Assist with closeouts as needed.Coordinate the process of setting up awards in designated department/division after grant number is assigned, including reviewing award, verifying award set-up and ensuring personnel is setup appropriately.Ensure that post-award responsibilities are completed, including budget distribution, account reconciliation, e-form setup, effort reporting, cost transfers, paying invoices and paperwork finalization related to subcontract setup.Conduct complex award management activities and provide oversight to other employees, including monitoring and managing accounts, audits, evaluations and reporting.Provide information and direct assistance required to complete contract and grant closeouts. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree required plus 2 years of administrative/budgeting experience.  Successful completion of the RAT program (13-15 months) is equivalent to two years of relevant experience for this position. If an employee does not successfully complete the program, no additional experience will be applied. JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job.Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of accounting and budgeting theory and practices required. Thorough knowledge and understanding of The Johns Hopkins University accounting system and related fiscal offices preferred.Ability to make independent judgments and to act on decisions on a daily basis.Ability to work with flexibility on several tasks simultaneously and to meet various concurrent deadlines.Knowledge of external Federal guidelines/procedures for grants and contracts, including NIH, NSF, DOD and NASA. The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly. During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. Name: Business Analyst Intern MBA
Description: Job Description Summary:Job Description:At PayPal, we’re literally reinventing how the world pays and gets paid. We understand that it’s about people. We connect individuals to let them shop, get paid, donate and send money using today’s technology with the confidence that comes from the security and control PayPal enables. Are you ready to help us change the world?The world’s leading payments company, PayPal, brings together a family of brands that are revolutionizing the way people move money. At PayPal you will be immersed in an amazing community with a vibrant culture that thrives on innovation, collaboration, inclusion and wellness.Analysts at PayPal are a part of a global analytics organization that generates insights into what will make the biggest impact on connected commerce and payments for PayPal. Providing reports and analyses only scratches the surface of what our analysts do on a daily basis; you’ll be a part of a team that goes above and beyond and consults on product design and customer experience.You’ll conduct extensive analyses of PayPal’s rich data and, in the process, develop a deep understanding of the PayPal businesses and PayPal’s site functionality. On this team, you’ll strengthen your analytic, leadership, and presentation skills, and gain exposure to a wide variety of functional teams within PayPal. This is a unique role with many options for future growth here as you work alongside the brightest analytical minds in the industry.RequirementsPursuing MBA or Master’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer ScienceExperience in SQL or SASExcellent understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms.Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Specifically, experience and confidence in interacting with people at all levels of an organization such as PayPal, including pitching business ideas to both senior management and external partners.Excellent problem solving skills.EducationPursuing MBA or Master’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer SciencePosition Location: VariesSubsidiary:PayPalTravel Percent:0Primary Location:San Jose, California, United States of AmericaAdditional Locations:Newton - Massachusetts, New York, Scottsdale, TimoniumWe're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Name: Senior Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Description:Leidos is looking to improve and advance our organization. Our program is focused on the delivery of end-user centric IT technology solution to our Centers of Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) customer where we are challenged to provide ongoing innovative and seamless experience while using CMS systems, applications and solutions, provide proactive secure development of IT integrations, concepts, and designs across the CMS enterprise and integrate end-user computing devices, conference room technology, infrastructure hardware and software, and user applications into a streamlined and seamless experience across the CMS user base. We foster a positive end-user experience while ensuring protection of the data.AS Senior Business Process Analyst you will work closely with the program management and technical and engineering teams and provide evaluation and the analysis of the hardware and software products in support of the customer. Review trends and analyze the data to discover patters, identify areas of concerns and prioritize action steps to optimize program performance. You will work closely with external and internal customers to streamline the hardware and software ordering, delivery, tracking and reporting.Primary ResponsibilitiesList daily duties and/or specific job responsibilities. Under the direction of the Program and Deputy Program Manager, you will be responsible, to include, but not limited to:Management of the program Product Catalog.Streamline the ordering, tracking and continuous monitoring and reporting on the hardware and software delivered under the program.Work closely with the internal functional support teams and identify areas of improvements to deliver goods to the customer in the most efficient manner and act as a liaison between the program and the sub-contractors and vendors.Conduct evaluation of the software licensing currently on the program, identify different licensing options that will lead to cost reduction and faster delivery.Research best business practices within and outside the organization, collecting and analyzing process data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on increased productivity and cost reduction. Basic QualificationsList the "must have" MINIMUM requirements to be considered for the position and ensure minimum quals fall within the minimum Leidos job code requirements. Example: Bachelors' Degree with 6 years' of applicable experience or 4 additional years' of experience in lieu of degree. Must be able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI Clearance. Must have 2+ years JAVA experience. Bachelor's Degree with 8 - 12 years of relevant experience or Master's with 6-10 years of prior relevant experience. Additional years of work experience in lieu of degree is acceptable.Working knowledge of Leidos processes and systems.Experience working in Cognos, CostPoint, Hyperion and other financial and procurement systems.Experience in financial analysis and forecasting, review and analysis of invoices within contract and purchase order parameters.Experience with cost estimating, cost/benefit analysis, and the ordering, managing and tracking processes and procedures.Proficiency in budget and cost analysis tools.Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas and pivot tables.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated experience in developing and delivering briefings for senior and executive managers and facilitating high level technical discussions.All candidates supporting the CMS programs must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior in order to be considered.

Name: Process Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBackground Formulate and apply mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret information that assists management with decision making, policy formulation, or other managerial functions. May collect and analyze data and develop decision support software, service, or products. May develop and supply optimal time, cost, or logistics networks for program evaluation, review, or implementation Job Duties Duties will include:  · Develop acquisition logistics processes to turn shipbuilder CDRLs into usable logistics support artifacts for Supply Support, Maintenance Planning, Technical Information, and Design Interface.  · Develop product support management procedures and overarching quality management procedures to ensure the processes work effectively.  · Implement quality monitoring or assurance mechanisms to evaluate performance.  · Develop an efficient framework for quality management  · Develop efficient & complain processes for each of the specified areas  · Monitor & control quality, subject to government supervision Minimum Position Requirements · BA/BS Degree  · 3-10 Years of relevant experience  · The ability to research, find, and synthesize information  · Expertise or proven methodology in designing efficient processes  · Expertise in ILS, Logistics Supportability Analysis or Product Support Management, and;  · Excellent Communication Skills, written & verbal  · Detail oriented Security Clearance Requirement Secret (Obtainable) Place of Performance Baltimore, MDCompany DescriptionThe Loch Harbour Group (LHG) is a Certified Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business. For nearly two decades, we have provided versatile, multifaceted professional services to government and private sector clients. Name: Financial Business Analyst
Description: This is an entry-level position.  The Financial Business Financial Analyst will be responsible for performing functions such as heavy analysis of financial information (using Excel), spreadsheet development, and special projects that support the Finance team. Working closely with senior leadership, deliver effective financial modeling results, provide business analysis, and identify revenue optimizing trends in pharmacy financial performance. Extract data and gather information from various sources to perfrom analysis and create reports for senior management based on results.Perform data mining and complex analysis utilizing MS Excel, SQL, and similar tools.Identify trends and revenue enhancement/savings opportunities by analyzing historical billing and third-party claims data (financial and operational).Provide Finance support through creation of reports and anlaysis that provides insight into pharmacy performance and customer profitability.Provide Sales support through creation of customer pricing models and margin analysis.Provide Strategic Sourcing support for vendor programs to achieve expected revenue and purchase savings with all key vendors.Assist in the preparation of analysis for key projects within the organization and other duties as assigned.Provide as needed analysis and reporting to General Managers, Account Management, and Sales as needed.Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or equivalent and 1-3 years of financial/business experience required.Advanced MS Excel skills and abilty to effectively organize large data files is a must. Knowledge of a broad range of other technologies (e.g. SQL, Power Pivot, MS Powerpoint, Acess, etc.) is a plus.Knowledge and experience in healthcare services, insurance , phamacetical industry, or distribution preferred.Superior communication competencies required. Ability to demonstrate and deliver extensive communications with senior level operations management.Strong analytical and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated confidence and abilty to interface with senior leadership. Must be dependable with ability to be flexible, function independently and works under pressure with multiple tasks and deadlines. Must have strong organizational, time management skills, ability to problem solve.

Name: Quantitative Analyst, Retail
Description: DescriptionThe Principal Retail Quantitative Analyst role is responsible for the design, development, and support of Constellation’s customer analytics platform. The Principal will develop new insights through data analysis to drive profit optimization of Constellation’s customer portfolio. The role will orchestrate and execute analysis on large data sets to enable the retail organization to understand its customers, market trends and internal operations through rigorous data governance, consistent data capture and advanced statistical techniques. This role requires the ability to orchestrate and analyze complex interconnections of data from conceptualization through the presentation of both internal and external data sets. The Principal Quantitative Analyst provides leadership, training, and mentorship to less experienced members of the team and organization as a whole.PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES  · Developing queries, methodologies, and files for analyzing and presenting relevant data  · Continuous monitoring, refining, and executing reports/queries and communicating the results to internal partners  · Performing data analysis in support of ad-hoc and recurring requests  · Evaluation of data quality and integrity in each phase of data analysis  · Incorporate new/updated sources of data as appropriate  POSITION SPECIFICATIONSMinimum:- Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Econometrics, Engineering or other quantitative discipline  - Minimum of 5-8 years’ work experience in relevant field  - Experience with broad range of development tools supporting advanced analytics, working in cloud environments (ie. Microsoft Azure, AWS), programming languages (Phython, C#, USQL), and structured and unstructured databases (Oracle, SQL Server, data lake)  - Familiarity with natural language processing techniques  - Ability to understand and build data relationships for performing data analysis  - Ability to quickly understand energy and business concepts  - Strong ability to communicate and collaborate with others  - Understanding of IT infrastructure  - Proficiency with Microsoft Office applicationsQualifications Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Name: Financial Analyst - Sport Category
Description: Under Armour is all about performance. Because what we make empowers athletes in every form to push themselves, to turn good into great, and to stay hungry for whatever comes next. And this is exactly what we expect from each other.  Working with us means one key thing: no matter what you do, you see every day and every project as a chance to push your field forward. In every store and every office, we build teams where everyone is an MVP. And together we tackle every challenge head on. Because we work to push the gear, the game, and ourselves farther.  We're looking for people who do more than good work.  We're looking for the Best in Every Game.  Under Armour is the chosen brand of this generation of athletes... and the athletes of tomorrow. We're about performance - in training and on game day, in blistering heat and bitter cold. Whatever the conditions, whatever the sport, Under Armour delivers the advantage athletes have come to demand.  That demand has created an environment of growth. An environment where building a great team is vital. An environment where doing whatever it takes is the baseline and going above and beyond to protect the Brand is commonplace.  The world's hungriest athletes live by a code, a pledge to themselves and everyone else: Protect This House... I Will. Our goal is to Build A Great Team! Will YOUProtect This House?! SUMMARY: Under Armour's vision is to be the #1 Performance Athletic Brand in the world. To help achieve this goal, we are building a world-class Financial Planning & Analysis team whose focus will be developing core competencies in the areas of FP&A, Decision Support, and Strategy Execution.  The Sport Category Reporting & Analytics Analyst will transform how Under Armour operates by embedding data & analytic insights into our core work processes to provide key insights and reporting that will influence the strategic decisions of our Sport Category leadership teams.  Specific Responsibilities Develop tools to report on key financial metrics for the CPO/Sport Category organization. Deliver a monthly reporting package and visualization tools for teams to analyze key business drivers.Understand business systems (IBPf, COPA, SAP) to pull key financial data.Collaborate cross functionally with FP&A Region leads and Corporate FP&A team to build category forecasts and actuals validation.Partner with IT to automate long term solution.Develop Sport Category P&Ls.Work collaboratively with FP&A Region leads and Marketing to develop virtual P&L for all sport categories.Develop Sport Category business reviews to deliver key revenue and margin insights around future season performance and KPI tracking and current year sell through, market share, and P&L performance.Support the Analytics Manager in managing and reconciling relationships and data with accounting to ensure data integrity.Work cross functionally with Sport Category, Product and Sales teams to share findings and provide key strategic recommendations that drive business decisions.Continue to help innovate business metrics that drive thought provoking conversations and key business decisions.QualificationsBA/BS required in Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or similar degree1-3 years of progressive experience in Finance, FP&A, Pricing or Business Analytics.Advanced Microsoft Office skillset, with emphasis on Excel and PowerpointConsumer Products preferred.Team player with demonstrated ability to lead and influence others outside of their direct-reporting lines.Balance of strategic and analytic capabilities.Strategic thinker with excellent analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving, interpersonal, and relationship building skills.Ability to communicate effectively at all levels and articulate ideas, financial results, and actionable recommendations.Ability to get results in ambiguous/ever changing environment.Demonstrated leadership skills, willingness to "do what it takes" to get the job done-done-done, and commitment to challenging the status-quo to make things better.Consistently producing results that exceed expectations.Expertise in Excel, financial modeling, cash flow valuation, scenario/sensitivity analysis, and ROI, NPV, and IRR analyses.High integrity.Humble & Hungry. Preferred Pursuance of advanced degree highly preferred.Knowledge of descriptive and inferential statistics including but not limited to regression, probability, t-tests, ANOVA, and hypothesis testingSAP, Tableau, SQL, COPA, IBPf experience preferred Under Armour is an equal employment opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to the following legally protected characteristics: race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military/veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal law. We assure you that your opportunity for employment with Under Armour depends solely on your qualifications.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst IT - ETRM / CTRM products
Description: DescriptionPRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION Provide in-depth expertise to solicit functional and technical requirements for projects and/or on-going operations. Act as the liaison to provide IT teams and business personnel with clear understanding of business requirements and business unit’s processes and translate into defined scope. Creates and assigns detailed tasks to subordinates. Resolve disagreements and conflicts constructively, knowing when to escalate and involve others.  - Maintain business acumen within own discipline or function. Name: Lead Financial Analyst Business Analytics
Description: What You Will Do: In this position you will support financial reporting related to Life & Health Insurance. We want you to become one of our technology experts using your skills and experience to help us find new ways to collect and review data, present information, and modernize our processes. Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.
