Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything - people, process, data and things - and we use those connections to change our world for the better.We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more - from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities. Colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.  Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  *LI-KM1

Name: PMO Systems Analyst
Description: The Application Systems Analyst provides managed care system support to various JHHC departments. Within assigned areas of responsibility and with little or no supervision, collaborates independently with business and technical resources to identify, analyze, prioritize, and resolve system issues. This includes providing suggestions for potential application modifications, enhancements, or business process changes as appropriate, as well as advising business and technical counterparts regarding current system functionality. The Application Systems Analyst demonstrates a strong knowledge of one or more business areas and develops functional specifications and operations process flows, department procedures, business requirements, or other necessary documentation for approved system enhancements or modifications.  Must have demonstrated experience supporting all aspects of the administration of Microsoft Project Server or comparable project management information system. Key responsibilities include  Provide application level support as it relates to troubleshooting issues, performing upgrades and maintenance  Understand and assist with gathering requirements for configuration and reporting  Experience with developing and configuring templates and custom fields  Must have experience with the Enterprise Resource Pool and associated capacity planning  Project management experience is desired.Requirements:Education: Bachelors degree in business and management, human resources, information systems, computer science, or another related field, or equivalent experience.B. Knowledge: Knowledge of managed care operations and medical coding systems (e.g., ICD9/10, CPT, HCPCS). Familiar with healthcare / managed care processes and terminology and the basics of information systems support, preferably in the healthcare industry. Experience with SQL query writing and relational database concepts.C. Skills: Proven analytical, problem solving, and computation abilities to assess, prioritize, and solve complex business and technical problems. Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills to effectively interact with all levels of company personnel, vendors, and consultants. Experience with standard word processing and spreadsheet software.D. Required Licensure, Certification, Etc.: NoneE. Work Experience: Minimum of three years' experience working with mainframe, client server, or web based applications in the areas of requirements gathering, requirements definition and analysis, and business analysis, or other general system support tasks.F. Machines, Tools, Equipment: General personal computer and applications; standard office equipmentPay Grade: I8

Name: Process Improvement Analyst
Description: Big Sky is seeking a passionate Process Improvement Analyst to join our team. Enjoy working just like everyone else? This is not the job for you! We want self-motivated, people-oriented professionals who thrive in a high-risk, high-reward environment.Clearance Requirement: SecretJob Mission: Work with a team to analyze, redesign, and implement a streamlined set of mission-critical business processes for a Defense client. This is a high-profile project, directly supporting senior levels of leadership. Here's what you'll be accountable for:Employing various research methods to gain a complete understanding of the current state, including identifying all affected functional areas, departments, stakeholders, processes, and policiesProducing comprehensive current and future state value stream maps of end-to-end processesIdentifying gaps in compliance and areas of inefficiency, including waste and redundancyPerforming quantitative and qualitative strategic assessments and analyses, including root cause analysis, FMEA, cost/benefit analysis, resource analysis, risk ranking, maturity model, and predictive forecastingDeveloping evidence-based recommendations and roadmaps for system and process improvementDrafting project charters, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and other governance/policy materialsFacilitating and supporting implementation of pilot improvement projectsMeasuring process performance and identifying opportunities for continuous improvementInterfacing directly with executive leadershipThis job might be for you if:You enjoy figuring out how to get over, around, or through barriers to success. You're not intimidated by complexity and seek creative solutions to tough problems.You are a critical thinker, willing to dig deep into the root cause of problems.You can quickly grasp complex technical concepts and make them easily understandable to others.You know how to effectively communicate with clients and team members; you are a good listener and you can clearly articulate arguments and key points.You love to work with people and understand that your number one result is to make your teammates successful.You are sensitive to the needs of all stakeholders -- you understand that change can be tough, and you are invested in setting them up for success.You know how to analyze complex data and draw insightful conclusions from it.You measure success in terms of results achieved, rather than hours spent working.You are an expert at juggling multiple priorities and managing your time to get the maximum results.You should have:5-8 years of professional experience, ideally within DoD or ICKnowledge of personnel security practices and processes - desired but not requiredFamiliarity with business process improvement methodologies (e.g. Lean/Six Sigma, ITIL, CMMI, ISO)Experience with business process mapping, performance measurement, data analytics, designing implementation plans, and documenting process improvementsConsulting experience and familiarity with basic management consulting tools, methodologies, and approachesHigh level of comfort with Microsoft tools including Visio and SharePointBachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in a related fieldAn active Secret-level security clearanceOur Values: Everything we do at Big Sky is dictated by our values. We take them very seriously, and we're proud of this unwavering commitment. Results: We get them -- for each other, for our customers, our partners, and our families. Hustle: We don't take "no" for an answer. We don't make excuses. We scrape and claw to make sure the details are always right. We fight like hell for our customers -- because they need us. Curiosity: We question everything, and learn constantly, from any source we can get our hands on. We are smart because we know we don't have all the answers, and because we always want to get better. Respect: We treat each other like adults. We respect what makes each of us unique and productive. We practice honest and ongoing feedback as a way of respecting each other. We know that without ethics (doing the right thing) and honesty, there can be no trust or respect.  All candidates will be required to organize reference calls with at least three recent supervisors. Big Sky is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, disability, age (40 or older), genetic information (including family medical history) or protected Veteran status.

Name: Program Budget Analyst
Description: Duties & Responsibilities: ARMADA has a requirement for a Program Budget Analyst  The Joint Program Executive Office for Chemical, Biological Radiological Nuclear Defense (HQ, JPEO-CBRND).  This position is contingent upon ARMADA's successful capture of the work. The place of performance for this project is at Edgewood, MD. The selected applicant would be expected to relocate for the duration of this contract, which is advertised for one year, with the potential for two, one-year options.  The Budget Analyst shall administer a complex annual budget, which involves receiving, processing, and allocating funding, as well as preparing financial reports.  Some of the supporting actions will include: Forecasting future program financial health.Identifying program line CRA requirements and track financial distribution.Building a Program Objective Memorandum (POM) submission, the IOB, functional support agreements (i.e., DD1144s and Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs), UFRs, and O&O plans.Evaluating financial plans to ensure consistency with program baselines, schedules, and requirements, including the following:Budget executionO&O plansAnnual budget and financial reportsReview and assist in the development of P&R forms for the EnterpriseFuture program financial healthFinancial development of acquisition documentation and program milestone reviewsProgram line CRA requirementsPrepare contract requirements, modification packages, and awards, and provide financial oversight of contract deliverables.Develop Enterprise-level (i.e., JPEO-CBRND and Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) quarterly reviews, especially in relation to financial reporting required to support Chemical and Biological Defense Program (CBDP) stakeholders.Resolve issues and provide authoritative financial analyses.Manage and develop budget execution reports for senior-level leadership (i.e., Flag Officers) as part of their decision-making process.Consolidate exhibits, P&R forms, spend plans, and budget allocation recommendations.Respond to audit requests and track audit requirements for JPEO-CBRND.Develop and review acquisition documentation and program milestone documentation.Participate in milestone and interim program reviews. The Budget Analyst will be responsible for ensuring project deliverables are completed on time and to a level of acceptance from the client. The Analyst will be responsible for relationship building with the client as well as any jurisdiction involved with the project in which they are assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):Possess experience briefing flag/Senior Executive Service (SES) level audiences.Possess a strong capability to operate within the General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS), as well as a systems background and familiarization withComprehensive Cost and Requirement System (CCaRS), Standard Financial System(STANFINS), and Defense Travel System (DTS).Possess a familiarization and working knowledge of the DOD Instruction (DODI) 5000.1 acquisition processes and execution of funding, including appropriations associated with an acquisition program (i.e., RDT&E; Procurement (PROC); and Operations and Maintenance (O&M)).Possess an understanding of Department of the Army (DA) audit requirements and have experience assisting in the response to audit testing and drafting standard operating procedures to institutionalize a climate of audit readiness.Skilled in personal computing (e.g., spreadsheets, word processing, graphics, database management, communication packages, etc.), to include recent work in a DOD-relevant ERP financial system, such as GFEBS.Possess the oral and written communication skills necessary to articulate information in a clear and concise manner, as well as strong organizational, interpersonal, analytical problem solving, leadership, and presentation skills.Be a team-oriented individual with the ability to handle multiple, high priority projects with a keen attention to detail.Be a motivated self-starter with the ability to perform duties and meet deadlines with minimal supervision. LAUTENBERG AMENDMENT: This position is covered by the Domestic Violence Misdemeanor Amendment (30 Sep 96) of the Gun Control Act (Lautenberg Amendment) of 1968. An individual convicted of a qualifying crime of domestic violence may not perform the duties of this position Minimum General Experience/Education:Master's degree or equivalent from an accredited college or university in a discipline applicable to the effort. A Bachelor's degree in a related discipline from an accredited college or university, and eight or more years of qualifying experience can be substituted for a Master's degree.Possess (8) years of experience perfuming a full range of budget functions, applying an expert knowledge of financial management and program principles (i.e., policies, procedures, concepts, standards, terminology, and business operation systems) to execute assignments and projects in a DoD financial resource management office.Must be a US citizen with a current DOD Secret clearance.Disclaimer: The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work to be performed. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the Budget Analyst assigned to this position. Applying: If you feel you have the knowledge, skills and abilities for this position visit our careers page atwww.armadausa.com. Special Notes: Relocation support is not available for this job.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: oral and written communications: 4 years (Preferred)Budgeting: 8 years (Preferred)briefing Senior Executive Service level audiences.: 4 years (Preferred)understanding of DA audit requirements: 2 years (Required) Education: Master's (Preferred) Location: Edgewood, MD (Required) License: Secret Clearance (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Technical Analyst (OMNI Products)
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success. If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price.The Sr. Technical/Analyst (BA) works closely with business team and technical team to gather, clarify and translate business ideas into technical requirements from which the recordkeeping /Omni team can develop solutions following an agile process. The BA is responsible for defining (and/or redefining) business needs for new and/or enhanced products, services or optimized business processes. The BA is an active participant in all phases of the project lifecycle and will be required to work closely with a variety of internal and external business partners to ensure that business requirements are understood, documented and satisfied. The BA generally works on the resolution of production support requests as well as projects of medium to high complexity that touch our record keeping/Omni platform.  DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  o Prior working knowledge of FIS record keeping products (Omniplus, Omnipay, Omnisecurity, etc.) preferred  o Experience with project management and control preferred  o Prior experience in the Financial Services Industry preferred  o Relevant experience working with solutions lifecycle development methodology preferred  o Knowledge of relational databases and concepts preferred  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  o BS/BA degree and 2+ years of related work experience, or Associate degree and 4 years related work experience, or High School diploma/equivalent and 6 years related work experience  o Ability to translate complex business requirements into detailed functional and/or technical specifications  o Demonstrated ability to develop alternative solutions to complex problems and recommend the best solution to the business and project team  o Ability to apply acquired knowledge from prior experience effectively in new situations (medium to high complexity)  o Demonstrated advanced analytical and problem solving skills  o Must be able to meet with clients of varying levels to gather, document, and analyze system specifications and requirements, work closely with developers and testers in the fast-paced environment.  o Ability offer solutions and the business impact to clients in a clear and concise manner.  o Ability to work collaboratively with others in team environment  o Possesses ability to use effective facilitation skills and techniques to elicit requirements from a diverse range of stakeholders and group size  o Demonstrated successful mastery of major components of the solutions lifecycle  o Possesses effective influencing and negotiating skills  o Excellent written and verbal communication skills  o Knowledge of when and how to use business assessment tools (e.g., feasibility studies, business cases and/or cost/benefit, project sizing and costing, and current state analysis/needs assessments)  o Understanding of how the people, processes and technology within an organization interact in relationships and patterns to create a feasible solution on projects of medium to high complexity  o Demonstrated mastery of test strategies, test plans, and test execution  o Process oriented, logical thinker  o Strong negotiation and influencing skills  o Skilled in the use of Visio or other process or flow chart tool  o Strong knowledge of business processes related to business channel supported  o Experience using Microsoft Office Suite  o Experience with Agile development methodologiesT. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

All offers of employment are contingent upon pre-employment drug and background screenings. Only candidates who meet all of the above client requirements will be contacted by a recruiter.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst (Req. 091718.03R-M5)
Description: CLEARANCE: Top Secret/SCI with Polygraph ***Active on Day 1 of Performance*** REQUISITION NUMBER: 070918.03R-M5 FUNCTIONAL / LABOR CATEGORY: Senior Financial Analyst POSITION TITLE: Subject Matter Expert Level II LOCATION: Fort Meade, Maryland DESCRIPTION:The customer base requires financial audit and administrative management service support. This program effort is to provide business financial management, internal controls, evaluation, and analysis. The contract shall provide process discovery, improvement, and implementation; management, administrative, and operational support. Sehlke Consulting will provide expert on-site support in complex financial analysis and accounting reconciliation to identify and recommend solutions to abnormal accounting conditions, tri-annual review and managers' internal control evaluation process management, metrics, and reporting, trend analysis, business and financial process improvements, budget execution analysis and administrative services that allow for rapid response; enabling the sections to meet their regulatory requirements and any other requests from higher-level authorities.EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: BA/BS + 6 (six) years of experience in performing FABS related tasks for commercial or government organizations or 10 years of work experience with no degree. CERTIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS: There are no required certificate for this position. EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS / DUTIES:Responsible to plan, organize, execute, control, and perform project work efforts to result in successful delivery of professional servicesReview of accounts payable transactions.Perform category I and II reimbursable obligations.Perform abnormal transaction analysis.Provide financial management support.Conduct reporting.Perform financial management tasks.Provide financial audit and audit readiness support.REQUIRED:6 (six) years of experience in performing FABS related tasks for commercial or government organizations.DESIRED:Experience with SABRS, SMARTS, GCSS-MC, or PR Builder. Founded in 2011, Sehlke Consulting is a rapidly-growing Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) and Historically Underutilized Business Zone (HUBZone) headquartered in Arlington, VA and an Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength diversity brings to the workplace. Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Name: Global Trade Compliance, Traffic Analyst OTS
Description: Be visionary At FLIR, we have a simple but ambitious mission: to develop market-leading thermal and sensing technologies which enhance everyday life. From saving energy, to saving lives FLIR is making a real difference in our world.  Our products are used in a wide array of situations to rescue people in danger, detect criminals, conserve energy, navigate safely, provide security around the globe, and protect our environment.  We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins. Job DescriptionAssist the Traffic Group with preparation of import and export documents for (SED, CI, P/L, AES filing, etc.) International transactions as assigned.Ensure proper use and administration of approved import/export licenses, exemptions, exceptions.Experience managing carnets.Ability to classify products with HTS/SCHB codes.Tracks status of all import/export transactions to ensure U.S. Customs clearance.Able to apply correct Incoterms to manage risk/responsibilities for each transaction.Work with approved Freight Forwarders to ensure all documentation necessary to ship product is in accordance with Contracts and/or Customer Purchase Order.Assist Licensing (where applicable) with managing costs for freight, duties and associated logistics services.Experience with OCR/EASE Import/Export Modules.Performs other job-related duties as assigned.Requirements:Degree in International Business or associated discipline or equivalent experience and 2 to 4 years international and domestic traffic experience.Knowledge of Foreign Trade Regulations, Harmonized Tariff Schedule, Export Administration Regulations and International Traffic in Arms Regulations required.Knowledge and experience with importing and exporting commerce and defense articles, including drawback.Ability to work both independently and in teams.This position is very detail oriented and requires good analytical and problem-solving skills to assist the Traffic team with a variety of export compliance and logistics issues.Must possess excellent written and oral communication skills. FLIR and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.  FLIR is an equal opportunity employer.Apply Now

Name: Level 1 Operations Analyst
Description: Job Title:Level 1 Operations AnalystLocation:Columbia, MDDuration:Contract to hire (6 months)Description:We are looking for a a level 1 Operations analyst. The incumbent of this position assists with  or performs duties associated with monitoring server for anomalies and notifying  appropriate parties. He/she will follow  will utilized monitoring tools to detect, and troubleshoot issues in order to  maximize system up time.Initially the employee works with higher  level analyst to perform specific, and well-defined tasks and routine  operations designed to orient the employee to the business processes of the  organization. Higher level analysts instruct the employee on methods to use,  what to look for, and what to bring to the supervisors attention. The work performed is highly structured and  reviewed by the supervisor or higher level analyst while in progress.  The supervisor trains the employee by  assigning progressively more complex work to develop skills and experience  geared toward higher level work. After initial training, the employee will  begin to work more independently within established framework of instructions,  practices, and procedures; procedures are verified by a higher level analyst and  outcome is reviewed for completeness and accuracy.  Typical work activities will be to: Ensure all  servers are connected and being monitoredAssist in  maintaining monitoring documentationMonitor system  capacityMonitor performance  and detect problemsPerform  regular server auditsPerform  daily server checksPerform  hourly server checksVerify daily  server tasks have completedNotification  of connection level alertsNotification  of critical order alertsNotification  of critical server level alertsNotification  of non-critical server level alertsCoordinate  communication of severe outages throughout the companyRequired Skills:Knowledge of, and skill in applying, basic IT principles and  practices sufficient to perform routine, entry-level work, communicate factual  and procedural information clearly, orally and in writing, and gather and  analyze basic facts and draw conclusions.  Attention to detail: Is thorough when  accomplishing a task and is conscientious about all areas involved; monitors  and checks work or information and plans and organizes time and resources  efficiently to provide consistently accurate and high quality work.  Customer Service: Works with clients to  assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems,  and manage their expectations; focuses on understanding and meeting clients needs, makes  extra effort to meet customer needs, and follows up on client  complaints/questions/requests; is knowledgeable about the working environment  of client systems and Raptor and is  committed to providing quality results.  Flexibility:  Is open to changes and new information; adapts behavior or work methods  in response to new information, changing circumstances, or unexpected  obstacles; adjusts rapidly to new situations and works effectively on multiple  assignments simultaneously.  Interpersonal Skills: Shows understanding, friendliness, courtesy,  tact, and politeness to others; develops and maintains effective relationships  with others; maintains stable performance and emotional control when dealing  with individuals who are difficult, hostile, or distressed; considers and  responds appropriately to the needs and capabilities of different people in  different situations and treats other with respect.  Communication: Expresses information to individuals or  groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the  information; listens effectively and clarifies information when needed.

Name: International Trade Compliance Analyst
Description: McCormick & Company, Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor and seasonings industry, is seeking a full time International Trade Compliance Analyst on a McCormick Shared Services Finance Team. This new hire will work in McCormick's Global Headquarters, located in Hunt Valley, MD. The International Trade Compliance Analyst will report to an International Trade Compliance Director.　 With more than $4 billion in annual sales, the Company manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry – retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food flavored by McCormick. McCormick makes every moment and meal better™  As a company recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services. Benefits include, but are not limited to, tuition assistance, medical, dental, vision, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing, paid holidays and vacations. POSITION OVERVIEW This role is responsible for the execution of Foreign Trade Compliance activities to reduce exposure to Import and Export violations for the company. Performs analysis and maintenance of origin determination for multiple materials and ingredients. Provides guidance and knowledge to various business units, customers and vendors regarding trade activities. Ensures legal compliance and provides import/export administration and control within government rules and regulations. Interfaces with internal and external customers, freight forwarders, customs officers and other functional areas to ensure coordination and execution of shipments. RESPONSIBILITIESExecution of import compliance activities which includes weekly/monthly/quarterly reporting and analysis. Execution of export compliance activities which includes management of Export government regulations, SPL screening and monitoring system updates.Provide customer service support to Export and sales departments, providing information on requirements of other countries and product registrations.Manage trade program documentation to include NAFTA, vendor declarations, Certificates of origin, and US Returned Goods. Maintain GTS system with up to date information.Conduct audits and ensure business is adhering to execution of customs activities - monitoring for compliance. Reconcile issues as they are identified and implement corrective action as required.Execute testing for GTS upgrades, enhancements and issues that enable and improve business processes.Supports purchasing, export, import, product development, finance and other functions with HTS classifications, origin, trade programs and requirements for importing into and exporting out of the Americas.Performs research and analysis to assign FDA product codes for all food imports in the US. Maintain codes in GTSREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s degree in relevant field, such as International Business, Business, Food Science, Chemistry or Finance OR in lieu of degree, 3-4 years' relevant experience will be considered2 years’ experience in the international import/export trade industry to include majority of aspects of importing and exporting: regulations, Customs and compliance, HTS classification, origin determination, NAFTA, trade preference and other government agencies.Computer systems knowledge including Microsoft Office and Lotus NotesExcellent written and verbal skills with ability to communicate effectively with government agencies, vendors and customersHighly detailed oriented, self-motivated and able to work both independently and with teams. Initiative to follow tasks to completion.Customs related training/CFIA/FDA/USDA knowledge2 years’ experience in trade database and ERP systems, SAP and GTSPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS2 years’ food industry experience in the areas of spices, seasonings and/or flavorings McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.  As a general policy, McCormick does not offer employment visa sponsorships upon hire or in the future.

Name: Budget Analyst
Description: Videos  Duties  Help Help Duties Summary As a Budget Analyst you will formulate, justify, and execute a major segment of the command budget; or, a total budget for one or more funds (i.e. O&MA, RDT&E, APA, or Reimbursable). Learn more about this agency  Responsibilities Monitors monthly obligations, expenditures, and work year limitations for assigned accounts.Analyzes documents and input transactions in General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS).Develops budget for one or more funds such as Reimbursables, Research, Development, Test and Evaluation and Operation and Maintenance.Advises management on policy /regulation changes that impact the budget.Develops budget requirements by advising management on financial requirements.Monitors the end of year budget to ensure funding is appropriately executed and without deficiencies. Travel Required 25% or less - You may be expected to travel for this position. Supervisory status  No  Promotion Potential  3  Job family (Series)  0560 Budget Analysis  Similar jobs  Analysts, Budget  Budget Analysts  Requirements  Help Help Requirements Conditions of Employment Position requires incumbent be able to obtain and maintain a determination of eligibility for a Secret security clearance, or access, for duration of employment.Position requires incumbent be able to obtain and maintain Financial Management Certification Level 2.Position requires occasional travel away from the duty station up to 15% of the time. Qualifications Who May Apply: Only applicants who meet one of the employment authority categories below are eligible to apply for this job. You will be asked to identify which category or categories you meet, and to provide documents which prove you meet the category or categories you selected. See Proof of Eligibility for an extensive list of document requirements for all employment authorities.Current Department of Army Civilian EmployeesPriority Placement Program (PPP), Program S (Military Spouse) registrant In order to qualify, you must meet the education and/or experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document. To qualify based on your experience, your resume MUST describe at least one year of Specialized Experience at the NH-02/GS-11 level in which prepared you to do this work in this job. Specialized experience is defined as 1) Executing funds for various financial programs 2) Preparing a variety of reports utilizing systems such as the General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS) and 3) Providing guidance to management on funding requirements. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service NH-02/GS-11. You will be evaluated on the basis of your level of competency in the following areas:Budget ExecutionDecision SupportFinancial Management AnalysisOral Communication Education  Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. For this job, no substitution of experience is allowed.  Additional information Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.Two year trial/probationary period may be required.Direct deposit of pay is required.Must be able to obtain and maintain a secret security clearance for the duration of employment. This is a Career Program (CP) 11 position.Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.If you are unable to apply online or need to fax a document you do not have in electronic form, view the following link for information regarding an Alternate Application.Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is not authorized, based on a determination that a PCS move is not in the Government interest.Read more  How You Will Be Evaluated You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above. If you are minimally qualified, your résumé and supporting documentation will be compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine your level of experience. If, after reviewing your résumé and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully when applying, errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst Posting Number: 18032DC  Help us provide the solutions that will make a difference.  If you’re willing to take on challenging assignments with a commitment to performance and quality, then BCS, LLC (BCS) wants you to join its team!  BCS, a wholly owned subsidiary of Montero Williams International, has provided support since 1989 to federal and state government agencies and private-sector organizations in the clean energy, environmental systems, defense, national security and transportation sectors. Our award-winning services include business management, technical analysis, communications, and information technology.  Learn more about our company and the exciting opportunities we have to offer by visiting the BCS website. Position Location: Crystal City, VA Summary: BCS, LLC is looking for the best qualified Financial Analyst to join our team to better serve our client in the areas of improving energy planning and management at military facilities. The successful candidate will possess a broad understanding of the renewable energy project finance industry and will serve as a member of the financial team addressing issues associated with large scale renewable energy project development. The successful candidate will be stationed in Crystal City, VA. General Responsibilities:Perform financial cost analysis for large scale renewable energy projects utilizing third party financingConduct sensitivity analysis and incorporate impacts of alternate financing structures, utility rate structures, tax policy, and Federal and state policy supports to provide a comprehensive view of project business casesProvide advice to government efforts to prepare large scale renewable energy projectsDemonstrate strong analytical skills combined with actual industry experience to assess project business and financial issuesIdentify key business risks to successful project and integrates full life cycle cost assessment to guide government assessments of opportunitiesPlan and conduct detailed economic analysis and modeling of current and future electric rates based on capital base maturity, technological change, fuel costs, emission and other regulation, and other macro-economic trendsProvide analysis of current and projected utility tariff schedules and installation load requirementsDevelop strategies for alternate tariff schedules based on peak shaving or other load altering projects supported by detailed financial modelingRequirements:Bachelor degree in FinanceMaster degree preferred3 to 7 years of relevant experienceExperience in analysis of energy consumption, energy rates, life cycle cost analysis and tools used in preparing business case analysis for large scale private investmentsExperience working with utilities, public utility commissions, large government or DoD customersExperience providing financial due diligence or obtaining financing for large scale renewable energy projectsPossess a broad understanding of the renewable energy project finance industryDemonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills BCS, LLC is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, who participates in E-Verify. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, gender, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, or any other classification as required by applicable law.

Because you have:A GPA above 3.0Excellent research, writing, and organization skillsHigh motivation and the ability to work easily in both large team environments and independentlyAbility to analyze, measure and report on program engagement metricsExperience using data to analyze and solve problemsExperience working with PowerPoint, Excel, and WordMotivated, well-organized, detail-oriented and flexibleAble to successfully collaborate with multiple personalities and communicate with all levels of the organizationAbility to work under pressureAbility to interact effectively with people from different culturesInterest in learning how a global channel operates to build marketing programs that can be deployed across international markets and industriesExperience with marketing automation platforms such as Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo or similarWorking knowledge of FileMaker, Tableau and/or other data analysis toolsExperience working with SAP Business One, SalesForce.com, or other similar accounting and/or CRM solutionsWorking knowledge of rational database creation, management and SQLEligibility requirements for internships:Internships require working a minimum of 16 hours per week with a maximum of 40 hours per weekYou must be at least 18 years of age, and enrolled in an undergraduate program entering your junior or senior year, enrolled in a graduate program, or be a recent graduate (no mor than 6 months upon graduation)This is a paid internship and compensation will be based on applicant's qualifications. Name: Sales Technology Analyst
Description: McCormick & Company, Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor and seasonings industry, is seeking a full time Sales Technology Analyst on a McCormick US Flavor Solutions Division Sales Team. This new hire will work in McCormick's Global Headquarters, located in Hunt Valley, MD. The Sales Technology Analyst will report to aSr. Sales Planning & Operations Manager.  　  With more than $4 billion in annual sales, the Company manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry – retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food flavored by McCormick. McCormick makes every moment and meal better™  As a company recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services. Benefits include, but are not limited to, tuition assistance, medical, dental, vision, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing, paid holidays and vacations. POSITION OVERVIEW: As a key member of the Branded Flavor Solutions Commercial team, this position is responsible for directing, tracking, and reporting USFS Foodservice performance (all classes of trade, all customers, all brands and products). This role coordinates with relevant team members across Sales and Marketing to achieve sales and profit goals. Together with Sr. Manager Sales Planning and Operations, develops Food Service Technology Plans for all classes of trade and customers to enhance performance through actionable data. Expected to manage and maintain overall technology strategy for Food Service and develop the future strategic technology plan. RESPONSIBILITIES:Lead for performance and compliance, reporting and tracking for assigned classes of trade with focus on non-commercial business to include review of item mix and customer mix.Lead for external Technology.Review and recommend systems moving forward.Lead for internal sales & operations based technology for Branded Foodservice team including salesforce.comREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:1 – 2 years experience in Sales, Marketing, Technology, Operations, Management or related fields requiredBachelor’s in Business Management, Marketing, Technology, Operations or a closely related field requiredDemonstrated expert-level ability to obtain, compile and analyze data requiredExcellent oral and written communication skills requiredAbility to work independently, learn new tasks, solve problems, and show strong self-motivation and initiative requiredDemonstrated organization, planning skills and a strong attention to detail requiredAbility to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment requiredProficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint requiredPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Experience with SAP, EDW, SFDC, Tableau, TiberSoft or other Food Service based software solutions. McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.  As a general policy, McCormick does not offer employment visa sponsorships upon hire or in the future.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: We are seeking a Financial Analyst to support overall corporate analysis and consolidations of our regional operations. She/he will support the preparation of actual vs. estimate analysis, forecasting, budgeting and strategic planning. In addition, the Analyst will act as the lead on consolidation of regional components and support efficiency initiatives around said processes. The ideal candidate will be naturally curious and look for ways to drive our business forward, thru process improvement and by delivering financially sound business solutions. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Preparation and review of the budget, forecast and analysisMonitoring of Key Performance IndicatorsAssist with systems implementations/enhancements on an as needed basisParticipate in consolidation and reviews with Regional VP’s and business ownersEnsuring standardization of planning process where appropriateProvide timely and accurate information to the executive and other senior managementDevelop ad hoc reports for senior managementAdditional projects as assigned or determinedREQUIRED SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:Works collaboratively with others– strong desire to help others and be a good teammateStrong attention to detailSolution orientedAble to multi-task is a fast moving environment and work with multiple deadlinesProficient in PowerPoint and Excel (Access experience preferred)EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION:Bachelor’s degree in Finance or AccountingTwo to four years of financial planning experienceCorporate planning experience in large to mid-size companiesExperience working with planning cycle, actual versus plan reporting, variance analysis and executive level reportingWORK ENVIRONMENT: Standard office environment.

Name: Mommy Jobs Online - Billing Data Analyst
Description: As a Billing Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for billing operations and our overall revenue cycle objectives. This is a position that affords you the ability to drive processes and improvement initiatives with increasing revenue potential and a reduction of bad debt. By gathering and documenting business requirements and utilizing your sharp analytical skills to fulfill the needs of the business and/or clients, you will have an impact on healing the health care system.Youll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Primary Responsibilities: Gather and document business requirements  Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for the business and clients  Communicate analysis and interpretation to appropriate audience  Produce, publish and distribute scheduled and ad-hoc client and operational reports relating to the development and performance of products, processes and technologies  Supporting the reporting and analytics needs of our multiple billing locations Required Qualifications: 1+ years of experience in the following areas:  Business and / or finance analysis experience  Gathering requirements form the client / business and documenting  Project methodology (requirements, design, development, test and implementation)  Analysis of business process and workflow and providing an evaluation, benchmark and / or process improvement recommendations  Intermediate level of proficiency with Excel and Access Preferred Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration, related field or equivalent work experience  Healthcare Billing experience  Knowledge of GE Products of IDX, Centricity and or Character Cell (or other billing systems)  Knowledge of COGNOS  Ability to communicate analysis including trends and opportunities to clients and the business in writing and verbally  Ability to problem solve including multiple priorities and research conflicting and/or inaccurate data  Pay : $47,000.00 per year  To Become A Member: Please visit mommyjobsonline.com and click on Join Now and select the Medical Coding WAH Job Bank Registry to become a lifetime member to get connected with this client. Please email us your resume after you register with your qualifications and work history.  Please reference agent id code MJOLAMY on your registration submission.  Please feel free to consult with us if you have further job related questions about our company at 1*405*418*6160.

Name: Security Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAligned Development Strategies, Inc. (ADSI) is looking for an Information Security Analyst. Location: Windsor Mill, Maryland 21244 Responsibilities:  - Provide information security consulting to the client's Information Security and Privacy Group.  - Coordinate with the Data Guardian, ISO, Business Owner, and Cyber Risk Advisor (CRA) to identify the types of information processed, assign the appropriate security categorizations to the information systems, determine the information security and privacy impacts, and manage information security and privacy risk.  - Coordinate with the System Developer and Maintainer in identifying the information security and privacy controls provided by the applicable infrastructure that are common controls for information systems.  - Develop and review security and privacy artifacts  - Support Contingency Planning Coordination and Security Assessments.  - Document the controls in the information security and privacy plan (or equivalent document) to ensure implemented controls meet or exceed the minimal controls defined by CISO guidance.  - Evaluate the impact of network and system changes using RMH processes.  Desired Requirements/Skills:  - 3+ years general information technology experience.  - 2+ years of professional experience developing and implementing information security/assurance programs, policies, processes, and procedures per various security frameworks/laws/standards/directives, e.g.: FISMA; OMB directives; Presidential Directives; NIST (SP-800 series; FIPS); HIPAA of 1996; Privacy Act.  - Knowledge of the FISMA, HIPAA laws and Privacy Act of 1974.  - Knowledge of the NIST SP 800 series documents  - Knowledge of the 800-53 security control requirements and standard methods for implementing them.Company DescriptionADSI is a certified small business Information Technology and Management Consulting firm partnering with our clients to meet their business goals. ADSI is devoted to serving the needs of our clients in the federal, state and local government, as well as in commercial sectors. Our Governance, Risk and Compliance services are designed to help our clients achieve exceptional performance through effective management of regulatory, financial, operational and compliance risks. With unmatched dedication and determination, we strive to Administer Dependable Services with Integrity by keeping our finger on the pulse of our clients businesses.

Name: Systems Analyst - Sinai
Description: Under general supervison, assists in research and fact-finding to develop or modify information systems.Requirements: Basic professional knowledge; equivalent to a Bachelor's degree; working knowledge of theory and practice within a specialized field; Computer/Information Systems or related; 3-5 years experience; Microsoft Office Suite; Critical thinking skills; COBOL; SQL or MS Access; Crystal or other report writer; Health care financial systems.Part of LifeBridge Health, Sinai Hospital of Baltimore features state-of-the-art facilities and renowned Centers of Excellence – some with national and international acclaim. As the largest community hospital and the third largest teaching hospital in Maryland, Sinai Hospital's mission is to provide quality patient care, educate medical students and residents, and engage in research to improve the lives of people all over the world. Sinai Hospital is a smoke-free workplace. M/F/PV/IWD Employer  45624 Information Services - 6200  Full-time  Day shift  8:00am-4:30pm

Name: Budget Analyst
Description: DHPC is seeking a Budget Analyst in Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD. Requirements and Experience:Active DoD Secret clearancePerforms various budget functions involving the formulation, justification, and/or execution of budgets for organizations, programs, or projects.This work requires knowledge and skill in the application of related laws, regulations, policies, precedents, methods and techniques of budgeting.Bachelor's Degree- BusinessA minimum of 4 years’ experience in budgetSeven years of experience in budget/finance/accounting can be substituted for a Bachelor's Degree The successful candidate must be a U.S. Citizen and possess and maintain a DOD Secret Security clearance, as a qualification and condition for employment.  DHPC Technologies offers a highly competitive salary and benefits package.  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance  • Paid Holidays/Paid Time Off  • 401k Retirement Plan with Employer Match  • Life Insurance  • Long and Short Term Disability  • Flexible Spending Account  • Discounted Legal Service, Income Protection, Discounted Home & Auto  • And more! Name: Information Assurance Analyst: JPEO-CBD
Description: JOB TITLE: Information Assurance Analyst: JPEO-CBD PROJECT OVERVIEW:This position is contingent upon contract award Information Assurance Support Analysts levels III and IV for a contingent opportunity in Edgewood to provide information assurance support throughout the engineering, implementation, operation, and maintenance of Government systems. Support includes providing strategic guidance, Training, process oversight, Certification and Accreditation (C&A) support and Validation testing. JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Manage information-related risks in enterprise architectures, acquisition strategies, and testing and evaluation, and work to achieve cybersecurity C&AEnsure fielded information systems and networks are defended to maintain confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, and non-repudiation by identifying, developing, and applying risk management framework technical-, operational-, and management-related security controls and protection mechanismsExamine JPEO-CBD programs and system characteristics to develop strategies for compliance, when required, with DODI 8500.01 and DODI 8510.01Guide JPEO-CBD programs in the development of Acquisition Cybersecurity StrategyEnsure that each JPEO-CBD program, when required, has a cybersecurity Strategy that is consistent with DOD policies, standards, and architectures, to include relevant standardsAssist in the identification of CPI in terms of their importance to the program being developedAssist in the identification of foreign collection threats to the program, identify elements that require classification, and determine the phases at which such classification should occur and the duration of such controlsAssist in the identification of Critical Technology and address CPI as well as other relevant information requiring protection, including export-controlled information and sensitive but unclassified informationDocument programs overall cybersecurity approach and requirements, including determining the appropriate C&A process, contributing content for LCMPs, assisting programs in the creation of a SCG, and assisting in the development of PPPsManage the HBSS and install, configure, and maintain computer and network security software, including instances of the ACAS, the DISA STIG Viewer, and other cybersecurity software test and scanning software applicationsDirectly interface with JPM customers, representing SSA in discussions concerning cybersecurity, including (but not limited to) topics which address use of the DISA STIG in the software application and system development process, use of the DISA Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) tool to document program progress during the C&A process, and the Risk Management Framework and its critical alignment with a program's System Development Life Cycle (or Software Development Life Cycle, as appropriate.)Leverage SSA services while working in conjunction with JPMs across the JPEO-CBD to facilitate risk management framework activitiesREQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Security Clearance:Secret Active SECRET ClearanceBachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Management, Information Systems Management, or a related disciplineBe able to obtain the appropriate Risk Management Framework (RMF) Training within the first six months of employment at no cost to the government.Active security-related certification (Certified Authorization Professional (CAP), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), or Security+) or will obtain the certification within the first year of employment at no cost to the Government.Take the International Information Systems Security Certification Consortium (ISC) 2 TM Certified Authorization Professional (CAP) Certification Prep Self Study (11 hours) during on-boarding at no cost to the Government.Possess seven (7) years of experience providing information technology support services, including information assurance.Possess organizational skills. In addition, the contractor shall possess senior level interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.Proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite.DESIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Familiarity with Joint Program Executive Office for Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Nuclear Defense (JPEO-CBRND) programs is desired.WORK LOCATION: Edgewood, MD TRAVEL: 20% KEY WORDS: Joint Project Manager Information Systems (JPM IS), Team: Software Support Activity (SSA) WBB is a technical and management consulting company that provides innovative products and services that solve government and commercial customers toughest problems. For more than 30 years, WBB has set the standard for excellence in consulting services, while providing its employees with an outstanding work environment with ample opportunities for growth and success. WBB continues to enjoy impressive growth, which is directly attributed to the companys hiring practice of always hiring the very best professionals from government, military and industry.We are proud of our diverse environment and are an Equal Opportunity Employer. WBB is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. WBB participates in E-Verify.WBB does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of WBB and WBB will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.

Name: Accounting and Reporting Analyst
Description: OVERVIEW: Do you have a keen eye for detail and pride yourself on accuracy? Do you have efficient time management skills and thrive in a fast paced, goal driven environment? Do you enjoy developing metrics and reports to drive key business decisions? Are you driven to improve scalability and efficiency? WE are looking for YOU ifyou have experience in Financial Analysis, Reporting and Modeling!YOU are looking for US ifyou are looking for an opportunity to become an integral part of an innovative team that emphasizes respect, honesty and accountability. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESinclude the following. Other job related duties may be assigned in conformance with state and federal regulations. Develop, test, implement, and maintain reporting (regular production and ad-hoc) that enables data driven business decisions. This includes generation of monthly financial reporting package. Improve financial status by analyzing results; monitoring variances; identifying trends; recommending potential actions to management. Increases productivity and scalability by developing automated reporting and forecasting tools to include financial modeling for various what if scenarios. Assist Executive Vice President of Finance and Controllers with annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting. Identify financial status by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts. Roll out (publish, educate and train) the Accounting Team on newly developed reporting and analytical tools. Support ad-hoc requests for financial information received from across the firm. Assist with the month end close process and monthly general ledger account reconciliation process.QUALIFICATIONSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and/or Experience:  Strong financial analysis foundation with aptitude for learning and leveraging systems and data sets as well as experience creating forecasts and models. Advanced mastery of quantitative analysis using Microsoft Excel and VBA. Experience with Deltek Vision is preferred. Bachelors Degree in Accounting/Finance/Economics A minimum of five years experience within a service/consulting industry is preferred.Other Expectations: Ability to collaborate with and communicate to high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals. Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize competing demands Team player with high initiative as well as process improvement driven Self-starter with the ability to streamline functions and passion to learn and grow Passion for personal and professional growth for yourself, your team and the firmEEO/AAE

Name: Sr Data Analyst
Description: As a provider of massive data storage, access, and analytics solutions used by some of the world’s largest public and private healthcare organizations, NewWave understands the precious nature of the information we manage. There’s a reason our relationships with these important clients has grown continuously since our founding, and why we frequently out-compete some of the largest systems integrators in the nation. It’s because we always live up to our promise to employ the most rigorous engineering principles in building, integrating, and maintaining secure and cost-efficient solutions, vetting and deploying the most advanced technologies available as they emerge.  NewWave develops and integrates new cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions using the most advanced technologies and current best practices. When it comes to modernizing legacy systems, we like to think of what we do as similar to swapping out the engines of an airliner in midflight — without the passengers ever noticing what happened. Landing clients safely for NewWave means delivering infrastructure and solutions that make data securely accessible to support better services, improve outcomes, and remove unnecessary pain from people’s lives.  The Senior Data Analyst will perform data analysis, interpretation and management duties. Develops rules and methodologies for data collection and analysis for our CMS customer.  Performs duties and responsibilities commensurate with assigned functional area within a department(s) which may include, but are not limited to, any combination of the following tasks:  • Research, interpret, validate and prepare data, information and content used in making business decisions. Performs data collection, analysis, interpretation, and management duties.Develops rules and methodologies for data collection and analysis.Ensures the integrity of project data, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis.Consults with the external clients and internal staff to determine data management needs and objectives.Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of solutions, policies, practices and processes to ensure continuous improvement, good client relations, compliance and adherence to business and system requirements.Prepares presentations that reflect the results of the data analysis.Coordinates with scientists and other technical experts to design and develop statistical analyses methodologies.May provide guidance and work leadership to less-experienced Data Analysts.Maintains current knowledge of relevant technologies as assigned.Recommend improvements to achieve and deliver high quality, value-added services.Participates in special projects as required.  • Knowledge of Federal and State healthcare programs (i.e., Medicaid, CHIP) and related eligibility/enrollment principles and claims dataBachelor’s Degree in a Computer Science, Statistics or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience.5-8 years’ experience working with statistics/data analysis, reporting, or analytic purposes.Knowledge of the principles, methods, and techniques used in statistical analysis (SAS experience required, experience with Medicare data preferred.)Understanding of federal MMIS requirements and CMS Certification requirements preferred.Experience with data analysis techniques, data modeling and data management tools (i.e., MS Excel, SQL language, relational databases) preferred.  Interpersonal Skills  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication, and organizational skills - must be able to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writingShould be extremely facts and data oriented.Should be deadline and closure oriented.Strong persuasion, facilitation and influencing skills.Should be self-driven.Strong analytical, organizational and project management skills.Demonstrated ability to lead and work with cross functional teams including senior level individuals.Must be able to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environment with varying priorities, based on a team building culture.  NewWave is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. NewWave is a proud Veteran friendly employer.

Name: Financial Management Analyst
Description: Videos  Duties  Help Help Duties Summary About the Position:  This position is located at US Army Cyber Command, Budget and Program Division, Fort Meade, Maryland 20755. This is a permanent position. Positions filled in the National Capital Region will relocate to Fort Gordon, GA on/about 2020, but no later than 2022. Learn more about this agency  Responsibilities Administer assigned portions of the organization's budget for one or more funds by analyzing higher headquarters program and budgetary guidance.Execute and monitor assigned portions of the organization's budget.Provide financial advisory services for assigned portions of the command budget via reports, trend analysis, and other financial management products and techniques.Track major funding issues for the organization by serving as the technical expert on all financial regulations. Travel Required Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel 5% of the time for this position. Supervisory status  No  Promotion Potential  12  Job family (Series)  0501 Financial Administration And Program  Requirements  Help Help Requirements Conditions of Employment TOP SECRET/SCI CLEARANCE - You must be able to obtain and maintain a TOP SECRET security clearance based on SSBI with eligibility for access to Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI).DRUG TESTING -This position is a testing designated position (TDP) in accordance with (IAW) Drug Free Federal Workplace Program. You will agree to submit to urinalysis testing on a recurring basis. You are required to sign a DA Form 5019 form.POLYGRAPH - You must be willing to take and successfully pass a Counterintelligence Scope Polygraph (CI/Poly).TDY - Requires approximately 5% TDY (temporary business travel).FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT LEVEL 2 CERTIFICATION - This position requires you to obtain and maintain a financial Management Level 2 certification within the required timeframe. Qualifications Who May Apply: Only applicants who meet one of the employment authority categories below are eligible to apply for this job. You will be asked to identify which category or categories you meet, and to provide documents which prove you meet the category or categories you selected. See Proof of Eligibility for an extensive list of document requirements for all employment authorities.Current Department of Army Civilian EmployeesCurrent Permanent Department of Defense (DOD) Civilian Employee (non-Army)Interagency Career Transition Assistance PlanNon-Appropriated Fund Instrumentality (NAFI)Non-Department of Defense (DoD) TransferOffice of Personnel Management (OPM) Interchange Agreement EligiblePriority Placement Program (PPP), Program S (Military Spouse) registrantReinstatementVeterans Employment Opportunity Act (VEOA) of 1998In order to qualify, you must meet the education and/or experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.GS-09 Minimum QualificationsSpecialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes utilizing managerial/financial systems (such as: General Fund Business System (GFBS); Defense Travel System (DTS); or any DoD accounting system) to obtain data for budget submission; gather, assemble, analyze and prepare strategy for presenting, explaining and documenting the budget request; and recommend adjustments and resolution of budget issues. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the second lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-07). OREducation: Master's or equivalent graduate degree or 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree from an accredited or pre-accredited institution.GS-11 Minimum QualificationsSpecialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes utilizing managerial/financial systems (such as: General Fund Business System (GFBS); Defense Travel System (DTS); or any DoD accounting system) to assist with resolving problems in financial reporting or regulatory requirements; assisting with assuring that budget forecasts, estimates and submissions conform to requirements and guidelines; and assisting with analyze and interpret statutory, regulatory and procedural directives pertaining to the overall financial management program. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the second lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-09). OREducation: Ph.D. or equivalent doctoral degree or 3 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree from an accredited or pre-accredited institution.GS-12 Minimum QualificationsSpecialized Experience: One year of specialized experience which includes utilizing managerial/financial systems (such as: General Fund Business System (GFBS); Defense Travel System (DTS); or any DoD accounting system) to resolve problems in financial reporting or regulatory requirements; assuring that budget forecasts, estimates and submissions conform to requirements and guidelines; and analyze and interpret statutory, regulatory and procedural directives pertaining to the overall financial management program to advise managers of changes to operations. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-11). You will be evaluated on the basis of your level of competency in the following areas:Budget AdministrationFinancial Concepts, Policies, and PrinciplesFinancial Management AnalysisFinancial Management SystemsOral Communication Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-07). Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-09). Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-11). Education FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html.
