Name: Sr. Analyst, Audit
Description: Davis Vision | Superior Vision is a leading provider of vision and eye health solutions offering services to the full spectrum of the vision care marketplace, including employer groups, health plans, and government-sponsored programs. We deliver value to our members through our extensive access to providers and having the industry's broadest, most diverse networks. No other vision carrier comes close to the size, accessibility, and diversity we offer. We have built lasting relationships based on one foundational principle: our members are our highest priority. Every department embodies a member-centric approach to service.  We are an innovative company that is always looking forward and adapting our comprehensive portfolio of products to match -- and anticipate -- what our customers need. We are a true partner with our customers by leading and guiding them to make the best choice. Great Environment We are committed to a culture of delivering outstanding service, provider access, and member and customer value. You'll find a strong commitment to ensuring our culture also embraces quality and continuous improvement. We seek associates who are creative thinkers with fresh insights, who thrive in a dynamic, customer-centric environment. Scope and Purpose of Position: The Senior Analyst works independently in leading the planning and execution of regulatory-based operational audits performed by clients and regulatory / government agencies. The Senior Analyst will partner with the business to optimize audit performance and outcomes. The Senior Analyst will work with management to develop corrective action plans to address audit issues identified by clients/regulators and monitor the progress of remediation through to closure. The Senior Analyst serves as the organization subject-matter expert in preparing for and facilitating CMS audit activities (ODAG / SARAG). Essential Functions: · Facilitate regulatory-based client and third-party audits and assessments to include scheduling, coordination, internal notification, scope determination and oversight  · Facilitate internal notification, training, scope confirmation and continued oversight through to closure  · Subject-matter expert to the organization for ODAG / SARAG CMS audit activities including mock audit activities  · Assists in delivering training and feedback to staff and business process owners on audit facilitation and related processes  · Provides communication of audit results, and supports the development of Company response to report issuance  · Assists in development, monitoring, validation and reporting of all Corrective Action Plans (CAPs)  · Assists in the development of departmental policies and procedures that support compliant departmental operations  · Support the completion of departmental reporting to both internal and external customers  · Support the completion of other audits as needed to meet departmental needs  · Provide project management skills, develop work plans and act as Project Lead for all assigned projects  · Completion of special projects, programs, requests and all required documentation to meet department standards, as needed  · Interface with external customers whenever needed  · Respond to and follow up on Audit Management inquiries received from internal and external customers within established timeframes  · Prioritize essential responsibilities to ensure that business needs are met  · All other duties as assigned Education: Bachelor's degree in related field preferred.  Or equivalent combination of experience and education. Experience: Three (3) years' progressive business operations experience, preferably in managed care or retail optical.  Three (3) years' progressive compliance / regulatory auditing experience, preferably in the managed care environment.  Three (3) years' progressive delegation oversight experience, preferably with URAC and NCQA requirements.  Excellent PC skills; proficiency with MS Office applications including Excel and Access highly desirable. Competencies: · Ability to access, compile and analyze large volume data sets into concise and precise information  · Ability to understand and analyze metrics  · Ability to define business processes into manageable components  · Excellent analytical skills  · Excellent presentation skills  · Strong skills in negotiating, relationship building, problem-solving, and timely problem escalation  · Ability to work independently as well as part of a team  · Ability to multi-task  · Excellent organizational skills  · Ability to work onsite and participate in interactive onsite meetings on a regular and predictable basis  · Ability to initiate immediate interaction, coordination and collaboration with team members, clients, customers etc.  If you are prohibited from working on a government contract, this may disqualify you from consideration for this position. We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all associates and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious beliefs, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability or history of disability, genetic information, status as a protected veteran or disabled veteran, or any other status protected by Federal, state or local law.

Name: Sr. Data Analyst
Description: Softrams is seeking a strong Sr. Medicare Analyst with expertise in Medicare Advantage and/or Part D data and policy. This role is part of a collaborative and agile team that supports and builds modern, standards-based responsive web application for mission-critical health IT solutions. In this key role, you will provide Medicare data and policy expertise to support an effort to develop a web-enabled information system that serves a critical role in the daily operations and high-profile initiatives of the Medicare Advantage (MA) and/or Prescription Drug (Part D) programs. The ideal candidate has strong communication skills, extensive experience with Medicare and other health insurance administrative claims data, experience working with the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), and can provide Medicare policy expertise for a system development team. As a client-facing expert, you will use your knowledge of MA and/or Part D to drive the system requirements elicitation process with CMS staff.Roles and Responsibilities:- Uses expertise in MA and/or Part D to drive the business requirements process.- Demonstrates MA and/or Part D expertise in client-facing requirements development sessions.- Communicates CMS policy and regulations to the team. - Keeps up-to-date with CMS guidance changes. Anticipate effects on the system of regulatory or policy changes. Understands and interprets guidance as it applies to the development effort, and makes recommendations to incorporate necessary changes into the business requirements.- Works with the project manager, system architect, business analysts, and full-stack developers to resolve client issues. - Maintains familiarity with the various MA and/or Part D plan designs, including operations, annual requirements, benefit setups, pharmacy networks, claims adjudication and/or formulary. - Relies on experience, judgment and systems knowledge to accomplish goals. - Leads communication of policy with various internal and external stakeholders throughout the team. Demonstrates exceptional presentation skills; prepares presentations and presents information to client and team.Required qualifications:- Bachelors Degree and expertise in statutory, regulatory, and administrative guidance that governs business requirements for the MA and/or Part D programs.  - A degree in one of the following: epidemiology, statistics, biostatistics, public health, or a health-related discipline preferred. - Excellent oral and written communication skills and must be detail oriented. - Must be able to effectively and professionally communicate to management, peers and customers as well as demonstrate sound judgment/reasoning skills.- Expertise with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, etc.).- Experience with using policy expertise to develop system requirements.- Must be able to obtain a Position of Trust designation.Preferred qualifications:- Two (2) or more years of experience working with any of the following: CMS, MA, Prescription Drug Plan (PDP), cost-based, Program for All-Inclusive Care (PACE), and demonstration organizations and affiliated industry groups, private health and drug plans, pharmaceutical manufacturers, States, consultants and third-party vendors, related federal agencies, and CMS contractors.- Broad knowledge of Healthcare, Medicare & Medicaid systems and data is a plus.- Experience in a CMS system development or policy analysis project a strong plus.

Name: Program Budget Analyst
Description: Duties & Responsibilities: ARMADA has a requirement for a Program Budget Analyst  The Joint Program Executive Office for Chemical, Biological Radiological Nuclear Defense (HQ, JPEO-CBRND).  This position is contingent upon ARMADA's successful capture of the work. The place of performance for this project is at Edgewood, MD. The selected applicant would be expected to relocate for the duration of this contract, which is advertised for one year, with the potential for two, one-year options.  The Budget Analyst shall administer a complex annual budget, which involves receiving, processing, and allocating funding, as well as preparing financial reports.  Some of the supporting actions will include: Forecasting future program financial health.Identifying program line CRA requirements and track financial distribution.Building a Program Objective Memorandum (POM) submission, the IOB, functional support agreements (i.e., DD1144s and Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs), UFRs, and O&O plans.Evaluating financial plans to ensure consistency with program baselines, schedules, and requirements, including the following:Budget executionO&O plansAnnual budget and financial reportsReview and assist in the development of P&R forms for the EnterpriseFuture program financial healthFinancial development of acquisition documentation and program milestone reviewsProgram line CRA requirementsPrepare contract requirements, modification packages, and awards, and provide financial oversight of contract deliverables.Develop Enterprise-level (i.e., JPEO-CBRND and Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) quarterly reviews, especially in relation to financial reporting required to support Chemical and Biological Defense Program (CBDP) stakeholders.Resolve issues and provide authoritative financial analyses.Manage and develop budget execution reports for senior-level leadership (i.e., Flag Officers) as part of their decision-making process.Consolidate exhibits, P&R forms, spend plans, and budget allocation recommendations.Respond to audit requests and track audit requirements for JPEO-CBRND.Develop and review acquisition documentation and program milestone documentation.Participate in milestone and interim program reviews. The Budget Analyst will be responsible for ensuring project deliverables are completed on time and to a level of acceptance from the client. The Analyst will be responsible for relationship building with the client as well as any jurisdiction involved with the project in which they are assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs):Possess experience briefing flag/Senior Executive Service (SES) level audiences.Possess a strong capability to operate within the General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS), as well as a systems background and familiarization withComprehensive Cost and Requirement System (CCaRS), Standard Financial System(STANFINS), and Defense Travel System (DTS).Possess a familiarization and working knowledge of the DOD Instruction (DODI) 5000.1 acquisition processes and execution of funding, including appropriations associated with an acquisition program (i.e., RDT&E; Procurement (PROC); and Operations and Maintenance (O&M)).Possess an understanding of Department of the Army (DA) audit requirements and have experience assisting in the response to audit testing and drafting standard operating procedures to institutionalize a climate of audit readiness.Skilled in personal computing (e.g., spreadsheets, word processing, graphics, database management, communication packages, etc.), to include recent work in a DOD-relevant ERP financial system, such as GFEBS.Possess the oral and written communication skills necessary to articulate information in a clear and concise manner, as well as strong organizational, interpersonal, analytical problem solving, leadership, and presentation skills.Be a team-oriented individual with the ability to handle multiple, high priority projects with a keen attention to detail.Be a motivated self-starter with the ability to perform duties and meet deadlines with minimal supervision. LAUTENBERG AMENDMENT: This position is covered by the Domestic Violence Misdemeanor Amendment (30 Sep 96) of the Gun Control Act (Lautenberg Amendment) of 1968. An individual convicted of a qualifying crime of domestic violence may not perform the duties of this position Minimum General Experience/Education:Master's degree or equivalent from an accredited college or university in a discipline applicable to the effort. A Bachelor's degree in a related discipline from an accredited college or university, and eight or more years of qualifying experience can be substituted for a Master's degree.Possess (8) years of experience perfuming a full range of budget functions, applying an expert knowledge of financial management and program principles (i.e., policies, procedures, concepts, standards, terminology, and business operation systems) to execute assignments and projects in a DoD financial resource management office.Must be a US citizen with a current DOD Secret clearance.Disclaimer: The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work to be performed. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the Budget Analyst assigned to this position. Applying: If you feel you have the knowledge, skills and abilities for this position visit our careers page atwww.armadausa.com. Special Notes: Relocation support is not available for this job.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: oral and written communications: 4 years (Preferred)Budgeting: 8 years (Preferred)briefing Senior Executive Service level audiences.: 4 years (Preferred)understanding of DA audit requirements: 2 years (Required) Education: Master's (Preferred) Location: Edgewood, MD (Required) License: Secret Clearance (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Program Financial Analyst, Jr.
Description: Program Financial AnalystWhat you will be doing! The Program Control Analyst will be responsible for the day to day program financial analysis function for programs assigned, including but not limited to the following: Perform financial analysis and prepare internal and external reports in order to ensure that contracts are within negotiated and agreed-upon parameters and government cost and schedule performance guidelines.Assist Program Office in the planning, tracking, analysis and reporting of projects of varying size, complexity, and contract type.Develop and maintain budgets, forecasts, cost/schedule baselines, estimates at completion (EACs).Support Basis of Estimate (BOE) development.Variance Analysis to plan and forecast on major metricsPrepare delivery order/task order pricing and realignment requests for customer approval.Ensure adequate funding availability by maintaining accurate records of expenditures, open commitments, preparation of expenditure projections, and assisting in submitting timely requests for additional funding to the government.Establish project workforce and rates in Deltek Costpoint, including ensuring contractual modifications are up-to-date and changes to workforce is maintained.Issue charge authorization documents as appropriate.Reconcile and track personnel charging against authorization; facilitate and monitor corrections, when needed.Prepare month-end journal entries in Deltek Costpoint, as well as ensure proper recognition of revenue as it relates to project finance.Significant collaboration with Program Managers, Accounting, Contracts & Procurement personnel, senior technical personnel, and other internal functions or support departments.Participate in regular program reviews providing financial information as neededWhat you will needShould have minimum of 3 years of financial analysis experience working in a government contractor environment.Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skillsMust be able to work independently and as a key member of a teamMust be able to handle multiple tasks/projectsEffective and clear communication and presentation skillsExperience with all Contract Types (T&M, FFP, CPFF, CPAF, including incentive)Demonstrated working experience of Deltek Costpoint Project module; specifically project set-upAdvanced experience with Microsoft Excel, Word, and Powerpoint.Strong financial background Education: BS/BA in Business Administration or a related discipline. (Experience may be considered in lieue of degree)Clearance Ability to obtain TS/SCI with appropriate polygraph required.  (Current TS/SCI with appropriate polygraph preferred.)Who are we? Praxis Engineering* was founded in 2002 and is headquartered in Annapolis Junction MD - with growing offices in Chantilly VA and Aberdeen MD.  Praxis Engineering is a consulting, product, and solutions firm dedicated to the practical application of software and system engineering technologies to solve complex problems.  With over 350 employees supporting more than 50 contracts, Praxis brings together world class engineers with proven engineering best practices, domain expertise, commercial technologies and proven agile management approaches to create high value solutions aimed at helping our customers meet their most critical business and mission objectives. *Praxis Engineering is a wholly owned subsidiary of General Dynamics IT. Why Praxis? We are focused on continual learning and evolution. We don’t do things because “that’s the way we’ve always done things”; we listen to our employees and adapt to the changing marketplace. We look at the big picture and encourage our engineers to get training and certifications in emerging technologies that will help shape our customer’s mission. We've been profitable year after year. We're always on the lookout for great engineers to join the team and we recognize that our employees are the heart and soul of what we do. We focus on recruiting talented people, treating them right, and then allowing them to do what they do best. No red tape. No micromanagement. Smart people want to work with smart people, and we love people who are passionate about what they do, and finding ways to do it better.  And then there is the... BenefitsCompetitive salaryOffice perks such as free soft drinks and snacks (both healthy and not-so-healthy)Praxis swag (annual gift certificate to purchase top brand Praxis apparel)Comprehensive health insurance plan401(k) retirement plan with company paid contribution (amount equivalent to 7% of your salary)Annual bonus planFour weeks Paid Time Off + 10 holidays + comp time eligibilityTraining is a priority! Take advantage of our endless in-house training opportunities - or seek out vendor offered (paid) training opportunities like conferences, certification courses and seminars.Conferences(recently attended by Praxis employees): AWS Summit, IoT World, Black Hat and DefCon.Training & Certifications:Splunk, AWS, Big Data/Cloudera, VMWare, Scrum Master...the list of certifications goes on and on!Praxis University:Cyber Research, Data Analytics, IoT, AWS and RedHat course offerings and hands-on training.We truly believe the right work-life balance can exist, and it's here at Praxis. Our work is extremely important, but your job is just a part of who you are. When you enjoy your life outside of our walls, you're at your best the next time you walk through our doors. We do all we can to assure that happens every day.Praxis Engineering provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, age, disability

Description: Paradigm Infotech is seeking to recruit a self-motivated and qualified professional for the following position. Analyze user needs, align with data gathered and develop solutions. Name: SIGINT Analyst
Description: If you enjoy targeting networks and finding vulnerabilities, consider growing with our team of experienced analysts to help us enable SIGINT collection and dissemination. You will research, assess, evaluate and analyze digital network information using network evaluation and analysis. At Fortego, you will embark on a journey of exciting, impactful & highly technical work with good people that treat you like family.If this is up your alley, and you’ve got the skills listed below with a TS/SCI with a Polygraph, we encourage you to apply. We will contact you within 3 business days of your application.As an ideal candidate, you will have the following skills: Experienced with SIGINT DNI/DNR methods, including digital network characterization, reconstruction and mappingExperienced networking concepts, TCP/IP Ports and other networking fundamentalsKnowledge of agency databases and toolsConduct trend analysis to determine target behavior patternsUse traffic analysis to identify communication patternsExperience with vulnerability assessments, exploitation techniques, or forensic analysis a plusRequired qualifications:TS/SCI with a PolygraphLooking for junior, mid, senior level engineers & analystsThe benefits:Rewarding your hard work: Referrals, sign on, profit sharing, quarterly awards… need we go on?Generous training budget: Designed by you.PTO that has your back: For the families and the unbounded adventures, from furloughs to inclement weather, we are there.Top-notch health care and 401k package: If these drive you, this is your stop.Something always going on: Team lunches, happy hours, fantasy leagues, game nights, homebrew competitions and monthly family events.We support innovation: Got an idea? Want to learn something new? Whatever it is we will help see it through.About FortegoFortego helps solve some of the most difficult cyber issues the world faces today. Our employees spend their working hours deep in the trenches handling the most critical and exciting challenges on the national security front. As for the other hours of the day, you will find Fortego employees kicking back and enjoying benefits that span from family activities to sporting events, supporting veterans in the community, and exploring new tech.Fortego is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Microwave Telemetry, Inc is an established global leader in the design and manufacture of miniature tracking devices for endangered species. Our loyal customers depend on our products to collect data via satellite for their research to understand and protect wildlife.  We seek a hard-working, curious, self-motivated, organized individual for a full-time position at our biotech company centrally located between Baltimore and Washington, DC. Qualified applicants should have a background in biostatistics, statistics, mathematics, data-management, with an interest in biology, ecology, or zoology. A master's degree and experience with scientific data analysis, managing large datasets, and the scientific peer-review publication process, is preferred. The successful candidate will have a working knowledge of Microsoft, basic programming and code-writing in R.  We offer full employer-funded medical/dental, profit sharing 401(k), life insurance policy, educational reimbursement, and a BJ's membership. Willingness to work in a team environment and possession of effective communication skills are a must in our friendly, family-like atmosphere. Additionally, any candidate should have well-developed writing skills; this is necessary for proper communication with customers, scientific research collaborators, and co-workers.  If you are excited about being part of the work we do, and you have the experience we require, we can't wait to meet you. Please submit your resume (or CV) and a cover letter with salary requirements and answers to the following questions: Please give some examples of scientific data you have analyzed?Tell us a little about a large dataset you managed?Please provide examples of your experience effectively supporting internal and external customers working with or troubleshooting complex data or data analysis.Please note: Phone calls and emails to staff regarding this job opportunity are not accepted. Equal Opportunity EmployerJob Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Counter Terrorism Intelligence Analyst
Description: MOSAIC is seeking an Intelligence Analyst in the Annapolis Junction, MD area to recommend solutions to and track progress on systemic issues which impede the efficient prosecution of the counter-terrorism mission.  Job Responsibilities: Research, investigate and evaluate existing and emergent software and hardware tools to enhance situational awareness and operations support functions.Such support may also include, but is not limited to, the areas of business process improvement, technical and analytic process definition; and tools, database and web administration.Provide support to the planning, enhancement and sustained operation of the Counter Terrorism MissionAbility to effectively present technical information to highly technical reviewers in oral and written formatsProduce analytical information reports from reviews of investigative and Intelligence Community database searches in support of ongoing investigations and insider threat reports Minimum Requirements: Eight (8) years professional experience and training in SIGINT production or SIGINT support rolesFour (4) years prior technical responsibilities associated with identifying, coordinating, and tracking solutions to a variety of issues ranging from (but not limited to) VTC, phone, computer systems supportSubstantial professional intelligence writing, presentation preparation, and briefing experience.Must be able to work monthly rotating shifts of Monday-Thursday 0400 – 1400 or Tuesday-Friday 1200 – 2200.Active TS/SCI with Polygraph is requiredBenefits:Medical, Dental, and Vision InsuranceFlexible Spending Accounts (FSA)401(k) Matching Program10 Paid Holidays and PTOShort-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability paid for by MOSAICTerm Life InsuranceTraining and Career Development Reimbursement OpportunitiesReferral Incentive Program At MOSAIC Technologies Group each team member is a key player. MOSAIC provides consulting and technical services to Government and commercial clients in the areas of management, mission and technology. We know the value of our talent, and we work to provide challenging opportunities for each member that will cultivate careers as well as develop people. Our familial environment, competitive salary and benefits are a few of the ways that we take care of our people. If you believe in supporting your community, growing your career and working with committed colleagues then join us. MOSAIC wants you in the family.

Name: Test Analyst
Description: Test Analyst (SEC3T-18-1845-W)  Bowhead seeks a Test Analyst to support our CECOM project at Aberdeen Proving Ground in Aberdeen, MD. The Test Analyst will define, document, analyze, perform, and interpret developmental tests for new and/or modified products or product components Essential Functions to include:Must be able to investigate and resolve operational problems in conjunction with other engineering and technical personnel. Bowhead seeks to network with qualified individuals relative to a potential opportunity, which is contingent upon award and not currently funded. Please click the link at the bottom of this posting to apply for consideration. Incumbent employees are encouraged to respond. No solicitations or third party applications will be accepted.  Bachelor Degree in Electronics Engineering or any other Scientific or Technical discipline and seven years of relevant work experience as a Journeyman Test Analyst.  Must be able to defines, documents, analyzes, performs, and interprets developmental tests for new and/or modified products or product components. Name: Intelligence Analyst (Top Secret/SCI Clearance)
Description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking a Research Analyst Level I/II to become an integral part of our team! You will assist social scientists in educational research and data analysis.  An ideal candidate would be a soldier (MOS - 35F) PCSing from the Army into a civilian. Responsibilities:Provide research and analysis of existing and emerging threats and vulnerabilitiesGather qualitative and quantitative social science dataConduct statistical analysis on research data collectedCollaborate with others management to identify research needsTranslate complex data into simple textual and visual representationsSummarize findings into presentations and reportsQualifications:Bachelors Degree and 4 years intelligence experience minimumPrevious experience in social sciences, educational research, or other related fieldsFamiliar with fundamental research practicesDeadline and detail-orientedExcellent written and verbal communication skills Company DescriptionAbout NETS  Nelson Enterprise Technology Services, LLC (NETS) is a successful, Minority Owned 8(a) and Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) - certified by the Center for Veterans Enterprise focused on providing Next Gen IT software, infrastructure, health staffing and IT solutions, systems engineering, networking, and other professional support solutions to our Federal, Civilian, and State and Local customers. NETS provides innovative solutions to meet complex, challenging requirements spanning enterprise communications and networking, interoperability, IT security and information assurance, e-government, e-health, systems design and development, and project management.  NETS utilizes emerging network technologies by providing cost-effective and efficient options for our clients to meet and often exceed their key IT and network business objectives in support of their mission while enhancing technology in daily operations. Our growth and success are a direct result of the passion our engineers bring to each engagement, and our ability to utilize our customers' existing investments enhanced with state-of-the-art technologies that continually improve services and demonstrate a passion for doing more with less. Team NETS, consisting of skilled, qualified technical and management professionals, managers, technical subject matter experts, and system specialists, are among the best in their fields. We are organized to provide maximum responsiveness and total quality management to clients while consistently delivering measurable results - on time, within budget, and without surprises.  Our Benefits  Benefits are effective Day 1 of your employment with NETS. Our reputation is built upon the talents and integrity of our employees. We value the contributions of each and every person that is a part of our organization. We offer exciting, challenging career opportunities, competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package to include the following: 10 Paid Company Holidays Annually15 days a year of Paid Time Off (PTO) Annually for new employees (accrued)Comprehensive Medical and Dental CoverageTuition & Professional Certification Support401(k) planFlexible work arrangements, where possible

Name: Management Analyst
Description: Videos Duties Help  Help  Duties  Summary About the Position: This position is in the Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). Employees occupying DCIPS positions are in the Excepted Service and must adhere to U.S. Code, Title 10, as well as Department of Defense Instruction 1400.25. This position is with the US Army Intelligence & Security Command, 780th Military Intelligence Brigade responsible for planning and organizing manpower requirements and authorizations.Learn more about this agencyResponsibilities Maintain the Personnel and Equipment portions of Brigade-level Tables of Distribution and Authorization (TDA) and Mobilization TDAsAnalyze mission and function changes, doctrinal changes, programmed strength changes, and systems integration for impact on force structureReview manning documents and adjustment documentation for legality and reasonablenessStudy manpower and equipment survey reports, organizational structure, and authorization documents to assure conformance of plans with DA requirement or INSCOM programsMaintain contact with the National Security Agency (NSA) and Department of Army (DA) to provide information on current manpower and equipment authorizationsConduct studies related to the validity of concepts, organizations, and requirements including the feasibility of establishment, consolidation, reorganization, or discontinuance of Brigade units Travel RequiredOccasional travel - You may be expected to travel up to 15% for this position. Supervisory statusNo Promotion Potential13 Job family (Series)0343 Management And Program Analysis Similar jobs  Analysts, Management Management Analysts Requirements Help  Help  Requirements  Conditions of Employment Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.Two year trial/probationary period may be required.In accordance with Change 3 to AR 600-85, Alcohol and Drug Abuse Prevention and Control Program, individual must successfully pass a urinalysis screening for illegal drug use prior to appointment and periodically thereafter.Must be willing to undergo and successfully complete a counterintelligence-scope polygraph examination with No Deception Indicated (NDI) on a pre-appointment and periodic basis.Must be able to obtain and maintain a TOP SECRET security clearance based on a Single-Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) with eligibility for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI).Must be able to obtain and maintain access to National Security Agency (NSA) facilities and networks.Temporary duty (TDY) travel may be required 15% or less.All INSCOM employees may be subject to extended TDY or worldwide deployments during crisis situations to perform mission essential functions as determined by management. QualificationsWho May Apply: Only applicants who meet one of the employment authority categories below are eligible to apply for this job. You will be asked to identify which category or categories you meet, and to provide documents which prove you meet the category or categories you selected. See Proof of Eligibility for an extensive list of document requirements for all employment authorities. 10-Point Other Veterans? Rating30 Percent or More Disabled Veterans5-Point Veterans' PreferenceCurrent Army Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) EmployeeCurrent Department of Army Civilian EmployeesCurrent DoD Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) Employee (non-Army)Current Permanent Department of Defense (DOD) Civilian Employee (non-Army)Disabled Veteran w/ a Service-Connected Disability, More than 10%, Less than 30%Non-Department of Defense (DoD) TransferPrior Federal Service EmployeeUnited States Citizen Applying to a DCIPS Position Army DCIPS positions apply Veteran's Preference to preference eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement.  In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience.  To qualify based on your experience, your resume must describe at least one (1) year of experience which prepared you to do the work in this job. Specialized experience is defined as experience conducting manpower studies and surveys, analyzing findings, and making recommendations to establish the most effective and efficient organization with a working knowledge of national level budget, acquisition, strategic policy, and manpower constraints as they affect force modernization and design. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level in the federal service (GG/GS-12).  You will be evaluated on the basis of your level of competency in the following areas: Change ManagementCommunicationsOrganizational Development EducationThis job does not have an education qualification requirement. Additional information Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.Direct Deposit of Pay is required.Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees.If you have retired from federal service and you are interested in employment as a reemployed annuitant, see the information in the Reemployed Annuitant information sheet.This is a Career Program (CP) 26 position.Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.When you perform a Civilian Permanent Change of Station (PCS) with the government, the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) considers the majority of your entitlements to be taxable. Name: Program Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe purpose of this job is to aid the Program Management organization in a staff capacity by analyzing and reporting on  program cost and schedule metrics, assisting in budget preparation and control, records control, and special management  studies. The Program Analyst will be part of the program management team and whose core responsibility is to collect  and analyze data enabling successful project, program and aftermarket services execution.Duties and ResponsibilitiesDevelop, plans, schedules and budgets to meet contractual requirements for large or more complex projects and programs.Develop/maintain methods for tracking and reporting project and program status and contract deliverables.Support the P&T, Programs, Aftermarket Services, Operations and Finance groups in generation of cost proposals and pricing sheets.Provide support to broader Project and Program teams to include assisting in project scheduling, budget management and coordination of graphic presentations.Interface with all levels of internal personnel, customers and vendors to coordinate CDRL deliverables, budgets and schedules.Generate weekly labor status reports and verify charges against program expectations.Develop/maintain Earned Value Management System (EVMS) metrics; facilitate the identification/documentation/maintenance of a Risk Register; support project and program financial analysis/tracking/reporting; facilitate the collection/analysis/documentation of metrics/delivery statistics/invoicing on Aftermarket Service projects and programs within Company specified thresholds.Compile, store and retrieve management data from SAP and present in readable format.Work with Project, Program and Aftermarket Services Managers to generate, explain, and support estimates to complete.Support Project, Program and Aftermarket Service Managers data request to support answering customer questions.Follow and adhere to all company Program Lifecycle Management (PLM) and Product Lifecyle Process (PLP) policies, procedures, and reporting criteria.Comply with all applicable U.S. export control and security regulations.Complying with and promoting all relevant legal requirements & Smiths policies and procedures, including business ethics, data protection and health & safety.Required Skills and ExperienceEducation/Training:? BS or BA degree in Business Management, Finance or Accounting or other related educational field. May accept significant demonstratable prior experience in lieu of degree.PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PBA-PMI) Certification DesiredPMI and PBA-PMI Training Required as part of job function. Experience: 2+ years relevant experience in a project support role. Knowledge Skills/Other Attributes:? Working level proficiency in MS Office Suite (e.g., MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Project) and SAP.Demonstrated work experience desired and working knowledge with Earned ValueManagement Systems (EVMS), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Systems, Risk Management Systems, and Finance Management and Analysis. This position requires access to ITAR, EAR, and Department of State or Department of Commerce controlled information and routine access to a cleared facility. Applicant must be a U.S. Person (citizen, green card holder or other permanent resident).  ?Work Environment DetailsWork environment is an office environment located on-site with the Edgewood MD Smiths Detection  Inc. campus during normal or extended business hours. Required to travel on an as needed basis only.About UsAt Smiths Detection we are dedicated to making the world a safer place.  Smiths Detection, a division of Smiths Group, is a global authority on the application, management and manufacture of world class detection and screening technology.  We deliver solutions needed to protect society from the threat and illegal passage of explosives, prohibited weapons, contraband, toxic chemicals, and narcotics. Delivering an unrivalled range of detection technologies, we support customer from markets across air transportation, ports and borders, the armed forces, and critical infrastructure and emergency services.  Smiths Detection is an EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled. Smiths Detection, Inc. participates in the Electronic Employment Verification Program.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst Category: Finance Job ID: 12941 Location: Annapolis, MD Posted Date: September 18, 2018Apply  Keep Me In Mind  Add to CartRequisition ID: 12941  Want to work with some of the most talented, dedicated people on the planet? Do you value relationships, commitment, innovation and integrity? Want to be a part of a company that has been named numerous times as America’s Best Employer in Aerospace and Defense by Forbes magazine?  Then Rockwell Collins is the place for you. Join our team and build a rewarding career while helping to deliver the most trusted source of aviation and high-integrity solutions in the world.  We are currently searching for a Financial Analyst to join our team in Annapolis, MD (IMS INC) (5010). Employing some of the most talented, dedicated people on the planet is not by chance. People from all over the globe choose Rockwell Collins as the place to build a rewarding career, while helping create and deliver communications, integration, and engineering solutions that our global customers demand so that our world keeps moving and stays connected. It’s an exciting time to become a part of our team. Join us and discover how high your career can soar at Rockwell Collins.Job Summary  The position will provide financial planning and analysis services and support directly to senior financial management, business unit leaders, and project managers.  Job Responsibilities Prepare and analyze inputs for monthly sales and profit forecasts, and perform same effort for Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and Strategic Financial Plan (SFP) as assignedProvide variance analysis of monthly sales, costs, and profit forecast in comparison to prior period and plan. Perform same effort for AOP/SFP.Perform a detailed analysis of cost estimates identifying inconsistencies and issues. Makes comparisons to the results of other programs and points out potential issues.Responsible for the documentation of moderate financial and cost/benefit analyses, and assisting others with complex analyses. Ensures compliance with internal procedures and regulations.Review and monitor a variety of contract types including Fixed Price, T&M, Cost Plus, and Service. Ensures compliance with internal procedures.Responsible for supporting scheduling activities of smaller programs or a portion of larger program.Monitors and reports performance against plans to ensure the contractual, cost and schedule objectives are met. Attend project reviews, analyze information provided for potential financial impact and provide financial guidance to Project Managers.Special projects and ad hoc analysis as required. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or in the absence of degree 6 years of related experience.Three (3) more years of experience in financial analysis, accounting, or related business experience.Advanced knowledge of excel and other financial analysis tools. Skills desired for success Possess strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills.Ability to work independently with strong attention to detailAbility to meet strict deadlines Desired Experience: Experience with project based businesses and project cost accounting.Costpoint accounting system.BPC budgeting and consolidation tool (SAP Business Planning & Consolidation).At Rockwell Collins, we believe a solid work-life balance creates a healthy lifestyle and inspires creativity and innovation. We value our people and invest in their development, growth and success at our company by providing development opportunities through Rockwell Collins University, networking, mentoring, and tuition reimbursement.  And that’s just for starters.  Some of our competitive benefits package includes: Medical, dental, and vision insuranceThree weeks of vacation for newly hired employeesCompany-paid winter holiday shutdown for most locationsGenerous 401(k) plan that matches 62.5 percent of the first 8 percent of eligible compensation you contribute (or 5 percent if you save 8 percent)An Incentive Pay Plan based upon company performanceTuition reimbursementAnd more Interested yet? Apply now and embark on your next worthwhile adventure!  Rockwell Collins is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.

Name: Software Implementation Consultant - Local Remote!
Description: The Squires Group has an exciting direct hire, primarily remote, opportunity for a Software Implementation Consultant. Are you innovative and ready to learn a new data management platform that helps companies solve big problems and manage billions of dollars in single instances?  Our client is an award-winning firm, and their CEO was a finalist for the SmartCEO magazine GovStar Award. As a new, cutting-edge, data management platform provider that helps companies solve problems quickly, our client supports many U.S. Government and Fortune 500 clients. In this role, you will become an expert with their unique platform, and work with clients to implement the software that captures and communicates crucial information to make important data-driven decisions fast.  Our client offers excellent benefits, including paid health insurance for employee and family! This role is primarily remote, with once per week presence needed onsite in Columbia, MD or Alexandria, VA. Candidates must be local to MD/DC/NOVA. Per our Federal Government Contract, candidates must be U.S. Citizens and able to obtain a Secret clearance. 5 years of experience with the following:Oracle PL/SQLHTMLData ModelingExcellent customer facing skillsPer our Federal Government Contract, candidates must be U.S. Citizens and able to obtain a Secret clearance.Preferred QualificationsKnowledge of Enterprise Architecture, IT Portfolio Management, Asset Management and/or Metadata ManagementTS/SCI clearanceA Thousand Reasons to Give Referral Program:Refer a friend, and you both can earn $1,000 if we place them in a new job opportunity! If you see a position posted by The Squires Group and know the perfect person for the job, please click here to send us your referral.The Squires Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Name: STARLIMS Data Analyst
Description: Knowesis is seeking highly motivated and qualified individual for the position of STARLiMS Administrator. As an Administrator, you will provide on-site support for an Enterprise STARLIMS Application (ELIMS) used at (6) global Army Installations throughout the world. The Administrator will work with IT and Laboratory Automation Team Members and LIMS Administrators providing LIMS and STARLiMS operational support. Responsibilities involve the daily management and operational maintenance and support, development support, and proactive/preventative analysis of systems. The Administrator will demonstrate knowledge of key laboratory operations, quality systems/processes, products and services.  Knowesis, a Service Disabled Veteran Owned (SDVO) (CVE certified) and Small Disadvantaged Business (SBA certified 8a), is looking for subject matter experts to supplement and enhance the existing workforce and training and operational support for the U.S. Army Public Health Center (APHC) located at Aberdeen Proving Ground in Edgewood, Maryland. The APHC's mission is to promote health and prevent disease, injury, and disability of Soldiers and military retirees, their families, and the Department of the Army civilian employees; and assure effective execution of full spectrum veterinary service for Army and Department of Defense Veterinary missions. Job Responsibilities:Must have strong verbal and written communications skills to interact with team members and clients dailyMaintain and support existing client systems and applications.As part of a team assist in the design and implementation of web applications, prototypes, and user interfaces.Analyze client business requirements to translate needs into technical requirements.Engage in critical problem solving.Implement tasks in accordance with schedule.Continuously improve skills, adapt emerging technologies, and apply best practices. Experience and Skills Required Qualifications:BS Degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Engineering or Computer Science or related fields and demonstrated comparable experienceExperience working with Commercial or Pharmaceutical Industry or DoD military and civilian customersKnowledge and experience with all aspects of STARLiMS application, including: configuration, testing, implementation, deployment, and operations and maintenanceKnowledge and experience with analytical instrumentation and equipment used in controlled substance/drug analysis and various output of such devices;Assist in the planning and implementation of application releases, data changes, and configuration changesExcellent written and verbal communications skillsExcellent organizational skillsExperience working with SQL and XMLLIMS Application Experience (Preferably STARLIMS)Lab Instrument Experience (Preferably Support Experience)Benefits About Knowesis  Founded in 2007, Knowesis Inc. has been providing data driven decisions and solutions to federal healthcare clients from day one. Our core capabilities include analytics and information management, planning and operations, and communication and engagement strategies. Knowesis' highly qualified, customer-focused professionals are committed to providing information and advice to enable client success through holistic, thorough, thoughtful, and aligned approaches. Our clients leverage these capabilities to support data driven decisions for their key business functions. Knowesis is dedicated to earning the loyalty of clients and staff through work ethic, collaboration, and humility. Our intent is to be a positive impact to our clients, team, and community.  Knowesis is Service Disabled Veteran Owned (SDVO) (CVE certified) and Small Disadvantaged Business (SBA certified 8a) with offices in San Antonio, Texas and Fairfax, Virginia. We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package inclusive of medical, dental, and paid time off.  For more information about working with Knowesis, please visit our website at http://www.knowesis-inc.com.  Knowesis is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. Knowesis will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, Knowesis will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.SDL2017

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job Description: Analyzes project requirements in the areas of business management, financial management, program scheduling, milestone tracking, critical path analyses, and support requirements, and performs other related analyst/management activities required for successful completion of required tasks. Assists with impact studies, cost/benefit analyses, dependency models, and project tracking methodologies to ensure the success and efficiency assigned projects. Provides support for critical operations related to acquisition, Navy ERP training, implementation and utilization. Education: BS or BA degree in a Business, Management or another business-related discipline. An AS or AA degree and an additional four (4) years of experience; OR an additional eight (8) years of experience may be substituted for a BS or BA degree. Required Experience: One (1) to Two (2) years of experience in a business or technical position providing programmatic or administrative support. Must demonstrate ability to utilize MS Excel for analysis and tracking.

Name: Financial Reporting Analyst
Description: ROLE:As a Financial Reporting Analyst, you will identify business intelligence, reporting, and data analysis needs. You will work closely with internal teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. You will provide data that is accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily available to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems. TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Work with customers (internal or external) to determine business requirements, priorities and define key performance indicators (KPI)Build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issuesDesign, and document dashboards, alerts, and reports either on a regular recurring basis or as neededConduct analyses of functional business processes and functional business requirements and participate in the development of business cases in the support of process changesMay perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platformsResearch business problems and create models that help analyze these business problemsCoordinate metrics with other teams in the division for consistency and correctnessEDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s degree Business or equivalent requiredMinimum five years as an analystAnalyzing and developing digital solutions addressing internal& external customer needsKNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:Proficiency in MS Office with advanced skills in Excel and AccessSQL ReportingStrong research skills and attention to detailStellar oral, written and interpersonal communication skillsAble to analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.Able to effectively collaborate with others to drive changeStrong team-oriented interpersonal skills including facilitation and the ability to effectively interface and work with a wide variety of people. Must work independentlyKnowledge of several business analysis techniques including, benchmarking, brainstorming, business rule analysis, data flow diagramming, data modeling, process modeling or deconstruction, metrics and key performance indicators, prototyping, risk analysis, root cause analysis, and/or scenario and use case developmentAble to multi-task is a fast paced environment and meet deadlinesPHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; to handle or feel; to talk and to hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk, sit, reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT: Standard office environment

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Peak-Ryzex is seeking a pro-active and detail-oriented Financial Analyst. This position serves as a member of the financial planning and analysis team to support reporting, budgeting, and forecasting activities for multiple companies' and currencies. Responsible for applying accounting principles and procedures to analyze financial information, and prepare accurate and timely financial reports and statements. Assists with financial and budget to actual variance analysis, oversees budget preparation, and assists with the annual financial audit.  This position will be located in our corporate office in Columbia, MD.  Essential Functions Prepares monthly financial reports to include profit and loss statements, balance sheet, statement of cash flow, margin analysis, and expense reporting.Completes variance analysis of financial changes, comparing actual results to prior, budget, and forecast.Participates in the annual strategic plan and budget cycle as well as the twelve month rolling forecast process.Assists with the administration of the reporting database and maintenance of company structure by working closely with accounting team to understand on-going changes and updates.Assists with financial audit schedule preparations.Provides analytical support to executive staff and department managers for purposes of understanding results and contemplating business changes.Responsible for establishing and maintaining effective and professional working relations, communication, and coordination with internal staff, co-workers, management and customers.Establishes and maintains good working relationships with all internal departments, peers, external customers and suppliers, to ensure cross-functional cooperation success. Requirements/Essential Qualifications Ability to:Demonstrate proficiency with Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Lotus Notes and the Internet, as well as other database systems.Work independently under limited supervision; solve problems involving differing situations, requiring creativity to search for solutions among learned and unlearned alternatives. Frequent analysis, independent judgment and discretion are required to determine appropriate courses of action.Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, including writing/developing processes and procedures. Ability to listen and disseminate information and communicate to customers and co-workers.Work effectively with employees at all levels of the organization, outside customers, and with the general public, including tolerance for constant interruptions.Manage a number of priorities simultaneously and meet deadlines.Collect, compile, and analyze information to develop recommendations.Be self directed and proactive, providing a high level of service to the department.Work cooperatively and foster teamwork by helping co-workers with essential functions.Perform the essential physical job functions.Work week may exceed 40 hours per week, as required.Education, Skills and Experience:Minimum of 2 years of business experience in an analytical/financial reporting or related role; must have financial reporting experience.Bachelor's Degree in Finance or Accounting highly preferred.SAP experience preferred.Must be able to demonstrate a high level of attention to detail and accuracy, be highly organized, and have ability to work independently, or with a team.Must have ability to identify and analyze concepts related to financial statements.Must be able to work under tight deadlines with minimal supervision.Must have excellent interpersonal skills, and demonstrate superb problem solving and troubleshooting skills.Must have a pro-active, self-driven, personality to investigate variances and anomalies in data.Must have strong analytical skills, and the ability to communicate to all levels of the company.SDL2017

Name: Threat Analyst
Description: Threat Analyst (IEWSD-18-1827-F)  Bowhead seeks a Threat Analyst III to support the IEWS-D at Aberdeen Proving Ground in Aberdeen, MD. The Threat Analyst III will identify and coordinates collection management opportunities for future threats within the Army Electronic Warfare Systems (EWS). Other responsibilities may include:Oversee all intelligence requests for information and brokers equities within the national intelligence production cycle.Conduct source research and analysis on the capabilities of threat emitters to attack or defeat Army EWS and their associated platforms.Coordinates directly with Joint Intelligence centers and ratifies discrepancies between national databases and theater orders of battle (OB). Requirements• Bachelor's Degree 4 years of relevant experience within the last 6 years. SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIRED: Must currently hold a security clearance at the Secret level. US Citizenship is a requirement for Secret clearance at this location.  Applicants may be subject to a pre-employment drug & alcohol screening and/or random drug screen, and must follow UIC's Non-DOT Drug & Alcohol Testing Program requirements. If the position requires, an applicant must pass a pre-employment criminal background history check. All post-secondary education listed on the applicant's resume/application may be subject to verification.  Where driving may be required or where a rental car must be obtained for business travel purposes, applicants must have a valid driver license for this position and will be subject to verification. In addition, the applicant must pass an in-house, online, driving course to be authorized to drive for company purposes.  UIC is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics EOE/AA/M/F/D/V. In furtherance, pursuant to The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act 43 U.S.C. Sec. 1601 et seq., and federal contractual requirements, UIC and its subsidiaries may legally grant certain preference in employment opportunities to UIC Shareholders and their Descendants, based on the provisions contained within The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act.  All candidates must apply online at www.uicalaska.com, and submit a completed application for all positions they wish to be considered. Once the employment application has been completed and submitted, any changes to the application after submission may not be reviewed. Please contact a UIC HR Recruiter if you have made a significant change to your application. In accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA), persons unable to complete an online application should contact UIC Human Resources for assistance (http://www.uicalaska.com/contact-us/human-resources/).  UIC Government Services (UICGS / Bowhead) provides innovative business solutions to federal and commercial customers in the areas of engineering, maintenance services, information technology, program support, logistics/base support, and procurement. Collectively, the fast-growing Bowhead Family of Companies offers a breadth of services which are performed with a focus on quality results. Headquartered in Alexandria, VA, we are a fast-growing, multi-million-dollar corporation recognized as one of the top 25 8(a) companies for government contracting.  ^ Cut/Paste this Link to Apply: https://rn21.ultipro.com/UKP1001/jobboard/NewCandidateExt.aspx?__JobID=21470 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here.The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c) Apply OnlineSend This Job to a Friend  © Ultimate SoftwareSDL2017

Name: Data Analyst - Frankfort KY
Description: Req ID: 26885 At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.  NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Data Analyst - Frankfort KY to join our team in Frankfort, Kentucky (US-KY), United States (US).  This candidate will be part of a team made up of Project Managers, Database and Web Developers, Data Modelers, DBAs, Business Analysts, Report Analysts, Technology Specialists, ETL Specialists and Security Specialists. This candidate will be working with customers gathering requirements for various projects; utilizing Optum’s project management methodology; creating detailed design specifications and then following the project through implementation.  Responsibilities include: Analyze entity relationship diagrams, file specifications, and physical or logical database data models to create detailed ETL mappings, Web API designs or business intelligence report specificationsPerform data analysis, data cleansing, test data creation, and data verification as part of design and testing activitiesCreate the testing documents and matrixes, and will be responsible for assisting the customer with user testingAssist the technical and business teams with project-related formal documentationMeet with users for clarification and elaboration as may be necessary to clearly define a problem and conceptualize a development plan Skills: Medicaid/Medicare or Healthcare industry experience (especially Kentucky Medicaid)Previous experience working with the Data Modelers and developers, facilitate modification of the logical design to create a physical design most suited to the reporting needs of the customerAbility to design applications taking into consideration data reconciliation (to the source system), query/reporting performance, and analytical business valueBusiness Analyst experience in a state government environmentMedicaid/Medicare or Healthcare industry experienceExperience with Data ProfilingExperience with Data Transformations and Data Cleansing Qualifications: 5+ years Data Analyst, Technical Business Analyst, Systems Analyst or Business Analyst experience preferably in a Data Warehouse project environment5+ years working with technical developers end users/customers to strategize solutions to align with business requirements4+ years analyzing database structures and developing detailed specifications for ETL, Web API, or reporting requirements5+ years working knowledge of relational databases/database structuresBachelor’s degree or equivalent work experienceThis position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.  NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.  NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. Name: Budget Analyst, Intermediate
Description: Budget Analyst, Intermediate Location Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD Status Full Time Date Posted 4/22/2017Job Summary: Budget Analyst, Intermediate, for Program Management and Engineering (PME) Services in support of the Program Executive Office for Command, Control and Communications Tactical (PEO C3T) and Subordinate PEO C3T OrganizationsDuties and Responsibilities: Performs a variety of budgetary functions implementing the organizations budgetary program, policies, and procedures. This includes analyzing and formulating program requirements; preparing, monitoring, justifying and defending budgets; tracking acquisition schedules and program milestone schedules; monitoring and tracking obligations and expenditures through the contract execution phase; initiating and tracking procurement and budget documentation throughout the procurement and budget cycles. Supports a wide variety of budgetary reports ranging from simple data calls to more complex work products. Manages budget and funding execution utilizing Standard Operation and Maintenance Army Research and Development System (SOMARDS), Logistics Management Program (LMP), and General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS); works in tandem with Program Analysts to balance budget and all funding requirements. Creates execution documents including Military Interdepartmental Purchase Requests (MIPRs), Procurement Work Directives (PWDs), and funding reports. Consolidates the accuracy of budget data estimates by the use of statistical techniques, e.g., extensions, averages, trend analysis of historical data. Monitors and tracks obligations and expenditures for assigned activity accounts on related budgetary forms, schedules, and reports. Verifies that obligations and expenditures occur on a timely basis in accordance with the annual work plan and regulatory controls, and are within amounts programmed. Resolves any discrepancies.Preferred Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Must be able to perform business and administrative planning, organizing, and coordinating actions to accomplish overall program objectives. Must have excellent communication skills, strong organizational skills and superior written/verbal communication skills. Must be able to process a variety of information, evaluate costs and benefits, and solve complex problems. Must be knowledgeable with office systems such as Microsoft Office.Additional Position Information: • Bachelor’s Degree - (Preferred) Accounting A minimum of five (5) years of related experienceFour (4) additional years of related experience may substitute for the Bachelor’s Degree requirement

and report findings to government consumers.Maintain direct dialogue with clients to clarify requests for information and coordinate results.Brief senior managers and policymakers on report findings, desired.Attributes:Superior written and verbal communication, interpersonal and relationship building skillsAbility to explain ideas and concepts in a clear and concise wayCapability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneouslyProfessional demeanorResults oriented with strong attention to detailStrong organizational, analytical, communication and problem-solving skillsAbility to interact with internal and external customersHigh ethical standardsFRDA is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to equal employment opportunities in recruitment, hiring, promotion, training, Name: 2019 Associate Operations Finance Analyst
Description: About Textron Systems: Harnessing agility and a broad base of expertise, Textron Systems’ innovative businesses design, manufacture, field and support comprehensive solutions that expand customer capabilities and deliver value. Textron Systems' businesses are industry-leading developers and integrators of unmanned systems, advanced marine craft, armored vehicles, intelligent battlefield and surveillance systems, geospatial management and analysis systems, intelligence software solutions, precision weapons, piston engines, test and training systems, and total lifecycle sustainment and operational services.About Textron: Textron is home to globally-recognized businesses, organized within five segments: Bell, Textron Aviation, Industrial, Textron Systems and Finance. Our businesses produce hundreds of products for customers around the world, in a range of industries spanning aerospace and defense, specialized vehicles, turf care, fuel systems, and tools and test equipment.
